Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find, this quiet Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Quirindi
Reviews.Content: The ambience is superb with its elegant decor and sense of history with its comfortable rooms named after historical leaders including Henri IV. We had a balcony room overlooking the peaceful nearby park, but only a stone's throw away are the bookshops, eateries, bars, supermart and a handy little food market just a block away where one could purchase cheeses and wine amongst other delicacies. Nearby attractions we visited were the Pantheon, Jardin du Luxembourg, Musee du Moyen Age, and it is also a short walk to the River Seine and Notre Dame La Grande. There are 2 or 3 Metros nearby to travel further afield. The people at Henri lV are lovely and very helpful -Unfortunately my partner and I on this trip (my 5th to Paris) had two occasions where the staff lent their invaluable assistance- we were unlucky to be robbed near Notre Dame and the staff helped us with police station and insurance applications. My partner later needed to see a dentist urgently and a choice of 2 nearby dental surgeries was found for us immediately! We loved Henri lV - it is a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Retreat”
Reviews.Author: HATLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in Paris. My mother had booked us into Henri IV for my 40th birthday present. What a find! It's brilliantly located right in the heart of the Latin Quarter but is tucked in a quiet corner so a lovely peaceful retreat after a long day marching the Paris streets. We were in a standard room on 6th Floor which was perfectly spacious and even had a bath and it's own private balcony overlooking the rooftops. The room has its own fridge, sink and hob so you can heat water to make a cup of tea in the morning. There is no kettle but a pan works just fine. The staff are very helpful and speak excellent English. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Five-Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: Perpetual-Motion1
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Residence Henri IV, with the last being about five or six years ago. How wonderful to report that nothing has changed...the rooms are still well maintained and clean, and the service is truly exceptional. Having had our luggage "delayed" by Air France, the various concierges on duty went above and beyond in helping track what was happening, and even made a call to Air France for us. When we requested anything be taken care of in our room, it was immediately done. We can't say enough good things about how well we were treated. We were two adults and two teens in one of the two-room apartments. My European standards, we had an excellent amount of space. It was lovely to have the large windows to open in both rooms with a view onto the park. The furnishings are well-worn antiques, but you do get the sense that you are staying in old Paris, which is lovely. There wasn't any dust anywhere despite the numerous picture frames and ledges in the room. The hotel offers complimentary WiFi which worked wonderfully. We did not partake in the continental breakfast, but did see it being delivered to the room next to us (there are only two rooms per floor, which makes things very quiet). Breakfast looked lovely, and you have the choice of it being offered in your room or in the breakfast room. Instead, we opted to go to nearby cafes for coffee (take-away is available), and picked up fresh fruit, pastries and juice at the nearby market. The hotel is very conveniently located between two Metro stations, and is about a 10 minute walk from the RER for St Michel-Notre Dame if you are coming in from the airport. Notre Dame, the river and the Latin District (with its numerous restaurant choices are all within a lovely walking distance) as is the Sorbonne and the Pantheon. At risk of not getting a room on my next stay, I must say I highly recommend this 3-star hotel, with its wonderful attention to service and its excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rive Gauche Boutique”
Reviews.Author: 007trader
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice (just finally got around to opening a trip advisor account). The hotel is ideally located and the staff is tremendously helpful. The rooms are quite spacious by Parisian standards and one of our rooms actually had a lovely balcony overlooking the park/school. You can easily walk to multiple metro stations and Notre Dame is just a short jaunt away. We've never tried the breakfast because we sleep late (or we go to the very conveniently Eric Kayser outpost located just one block away). Either way I'm sure you will enjoy your stay should you choose to stay at Henri IV

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Getaway”
Reviews.Author: spamboy
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Paris and I wanted a traditional hotel as it was my girlfriends first time in the city. This is perfect it is in walking distance from the centre of town with a major attraction nearby (Notre Dame) and a good night life (Latino Quarter). This place fits the bill perfectly, great attention to detail in an immaculate room, huge comfy bed decorated in a period style and free wifi. The staff were extremely friendly, and helped us with our French when we needed it. Plus being located in a cul-de-sac it was very quiet. I can not recommend this place enough, we will be back to see more of Paris and we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely friendly small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ilovefood123_12
Reviews.Content: I always like to stay in more traditional local hotels rather than the chain style large hotels that offer all manner of services that you never actually use. You are in Paris after all! The hotel staff greeted us politely, were happy to keep our luggage as we had arrived early in the morning. The kids were especially excited by the sweets in the jar at reception (they are easily pleased). The room was lovely, had everything that you could need. The bed was large and very comfortable and it was nice that the children were in a seprate room, albeit a sofa bed. We didn't make use of the kitchenette, we enjoy eating out too much. Very close to the Metro and a leisurely 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, via a Patisserie or two. The park next to the hotel is a bonus, where we all went for a quick read before heading out to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cdsailor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent a week in Paris. We enjoyed our hotel. The concierge, Hikam was always very helpful and courteous to us. The room was clean and the fridge was a bonus. The bathroom was very good with a lot of hot water and deep bathtub. Breakfast was good. The location of the hotel is excellent with Metro and bus 1 minute away. I would recommend this hotel to those who want a small and quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids too”
Reviews.Author: jaynegilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Henri IV with our 20-month-old son and it was perfect. The hotel is set in a quiet location but is still close to the main sights or metro links. Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter and the Jardin du Luxembourg are within easy walking distance. There is a small play park just outside the hotel and a Franiprix and pharmacy are steps away. The kitchenette is a great facility to have and the rooms are scrupulously clean. Best of all, the staff are welcoming and helpful. We did hear some noise from adjacent buildings but it did not disturb us. The full price room rates are quite high but we booked well in advance for a discount and you are staying in a fantastic location in the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but..”
Reviews.Author: n06
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews. My overall rating is average based on the price vs quality issue. It i a nice and clean hotel but i do believe it is pretty pricey for what it offers. The big problem is sound proof, you can here everything. I would not go back, but this is just my personal belief.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bongo_Craigy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place for my first visit to Paris. We were in the ground floor room next to the reception but had no problems with noise. The room was small but very nice and large enough for us - with Paris to explore we didn't spend much time in the room! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast - preferring to go the bakery for fresh cakes instead!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and location can not be beat”
Reviews.Author: 10000elle
Reviews.Content: Felt at home in this charming hotel. Spacious room lovely bed and bedding. Large bathtub The clean comfortable room. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: phantomAlabama
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed and superbly done. Very clean and the detail/period furnishings are what one would expect for hotels with more stars/higher prices. Truly a great find.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Gem”
Reviews.Author: KThang
Reviews.Content: My husband said that I shouldn't review this hotel because we don't want other people to find out about it. But I'm going to anyway because it is such a great find, it deserves to do well! If you want a charming, historical and typically Parisian hotel in the heart of St Germain, without paying a fortune this is the hotel for you. We spent three nights with our two teenage daughters in a four person room in January 2012 and were delighted. The room was a mini apartment, with the girls on a sofa bed (excellent quality sofa bed, I was concerned but shouldn't have been) and the main bedroom spearated by two internal doors. As with all older style Parisian hotels the rooms are fairly small, but the juliet balcony with a delightful view, quality bed linen, curtains and older style furniture made it utterly charming. While older in style, it is in excellent condition and well maintained. We were welcomed on arrival and every morning/evening with a cheery Bonjour Madame/Monsier. The staff helped with every question we had, looked up opening hours of museums and provided maps - couldn't have been more helpful. While we did out best to speak French, the staff do speak English. The small lounge on the ground floor was a nice place to sit and read the paper but with so many cafes and bistros nearby, we didn't use it often. Breakfast was a typically French affair bread, jam and a basket of divine pastries with freshly squeezed OJ, tea and coffee - a steal at just 8 euro per person and much better value than the 7 euro breakfast at the nearby cafe. Eggs are available is you want them for a little extra. The location is ideal - 3 minute to Maubert metro - although we walked everywhere, even to the Arc de Triumph which took an hour or so but was a beautiful walk. The tourist mecca of St Michel is a 10 minute walk (max) and full of restaurants. But St Germain itself is my favourite neighbourhood. We had a car and there is a garage 3 minutes walk away. However, we were lucky and scored a place in front of the hotel! Don't count on this though.. If you're after a modern 21st century hotel with computers in the lobby, room service and a gym - this is not for you. If you want a real Parisian experience in a charming neighbourhood - this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: UniTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Service - polite. Value - good for a quadruple room (2 adjoining bedrooms). Location - good. 5 mins walk to Maubert Mutualite station and 10 mins walk to Cluny Sorbonne RER (catch RER-B to CDG airport). Good location to explore the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame and the Marais District. Sleep Quality - excellent. Comfortable beds and quiet rooms. However, the 'queen bed' in the main bedroom is actually 2 single beds put together and the bed in the other room is a sofa bed. Not a major problem though. Rooms - excellent design throughout both rooms and bathroom. Very romantic feeling. Cleanliness - excellent. Travel tips - get your pastries from Eric Kayser, take them back to your room and eat them on the balcony (don't get coffee here though, it's not very good). Eat dinner at Le Hide (near the Arc but well worth the trip - make a booking the night before or on the day). If you want to be closer to the main sights, stay around the 1st district for a few nights - we booked an apartment on Rue St Honore from "Vacations in Paris" before staying here - very cheap, best location and the apartment was beyond fantastic. Overall impressions - it was a wonderful hotel to stay at for our last few days in Paris and Europe. Will definitely stay here again in the future. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: harizhuang
Reviews.Content: After staying in so many subpar places, it's refreshing to give such a positive review. The hotel was beautiful, the room was spacious, the location was perfect and most importantly, the staff was extremely helpful. We stayed for New Years and we were so busy that we hadn't booked anything. The staff made a big effort to arrange wonderful meals on both Dec. 30 and 31. The staff also helped arrange a reasonably priced and solid babysitter. The staff even pointed out how to save time in booking museums. He even pointed out where to go to catch the new years eifel tower viewing without going too far (just up at the Pantheon-- five minute walk). It was like having your personal travel consultant. The latin quarter location was perfect. There was so much to do just in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jjkin
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and comfortable hotel . Outstanding staff , the service is remarkable. Very good breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Great for family”
Reviews.Author: Teejaykay
Reviews.Content: This place really lives up to the good reviews others have written here. It's clean, spacious for the price, friendly, helpful, and ideally located. Staff were happy to provide an unusual international adaptor for our computer and to answer any questions. The kitchenette is very useful and the bathroom, in the room we had, a really decent size. Plenty of bookshops nearby if you like that side of Paris -- lots of eating places, boulangeries etc. It's set slightly back from the street on a "dead end", so you're not looking right out over traffic. Excellent if you want two separate sleeping rooms so a child can settle at night without disturbance (there are several rooms like this). Thanks to all at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayJay252
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last year and whilst not 5 star calibre, it is very comfortable for the price. The receptionists were always friendly and courteous which is rare from my experience of Parisian hotels. The best feature was a small kitchenette in the room, allowing us to make our own lunches and saving a small fortune in the process. It is well positioned and has a brilliant patisserie within 3 minutes walking distance. Highly recommended but beware Paris in February....brrrrrrrr!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for city trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: FamFransen188580
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the weekend and meet a very cosy clean and friendly hotel. As rooms are normally tiny in Paris we now met the exception of the rule. A room where you can turn around without reaching the walls. The bathroom in our room was very clean and consisted of a sink, toilet and bath. Noise reduction also ok with closed windows. Location very central within a 5 minutes walk from Metro Maubert Mutualite. Restaurants on the Rue Mouffetard also a 5 minutes walk. Perfect location and value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: Amie M
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here on our honeymoon, in one of the apartments. It was lovely - like having your own little flat in Paris. Breakfast was included in our rate and was v nice, but you could find cheaper nearby (would have cost â‚¬8) if it wasn't. Well situated next to lots of lovely food shops and they have a food/clothes market just up the street on a Tues 9-2.30pm. Excellent for getting supplies to have in your room! Located near metro stops and some very nice restaurants too (would recommend Chez Rene).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable professional hotel with period touches”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a street mentioned in Victor Hugo's Hunchback of Notre Dame. It is near churches, a market, and excellent take home food cafes as well as near metro and bus transport. Each room is named after a historic french person and has period features. Ours had a lovely sitting room with table, a tiny kitchenette, good for heating up food or cooking breakfast (no tea or coffee making equipment and not really suitable for cooking a dinner party) , large balcony doors from which you can watch the street go by, a lovely bathroom and a gorgeous peacefull bedroom. As per other reviews the front desk was always there, always couteous and always helpful. This hotel is a pleasure to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: This is an average, accurately rated 3 star hotel. My room was very large by Paris standards. It had an old rustic period feel, which is what was intended. The housekeeping was touch and go. The bathroom mirror was not cleaned daily. On one day, the sheets were not straightened. The blankets were simply pulled over them. The toilettries were not replenished every day. I even had a bakery item mysteriously disappear from my refrigerator. There was a problem with the lighting in the stairwell. The small elevator lift was also temporarily out of order. All said, the highest regards go to Hicham. He was extremely kind, helpful and professional!

Reviews.Title: “Latin quarter jewel”
Reviews.Author: davis22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the hotel in late May. The location is in the heart of the Latin quarter very close to bakeries, metro stops and wonderful sights. We booked a superior room which was actually a small suite consisting of separate bedroom and living room with a small balcony overlooking a park. Breakfast was served in the basement and was of the basic continental variety. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations. We bought 10 packs of metro tickets and used the subway to easily move around Paris. We also purchased museum passes which allowed access to multiple venues including the Louvre, Pompidou Centre, Versailles, Musee du Cluny, Musee Rodin, etc. We enjoyed a walking tour of "Revolutionary Paris" hosted by paris walks. A day trip to the Loire valley visiting 3 different castles was a nice break from Paris. Restaurant highlights included Les Bouquinistes, Le Bistrot de L'Universite, Lilane and Spring (owned by an american). Berthillon for ice cream. One disappointing dinner was L'Epi Dupin, cramped tables and abrupt service for average food. We enjoyed snacking at any of the numerous bakeries and street carts that we found wandering the city. A boat tour along the Seine (particularly at dusk) and a visit to the Eiffel tower at night we quite memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quiet place in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa1009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay in Room 60 (Francois Villon). The room was small but not unusual for Paris, and it seemed a bit larger with the artful use of mirrors. We had a small balcony that overlooked the small park. The bathroom was also on the small side but well laid out. There is a shower over a tub and a shower curtain (so you have ample place to take a shower and no wet floors, unlike other hotels we've stayed at). The free wifi worked well in the room. The hotel is in a great location in the Latin Quarter just a few blocks from the Seine but since it's in a cul de sac it was very quiet. We slept very comfortably. The breakfast was extra but was a good value. There is a kitchenette in the room so you can store your food and cook but we did not use it. We highly recommend this hotel and would go back to stay here when we go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Earned its high score”
Reviews.Author: ABD119
Reviews.Content: It's not only the location, in the heart of the Latin Quarter, surrounded with excellent restaurants and nightlife. It's simply great. Rooms are Parisienly generous in size. Staff is excellent. Don't come to breakfast with high expectations. The croissant anywhere outside is much more fresh. Price is high but it's definitely a place to come back to

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: We had such a great experience here. We loved the location within the city and that it was at the end of a dead end street. The decor is tasteful, not overdone. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A small but delightful respite.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely all round - just a little overpriced...”
Reviews.Author: Rachael K
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I finished our interrailing adventure at this hotel and what a wonderful way to finish it. The area was incredibly handy, being about 10 mins from Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. On our arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful, and called us in our room to ask if we wanted breakfast in our room, which we agreed to. The room was very nicely decorated, although a little pokier than the pictures on the website, which led me to think it may be slightly misleading..... Prior to our arrival I requested a balcony which they said although they couldn't promise anything, they did give us, which I thought was excellent service. Although it was an extremely pleasant stay, I don't think I could justify paying Â£200 for the room, and then breakfast on top of that as well! It seemed more around the Â£150 mark for me. But overall, very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The quality continues at Residence Henri 4 . . .”
Reviews.Author: JosephinePS
Reviews.Content: After staying at his hotel in the Latin Quarter last Christmas, I again chose to stay there in September. The quality of the service remains consistent - fantastic service prior to arrival by making restaurant bookings as requested and organising transfers. A warm welcome when I arrived and lovely room with balcony provided. Service extras included leaving purchases at the hotel while I travelled further afield, explicit details of how to get to various destinations and champagne being put on ice ready for my return. It is, indeed, an excellent hotel, beautifully furnished in French style with a great service ethic. Delighted to tell my friends about it, have them stay there too and rate it as highly as me. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel Hidden away”
Reviews.Author: DavsueWestYorks
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel. Really nice hotel in an excellant position close to major attractions with easy access to the Metro. We booked the hotel on recommendations from this site and to be honest most are true. What you do need to remember, this is a small 13 Bedroom 3 star Hotel. It does punch above its weight, however its not got the facilities of the larger 4 star plus Hotels. The rooms were large and well kept and the staff were really helpful including allowing us to check in early on our first day. The hotel is in a quite location at the end of a road so road noise not much of a problem. We did have some issues with noise from floor boards of the room above, but this is an old hotel and creaking floor boards are part of the charm, would have helped if it wasnt 2am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Merci, Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: jman965765
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here on our honeymoon. HRH IV is in a good location - near 2 metro stops, also close to the Pantheon, the Sorbonne and the Museum Cluny / Moyen Age. The staff was small, but pleasant. Ditto for the room. The room itself was clean and came with a nice little kitchenette. Only complaint here was the bed itself. I think it may have been one of Henry IV's actual beds - that's how old and saggy it felt. Pretty terrible. Other than that, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret Z
Reviews.Content: From the moment my husband & I stepped into the hotel we were greeted with warmth and friendliness by the extremely helpful young man on the reception desk. Nothing was too much trouble for him, and he offered to arrange our transport to the airport for the following day. We were in room no.1 on the ground floor which was very welcome due to our large, heavy suitcases. The room was large by Paris standards, beautifully furnished and very clean. The bed was enormous and extremely comfortable. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many major attractions, eg. Pantheon, Notre Dame, St Chapelle, etc. Breakfast was very good and we were served by the same young man that had been on reception when we checked in. Again he was friendly and helpful. My only regret is that our stay was very short. I would definitely stay at this hotel when in Paris again. Perfect for couples.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: rebecca91769
Reviews.Content: I am continuing my European sightseeing tour, and now my destination is France. I fell in love with Paris, but bear in mind that it is a city that wants a lot of money. Residence Henri 4 hotel is a charming, very cozy hotel with lovely people working there. Before my arrival, I called the hotel several times with a lot of questions, because it was my first time in Paris, and I was obsessed with everything being perfect. All my questions were resolved professionally and very quickly. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Delight”
Reviews.Author: pammft
Reviews.Content: This is a little boutique hotel on the end of a fairly quiet street. I say "fairly" because the gothic church a block away rang its bells several times a day and there are the ever present police car sirens in Paris. The location is very good, a pleasant walk away from Notre Dame and Ille de St. Louis. Many shops, restaurants and a busy night life Latin Quarter a few blocks away. Since the hotel is near the Sorbonne, lots of bookstores and students in the area. The staff, especially Hicham, are very pleasant, helpful and courteous. Hicham helped us find quaint restaurants, fix our problem with a shuttle service to the airport, and sent up tea and kind wishes when my husband was ill for the day. The rooms themselves are well appointed, comfortably sized, with nice bathrooms with tubs and showers. There is a small kitchenette with a small fridge and cookstove, microwave. We made more than one meal in our Paris kitchen. The hotel also offers a very nice breakfast of wonderful pastries, juice and coffee for a reasonable price each morning. The "farmer's market" two blocks away was a great place to pick up fresh fruit, vegetables, bread, cheeses, wine, etc. for your own french cooking. Our room had two twin beds side by side, which ended up being a perfect way for my husband to have enough room (he is tall and big by most European bed standards) to sleep comfortably for the 9 nights we stayed there. An added benefit: the air conditioning works well!

Reviews.Title: “Pete & Glor Queensland”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August after reading wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor and found they weren't exaggerated! It was an excellent small boutique hotel. The 24 hour reception service was the best I've ever experienced. The staff so pleasant at all times & couldn't have been more helpful. The location was ideal, we could walk to a lot of the attractions & there was also a bus stop just across the street. The mini kitchenette was really great, especially with the superette and excellent patisserie so close. Book a room with a balcony, although small, we did enjoy sitting outside with a glass of wine. The hotel interior is a credit to its owners. We would love to return one day for an extended stay & if we are lucky enough to do so, won't bother to look anywhere else. Our highest recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and charm”
Reviews.Author: garcher34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 11 nights in late August, early September and found this hotel to be a real gem in a very convenient and atmospheric part of Paris. Our room, together with the bathroom, were of a good size by Paris standards. The queen size four poster bed added to the ambiance. The front desk staff available 24 hours a day, were courteous and helpful. Hicham was particulary resourceful as he assisted with a computer issue, provided a frying pan to supplement the somewhat limited cooking utensils and was able to organise a dental appointment the day after I broke a tooth. The location of the hotel is a small cul de sac is very quiet and convenient with a vibrant twice weekly street market above the nearby Metro station, small supermarkets and patisseries close by. It was possible to walk from the hotel to so many of the major tourist sites. We will always remember the wonderful sound of the bells of St. Nicolas du Chardonnet and dinners at Le Comptoir du Pantheon. On our next visit to Paris we will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel, but it could be better!”
Reviews.Author: OnceBittenMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of a friend and the amazingly positive reviews on Trip Advisor. On arrival, the staff member at reception was friendly and very helpful, and directed us to the (smallish) elevator to our room upstairs. Our room was clean and for Paris, reasonably spacious, and quiet too, considering the busy streets not far away. WiFi was included in the tariff and worked well. There was a small kitchen with a sink, dual hotplate, microwave, a selection of dishes and glassware, washing up liquid and scourer. But - there was no electric jug, and no tea/coffee making facilties, and no tea-towel. As a couple who needs a cuppa when we wake, this was a catastrophe! I'm sure the staff would have provided us with tea had we asked but at this price level it should be a "given!" Other than this minor criticism, this is a well-situated hotel with very helpful staff but we do recommend it and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “sweet place, sweet staff”
Reviews.Author: montonefan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a recent weekend stop-over in Paris, and we were very pleased with our experience at this character filled, small residence-hotel in a fine location. Our rooms were big enough and charming, and the front desk staff were very helpful and pleased to help (thanks Isham). I would recommend this hotel without hesitation, and we plan to return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel full of charm and character and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tezza786
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel full of Parisian charm and wonderful service. Our Suite was larger than expected and beautifully decorated. The balcony and red geraniums were icing on the cake. This small hotel is in a great location and the staff are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Suite with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BruPete
Reviews.Content: This was our base for a wonderful 10 days in Paris. Within easy walking distance to Notre Dame, Luxemburg Gardens, Pantheon, and many good restaurants including Eric Kayser's fabulous Bakerie. Our 2 room suite with a kitchenette was roomy for 2 of us and could easily have fit one or 2 children. We also enjoyed our small balcony to soak up the sounds and smells of Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary - Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: PhiletJac
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to all of our expectations and its reception staff were exceptionally welcoming and helpful. Our room was quiet, very clean, functional with a small kitchenette and fridge and with its small balcony set into the roof, also full of character. The hotel is well situated for the Pantheon and Notre Dame with its quiet cul de sac location providing a break from the crowds and traffic found elsewhere. We are looking forward to returning in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful haven in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Karen808
Reviews.Content: Beautifully furnished and decorated small hotel in quiet side street in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Standard room but spacious with a kitchenette (no kettle but saucepan or microwave) and 4 poster bed. Windows cut out all traffic noise. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast in basement beautifully painted like the cellar of a chateau. Booked through booking.com and got a very good deal, otherwise quite pricey for us, but maybe not for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet and funky”
Reviews.Author: StockbrokerCharlotte
Reviews.Content: Family of five stayed two nights at this quaint 13 room hotel. Reminded me of a "pre war" building in NYC. Ornate, solid walls and doors, small kitchen in the rooms. Perfectly acceptable and fun. Close to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. Wish we could stayed another night! A highlight was the American Diner one block away where we ate pancakes, bacon and eggs for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Gave us many wonderful Paris memories.”
Reviews.Author: johndhenry
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed 4 nights. Great location/short walking distance to most every sight (several gourmet food shops located 2 min away). Situated on small cul-de-sac across from a park and so street noise is not too intrusive. No wait time at check-in and everything was efficient and in order. Hotel common areas and room were very clean and nicely furnished. Staff were extremely courteous in all interactions and both assisted in transporting our luggage to our room (elevator and stairs), and thoroughly explained hotel/room facilitates. The room itself was charming - elegant plaster work, antique reproductions, French windows (which opened to views of the park), flower boxes, etc. Two sets of drapes which effectively keep the light out for jet-lagged travelers and walls thick enough to silence any sound from neighbors. One bed in one room and pull out sofa in the other â€“ both beds sleep two adults or 3 children each (mattresses were new and very firm which I like). Rooms have doors so our children could sleep whilst we enjoyed late night glass of wine without disturbing them. Small kitchenette with two burners, sink, and small fridge OK for small snacks (we ate out and so only used the fridge). Bathroom was typically small but entirely covered in marble and very clean. Housekeeping was timely and efficient during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy operation in the heart of Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Suchanpeterson
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for two entire weeks at this hotel and got to know this area of the Latin Quarter very well. Overall, our stay was absolutely perfect! The staff was very professional and friendly, and they helped us in every way possible. They made us feel very comfortable during our entire stay. All staff members speak English very well but humored me as I insisted on practicing my French. Rooms are a nice size by Paris standards - our suite included a queen/full bed in the bedroom and a full size sofa pull-out which was always made up when we returned to the room in the late afternoon/evenings. Beds and pillows are very comfortable - I had 14 good nights of sleep! The kitchenette is very small, but we managed to make a few simple meals like pasta and ratatouille. Breakfast was from Eric Kayser bakery most mornings. The bathroom is very nice and is equipped with a good hair dryer and nice toiletries. The hotel is well situated in the Latin Quarter - within easy walking distance to nightlife but far enough to be quiet for a good sleep. There are many, many good food choices in the area, from "street" food (crepes, sandwiches) to good quality ethnic and French food to grocery stores and all the "-erie" shops: fromageries, boulangeries, patisseries, charcuteries, epiceries. Place Maubert (location of the nearest metro stop to the hotel) is full of take-it-and-go eateries and a nice outdoor market that runs on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday mornings. Our fav restaurants in the area include the Comptoir du Pantheon (near the Pantheon), Pema Thang (Tibetan restaurant), Kim Lien (Vietnamese), and the very accessible Pizza Roma, which makes a great antipasto and quatre saisons (four seasons) pizza. Across the street from the hotel is a nice park (Paul Langevin) with playground equipment. My daughter enjoyed decompressing there after a day of touring and enjoyed feeding the pigeons. The only downside to this little hotel is the lack of laundry facilities. We like to pack lightly and wash as we go, but we had to use a laverie nearby, which was very expensive (15 euros to wash and dry three pairs of jeans!) So, pack enough clothes if you stay in Paris. In summary, we would stay here again in a heartbeat! This is a very classy, boutique hotel that has more charm and personal service than any large hotel. This is a gem that I wish I had found the first several times I visited Paris. I would be happy to answer any questions about the hotel or about the area around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet, would return”
Reviews.Author: georanger
Reviews.Content: Met all our Paris needs - walking distance to sights, museums but far enough away for local shops and people, quiet air-conditioned room with small balcony to sit and enjoy wine with roof top views, fridge to cool the wine, bathtub/shower, and friendly/ helpful reception staff. Room was smallish but that is the norm.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: geordieboy58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Residence Henri IV for four nights in June, as part of a world trip. The hotel is full of character, the staff at reception were knowledgeable, helpful, courteous and above all, most pleasant and full of real French character. Hicham, the concierge with whom we had the most face to face contact, is a concierge 'tres exceptionelle'. We enjoyed our breakfast on our little balcony overlooking Paris each morning, as well as the decor of our room. Having a small kitchenette was a great asset. The hotel is very well located for tourists who wish to get around Paris on foot. When we return to Paris our hotel choice has already been made.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: joedrums1028
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel by researching our 2011 trip to Paris on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The suites are gorgeous, with beautiful interiors. Located next to a park where lots of well mannered children are playing. Rue St. germain de Pres is a block away, near Ile de la Cite, near the metro. Cheese, wine and green grocer stores are one block away - and that is a good option because these well-decorated suites also come with a kitchenette with utensils, pans and plates for light cooking. The staff kindly and generously spoke english to me and french with my french speaking wife, provided us an electrical adapter so I could recharge my blackberry every night, ice and a bucket for my champagne purchases. Continental breakfast and coffee were excellent. Good shower/bath combo. Really, everything we wanted; and we will be back. Oh, and by the way, my wife left her jacket at the hotel and we didnt realize it until we returned to the States. I emailed the staff, and within 24 hours staff had responded with a proposal to send the jacket back with a reasonable charge (for express delivery - no upcharge) to my credit card on file. All taken care of. First class.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a charming hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: KateLondon_9
Reviews.Content: I was extremely excited about staying in the Hotel Residence Henri 4 as the reviews on Tripadvisor are excellent - especially as this rates as number 21 in Paris, which is amazing considering how many wonderful hotels there are in the city. However, I was a little disappointed and the hotel didn't live up to my expectations. Don't get me wrong, it was charming and the hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. However, I had my heart set on a room with a balcony and I think we got the only room without one - we had the room on the ground floor, which was pretty much in the reception area. The room itself was very nicely decorated and very clean. I don't think the hotel offered value for money - we paid 220 euros for one night, which I think was very expensive for what I thought was not an exceptional hotel. I have stayed in much nicer and cheaper hotels in Paris. Unlike all the other Tripadisor reviewers, I don't think I will rush back here. Perhaps if the room was 50 euros cheaper my review would've been a little kinder.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: penelopeg87
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, clean, charming decoration, quiet, small and sophisticated, loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “very nice location and room for 3”
Reviews.Author: emelle280
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week + on special trip to Paris with DD and her childhood friend, both of whom had recently graduated from college in the US. Requested and got a two room suite with a balcony overlooking the park. The bedroom bed was separated for us and we thus had two twin beds in the bedroom and a foldout sofa (which the hotel made into a bed for us) in the salon. Still had room to move, unlike some other Paris hotels. A small refrigerator, microwave and two surface burners (plates, cups, wine glasses and two cereal/salad bowls with odd lot stainless flatwear for 4) and a small pot were in the small kitchen area. Bathroom had all facilities in one room. The hotel was clean and quiet, good matresses and pillows. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel breakfast room, opting instead to buy bread, cheese, fruit, etc from local bakery (Kyzer is just a block or two away) and the markets/local stores. Easy access to buses and metro. The staff were polite, very helpful and while I spoke French with them, their English was exceptional when needed. The neighborhood felt safe with a park across the street and many locals, including children going to and fro. Since the hotel is at the end/dead end of the rue des Bernadins, essentially none of the several taxis we took knew exactly where to turn or stop on the rue des ecoles when returning to the hotel....but after the first time this happened, we were prepared and could direct the drivers where to stop with only a short walk from the corner of the main street. I would stay here again when in Paris, if I did not rent and apartment or need to stay elsewhere for other reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: lee-lee50_11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old hotel in Latin Quarter. Gorgeous room. Front desk staff spoke very good English which was a bonus. Open 24 hours. Very helpful. Walking distance to Notre Dame and Metro. Lots of restaurants close by to choose from. Small kitchenette in room was helpful for making our own breakfast - basic but had the essentials. Quiet area. A little on the expensive side but it is Paris after all. Free Wi Fi, Wil definitely recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay - We hope to come back again.”
Reviews.Author: drumr0ll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a second honeymoon. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The location was superb - close to everything. Even the neighborhood around the hotel was wonderful to explore. Our room was the nicest room I've ever had in Paris. This is now our hotel of choice - We are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: BruceHall
Reviews.Content: We had an idyllic five days at Henri IV earlier this month, in the suite of the same name. The hotel is tranquil, comfortable and secure and the front-desk staff, led by Hicham, made us hugely welcome. Thanks also to the long-serving housekeeper, Sagaya, who looked after our room perfectly. The hotel is well situated, with a vast selection of bistros within a few minutes' walk. It would be our first choice of accommodation on our next visit. Thank you, everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Dreamin11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights celebrating our 20th anniversary. The room was beautiful, great location and the staff were very helpful and made you feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and rooms for our family of 4.”
Reviews.Author: MassMommy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults, girls aged 10 and 14) spent 4 nights here in April. We loved it- the rooms were great- but the staff and location made the trip. The location was ideal- on the end of avstreet, so it was quiet, but completely walkable to Ile St Louis, Ile de la Cite, and the rest of the Latin Quarter. The staff was unobtrusive, but went out of their way to help us when we needed it- I would absolutely stay their again ot recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming little hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: emcm2011
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in Residence Henri IV after seeing the wonderful reviews on trip advisor and then looking on the Hotel's own website. We availed of a sale on the website so got very good value. The hotel didn't disappoint in anyway. The hotel is small, charming and very Parisian. It is full of character and each room has its own individual name and style. The location couldn't be better right in the heart of the Latin Quarter minutes walk from Notre Damn and numerous shops, bars and restarants. It is also very near The Pantheon and Jardins de Luxemburg. If you wish to go further afield there is a metro and RER station only 5 minutes stroll. Having said this the way the hotel in situation on a side street across from a quaint little park there is no night time noise and we slept without interruption every night. The staff are wonderful and friendly full of advise and help if you need it and very happy to give directions, maps etc. I would definitely visit this hotel again if I was visiting Paris again. It is a wonderful calm Oasis in a lively city !

Reviews.Title: “We loved our Paris apartment!”
Reviews.Author: ckc5710
Reviews.Content: We (my two teenage daughters and I) stayed in a chambre superieure for 3 nights last week. I had booked on the basis of the very positive Tripadvisor reviews, which indicated that this hotel was just what we were looking for. We were as delighted with our choice as other reviewers have been. I booked through the hotel's own website - their special Spring promotion appeared to offer good value for the 3 of us. I received an e-mail acknowledgement from the hotel staff by return - very reassuring and efficient! In fact, from the moment we arrived and throughout our stay, the concierge team were always extremely courteous and ready to help. We loved our rooms - exactly as shown in the photos on the hotel website. Clean and comfortable with double bedroom, sitting room made up with sofa bed, good-sized bathroom, kitchenette and 2 tiny, delightful balconies. The kitchenette was such an asset and we made good use of it by shopping locally (rue Monge and rue Mouffetard) for provisions to put together our own meals. It felt like having our own apartment in a lovely part of the city. Having enjoyed our time in Paris so much, we are hoping to return very soon. If we can book another of this hotel's special promotions, we would not think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel a stone's throw from Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: Sandradesplaines
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply charming. Each room was decorated beautifully in a old french provencial style. The rooms had every modern accomodation and the view from the little balcony was so nice. It was a 3-4 block (5 min.) walk to Notre Dame. Close to the metro and fromageries, boulangeries, wine shops, etc. were nearby. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was a quiet, understated, yet elegant hotel. It only had about 10 rooms with a tiny elevator. With only 5 floors we used the spiral staircase mostly and reserved the elevator for the luggage and was also used by the children's grandfather who uses a cane. We travelled with a 9 and 12 yr old and had a room with a pull out and separate bedroom for the kids. The pullout was large and extremely comfortable. It also had a small kitchenette. One night a cat walked into the room from the balcony and visited a while. He was gone in the morning. This was a charming hotel away from all the tourist mayhem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable accomodations, & awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: cassadytl
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect; 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, 5 minutes to the metro, 5 minutes or less to exchange bank and fresh pastries and 1 minute to ATM. The staff was extremely accomodating even prior to our arrival, spoke perfect english (for those of us challenged with French it was a Godsend!) and geniunely left you feeling like they enjoyed helping you. The rooms were very comfortable with quite adequate space (especially by Paris standards) We slept 3 very comfortably. Several restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk near the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: diane_SanFrancisc0
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 days over Christmas in this little gem of a hotel and loved it! 2 rooms with tiny kitchenette was adequate for relaxing during the storms and had old building charm as shown on the web site. Bathroom not glamorous but clean and worked fine. Staff was friendly, but limited english. Breakfast was French and delicious. Loved the neighborhood behind the Technical College of the Sorbonne.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful, unpretentious little hotel, full of character, in easy walking distance for bustling city life”
Reviews.Author: Papillon032
Reviews.Content: My family and I hit the jackpot with this delightful boutique hotel. We particularly liked the fact that it was down a very quiet cul-de-sac, very close to Notre Dame Cathedral and the University. The rooms were well maintained and beautifully decorated with flaymboyant antique French furnishings. We took two rooms on the first night, a double and a twin which were very comfortable, although one was a little smokey (to be expected on the continent). The rest of the time, we all stayed in an apartment/suite - capitalising on a winter discount offer. This was more than adequate for our 6ft teenage son and 10 year old daughter - the sofa bed was very substantial and comfortable with a TV in both the lounge area and bedroom. Our bedroom in the unit was very decadent and the bed, large with a fairly new mattress. However, for our transatlantic neighbours, it is worth noting that the apartments are not huge, not by American standards. There is a little kitchenette with a fridge full of drinks for purchase and a saucepan, tea cups and plates if you want to boil water for tea etc. Great restaurants near the university, head for Rue Mange where you'll find a number of snack bars, cafes and interesting eateries,. near by. We didn't bother with the breakfast at the hotel as there were a variety of fine boulangeries around the corner, our favourite being Eric Kayser cafe with the boulangerie next door but one if you fancy a top up of patisseries. In all, we walked 50 miles throughout our 5 day visit, hopping in the occasional taxi and train. The kids gave the whole experience 11 out of 10. Recommended for a true Paris experience without breaking the piggy bank.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Dylan2011
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this amazing hotel while on a vacation in Paris! We LOVED everything about it. The concierge desk was so helpful, the room was beautiful, the breakfast was delicious, and the location was perfect. It is about a 3 minute walk to Notre Dame. Don't hesitate just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Paris highlight - great place and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: RodgerMajestic
Reviews.Content: As this was for our honeymoon we were looking for something very parisian and memorable - we got it in spades. This was a very quaint hotel - full of charm rather than modern tricks. Great location, only few minutes walk from Notre Dame and access to metro and batobus boat trip etc this was a great base for exploring for this romantic city. Staff couldn't have been more helpful, very pleasent and made our stay very comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fabulous location, friendly & helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelbug255093
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel, stayed 4 nights with my daughter. we could hear the bells of Notre Dame from our room and it was so easy to get places from here. we could walk or catch the metro. love the metro, so so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Our Paris Address”
Reviews.Author: Craigtown
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago we knew what to expect â€“ Understated comfort and warmth of service, however on our return we found that not only did the lovely hotel live up to our expectations it exceeded them with the introduction of free wi fi in all areas of the hotel. We were only really passing through on our way to Rome and were leaving about 15 hours after we arrived but in between we felt relaxed and at home in the Henri IV. The location is excellent for both the bars and restaurants in the latin quarter and is within walking distance to Notre Dame. For anything further away the Maubert Mutalitie metro stop is about 5 mins walk away and can quickly link you to all other areas of Paris. We did not eat at the hotel as we bought our breakfast a t the always excellent Eric Kayser Boulangerie in one of the neighbouring streets, but if we had been staying for longer we would have brought more food in and made use of the excellent kitchenette in our room. All things considered the standard is still high at this property and we will be staying there again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly and helpful staff. Book it!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBlair
Reviews.Content: The location is walking distance to the Metro, Bus stops, Notre Dame, many great restaurants. It is a smaller type hotel but friendly service as though you are staying in the states!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with love to details”
Reviews.Author: spyder2003
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time! Comfortable rooms with beautiful furniture... The service with breakfast in bed is great... we would definetly come back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Happyfliers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at the Hotel Residence Henri 4. We wanted to stay in a "French" type hotel which was close to everything. The room was perfect, the bed comfortable. The hotel has a elevator which made a difference when we had been walking all day and our room was on the 4 floor!! We were able to walk from the hotel to Notra Dame and onto Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. We had breakfast the first morning in the hotel which was Continental as the hot breakfast was not till 8am and we wanted to be on the road early. I think they should have a mircowave so you can warm up the bread. The staff were very helpful with letting us know how to get the bus or train. Supplied us with a map and order tickets to Moulin Rouge for us. All in all, I was very pleased with the our stay here and I would stay with them again for sure. The only negative I would say is the thin wall, which I am sure you would get anywhere!! I also think it would be a nice idea if they had tea/coffee available in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look further as this hotel has got it all - service, location, ambience”
Reviews.Author: JosephinePS
Reviews.Content: Any queries I sent to the hotel prior to arriving were answered promptly and informatively - a very good sign. I was greeted on my arrival by name and this courtesy was continued throughout my stay. My room was beautiful, furnished comfortably in the French style - truly a home away from home. Many of the major museums and churches were well within walking distance, and the range of bistros and restaurants in the area was fantastic, ranging from upmarket to really reasonable. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful concierge, great location”
Reviews.Author: Europhile-B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked into a corner of a short side-street. It is lovely and quiet. It is within easy walking distance to the ile de la citÃ© area, a nice market, and other points along the way. The rooms are just what you want in a boutique hotel--quaint and with a nice, long tub for relaxing after all that walking, because when you're in Paris, walking is what you want to do. What makes this small hotel really stand out, though, is the lovely concierge who was friendly and helpful. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: elderc
Reviews.Content: The thing I like the most in this hotel is that it is located between the Quartier Latin and the Notre Dame. This means that one can have easy access on foot to many places and to the rest of Paris with just a few minutes on the subway. Also, this hotel is on a charming 19th century building, it is tiny and silent and it even has an elevator. My room had a little kitchen and a well-sized bathroom. The staff was always attentive, I have no drawbacks about this property and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superbe!”
Reviews.Author: normajNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Residence Henri IV, and I was extremely impressed with it. I loved my "chambre superieure," because it was like having a small apartment in the center of Paris. I had two lovely rooms, both featuring beautiful moldings and lovely fireplaces. In addition, I had a large bathroom and a "coin cuisine," so it was like having a small apartment. The service is extremely attentive, the rooms spotless and the location quiet. What could be better? I really enjoyed my stay, and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PhDTigress
Reviews.Content: I travel to Paris often, and this hotel is simply the best. Centrally located, quiet, charming and beautifully decorated, the Henri IV provides a true Parisian experience. The superior rooms are very spacious and the kitchenette in each room is a wonderful addition. The staff is courteous, professional and makes you feel at home. The value for your money, especially during the hotel's seasonal sales, simply cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Far more than a basic weekend-stay hotel; great character, great location.”
Reviews.Author: CapitalP
Reviews.Content: We searched for winter deals and found this hotel. Four of us stayed in one of the hotel's apartments (with two single beds and one double sofa bed) and although it was quite small, it was the perfect size for us as we didn't spend much time in the hotel. If we had been in Paris in the summer we would have used the balconies (which are very cute and great for having breakfast in the morning). We just popped downstairs and picked up croissants and pastries from a shop around the corner for breakfast on the run instead. There are great details in the hotel (like the gorgeous spiral staircase) which gives it something special and it is a very short walk from the Notre Dame, some cool bars and the Metro. We were looking for a hotel with some Parisian character that was still inexpensive and in a great location - this was a great bargain and a very good find.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant little hotel on the edge of the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: theskin
Reviews.Content: A beautiful little boutique hotel that has retained it's charm while remaining very comfortable. An easy walk down the hill to the Latin Quarter makes this a great little spot for a weekend in Paris

Reviews.Title: “A Superb welcome and Excellent Quality”
Reviews.Author: EurofLLantrisant
Reviews.Content: Yet again the reviews in Tripadvisor surpass themselves! This Hotel is absolutely superb. At first we were disappointed to be on the ground floor with no small charming wine slurping balcony, however the large size and extra comfortable chaize longe more than made up for the latter. My wife had been dubious of having a kitchenette in the room but this was a godsend- Cold Chablis in the fridge and we could breakfast on fresh granary baguettes ( from round the corner) and framboise jam with our tea or coffee, on the small but ever so decorative glass table! We met 4 different people on reception and they were all genuiely helpul and full of local knowledge. The location is superb for the Latin Quarter and indeed we walked to th Louvre along the banks of the Seine in the Autumn sun. We will be back. As we say in Welsh -Roedd y Croeso yn wych! (The wecome was fantastic!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Kate348
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful rooms and the staff and consistently pleasant and helpful. It is within walking distance of all the Paris sights. The only downside was the beds - mattresses and pillows were uncomfortable and of poor quality, we kept falling down between the two single beds put together to make a double...and the beds were too short! In all other repects it was a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer51
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here whilst in transit and wished we had stayed longer. It is a lovely small hotel in a good location. Our room wasnt large but wasn't too bad by European standards. To our surprise it had a refrigerator, microwave and 2 burner hotplates- quite unusual in European hotels. We noticed a laundromat about 100 mtrs away in Rue Bernadins. Staff were very helpful- and spoke good English. There was nothing we could fault - lovely and very French

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Daitoni
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here or 4 nights at the end of 6 weeks in Europe. It was a great finish. Whilst the rooms are small (as is the norm in Paris) they are well furnished and comfortable. The location is just great. There are wonderful restaurants (the staff will advise and book for you) and the general feel of the area is wonderful. The staff are very helpful and provide all assistance with good grace and efficiency (even when we blew 2 light globes!!).

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Charming Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette85
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend this lovely gorgeous hotel. We loved it. The location was excellent, with easy walking to all the beautiful areas of Paris. The rooms were very clean and beautifully appointed, very Parisian. Both the rooms and bathroom were very spacious. We did not notice any outside noise at night. It was a lovely feel right from the moment we walked in. The friendliness of the staff was exceptional. They were all very professional and helpful. It was a lovely place to return to after a full day of exploring Paris. I would certainly book this hotel again on a future visit to Paris. Two very good restaurants we visited, close by were Louis Vins and Gaudeamus. Beautiful food and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tomshiff
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this great little hotel. Quiet end of street location, beautifully decorated rooms, excellent service from whomever was at the front desk. Little kitchen in the room was handy (though barely used - too many great restaurants). My only negatives, the breakfast room in the basement is a little cramped and noisy. Would definitely recommend this hotel to couples, business people, as a regular Paris treat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Parisian Stay”
Reviews.Author: CandCL
Reviews.Content: The Henri is a beautiful hotel, clean rooms, great bathrooms, excellent showers, and right in the heart of Paris within walking distance of most major attractions such as the Ile de la Cite, Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, and right in the Latin Quarter. Lots of sumptious restaurants nearby for all meals, close to the Metro as well. Only one issue, while the staff was responsive, they weren't all that helpful. For example, I asked to use the hotels computer to print tickets to sites. After making the booking, I was told I couldn't print from that computer so had to walk a number of blocks to pick up the tickets. Or, when asking if we could lock up luggage at the train station, I was told to call the train station and then charged for the call. All in all minor compared to the great stay at the Henri.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place - elegant, quiet, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie&Chantal
Reviews.Content: Staff at Henri 4 were friendly, professional, helpful with recommendations and responsive to requests. The room was beautiful - full of antiques, more spacious than expected, marble bath, high ceilings, decorative plaster moldings, tall shuttered windows, wrought iron railings - exactly what we wished for in romantic Paris (though no facecloths provided). Towels, soaps and sheets were replenished daily. Lots of hot water - made for a relaxing soak in the tub with sweetly scented bath salts provided, after a full day exploring Paris. Kitchenette had two burners, microwave, dishes (no dishcloths or towels), fridge stocked with water/pop/beer/wine (we never purchased these items as prices were lower at the many 'corner stores' nearby). Location was at the border of the Latin Quarter & St. Germaine neighborhoods, close to an artisanal bakery 'Eric Kayser' where we had fantastic croissants/pastries/baguettes almost every day, a block from the Pantheon, short walk to the Notre Dame and buses/Metro (excellent transportation system - about a 10 minute ride to anywhere in central Paris), numerous restaurants nearby (though we didn't try them). My daughter and I loved 'coming home' to the tranquility and comfort of Henri IV each evening and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, charming staff, charming location”
Reviews.Author: jld44
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here, I booked it by accident. I was supposed to stay in another hotel by the same name not too far away. I was delighted when the hotel turned out to be really nice! And now I stay here when I go to Paris for work. The staff are really helpful. The rooms are lovely and very charming. The location is good. Only a short walk from Odeon and St MIchel where there are plenty of nice bars and restaurants to eat in the evening. Also very close to Notre Damn. Great location for shopping trips as it is only a short distance on the metro to Sevres Babylone.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Parisian; connect with history and culture, while staying in comfort at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: L-Bolek
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our baby son (turned 20 months old while in Paris), and this hotel was a great choice. Please understand when you book that this is a boutique hotel, so do not expect Hilton or the likes. We like to feel â€œlike localsâ€� during our travels, and this place was perfect in every way for us and our baby. Location is superb. We almost never had to ride anywhere, except once â€“ pressed for time. Since this was a second visit to Paris, we already knew the city layout and main landmarks. Pantheon is a 5-minute walk up the street, and has great interior, rotunda, and a crypt (Voltaire, Zola, Dumas, Hugo), Louvre, Notre Dame, Place de Bastille, Luxembourg Gardens, Montparnasse â€“ all walking distance through fun streets. Sent Germen Boulevard with its side-street nooks full of great restaurants was just a block down from Henri IV. And for unexpected added bonus great for parents with kids: a nice playground in a little park right outside the hotel. The hotel itself is very quiet, since it is in a dead-end of a short street. We slept great. Our â€œalarm clockâ€� was the Sent Germen Church and its bell tower, which was a really cool way to tell time: just look outside at a piece of history. The building housing the hotel was also constructed in 1879. Our third-floor room 32 was named Marie de Medici, and all of the rooms had names after famous people of the period. There is a nice booklet in English and French that tells about several historical figures. So the hotelâ€™s spirit provides a good connection to Paris from the start. The little balcony (probably available in most of the larger rooms) was a fun way to have morning coffee (great coffee, BTW â€“ thanks for making it for me on request!), or enjoy evening wine and cheese, once our child was sleeping in the very good and large crib provided by the staff. We used kitchenette and the fridge a few times, and it is good to have when travelling with a small child. Some reviewers stated the absence of a coffee-maker, but really, just call the reception any time, and you get a fabulous coffee service. Bathroom was a good size, always clean. We didnâ€™t really watch TV much, but it was nice to have a flat-screen that doesnâ€™t take up any space. Breakfast cellar was good too, and we enjoyed the pastries a couple of times, while having breakfast in the room other times. There are many markets around, wine shops, bakeries, fromageries, you-name-it-eries. You wonâ€™t go hungry in Paris, thatâ€™s for sure. There is a great Chinese take-out place right around the corner. And also little pharmacies are everywhere, in case you need some pampers or whatever. Donâ€™t expect any of those to be open 24/7 though, since they take breaks during the day. The elevator was a good thing, even if it was small. We could fit all three of us in if our son was sitting in the travel stroller, or take turns in case of the luggage. Some things like the beds may need updating soon, but overall this was a great experience in a small apartment-type setting in the heart of Paris. Many thanks to all hotel staff for making the trip easy for us. We will definitely return in future years. Things we did this trip that stood out (or we didnâ€™t get a chance to do before) â€“ a horse-and-carriage 1 Â½ hour ride through the city with champagne â€“ highly recommend. We were with 2 friends and our son. That is top-capacity for the ride. And going up the Eifel tower was great. Make sure you do this at the end of your trip to Paris, when you already know the city layout and able to tell what youâ€™re looking at. Also, the staff at residence Henri IV gave me the site to pre-order tickets for the tower ahead of time. We booked those way in advance, and were able to get a time we wanted, and stood in no line to get in. Paris is comfortable to see with a child in a stroller. Although we think our blissful faces, no visible photo-equipment, no map in hand, and a kid in a stroller added to the appearance of â€œlocalsâ€�, and people asked us constantly how to get somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like coming home”
Reviews.Author: siskiyous
Reviews.Content: My husband, our college age daughter and I recently spent four nights at Residence Henri IV. We had a suite on the 5th floor which included a terrace. The room worked very well in that my husband and I had the bedroom while our daughter slept on a hide-a-bed in the living area. The decor and attention to detail at the hotel are wonderful, as is the location and proximity to markets. We often would pick up a bottle of wine or snacks and sit out on our balcony at the end of a long day exploring Paris. We also enjoyed the hotel's breakfast every morning and found it very convenient (plus wonderful coffee!). Also, our room was kept very clean. But what made this hotel so special was the attentive staff, particularly Hicham at the front desk. We had numerous questions regarding the metro, restaurants, museums, etc. and he went out of his way to help us, always with a wonderful sense of humor. We thoroughly enjoyed greeting him when we came back to the hotel, and it really did feel like coming home. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - a real treat”
Reviews.Author: onehotcurry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and it was a pleasure. The staff are very helpful. Hotel is clean and Room 32 accommodated me and my wife and 2 daughters (15 and 20) in 2 rooms with a lovely quaint balcony. The small kitchen was great although not big enough to cook a meal (suggest you take a travel kettle). There are only 2 English TV channels - BBC World News and CNN - so not good for relaxing to watch anything on the TV but it's another excuse to go out and enjoy the cafe culture in Paris. Breakfast in America restaurant very close, good supermarket round the corner and best of all Kaiser's Boulangerie for cakes and bread. A small plush cinema is literally one minute away from the hotel showing some older black and white movies - we saw a James Stewart picture - brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DHCWESTON
Reviews.Content: I love the small boutique hotels in Paris and have tried many of them. If you know what you are getting, you won't be disappointed. The rooms in Paris are generally small. It is especially difficult to find the right hotel for a family of 6 like ours with 4 children aged from 14 to 22. This is a nice comfortable boutique hotel and accomodated our family well. The hotel is at the end of a dead end street (50 rue des Bernardins) so it was quiet while we were there although the Fete of the Assumption was on Sunday and marched right down the main road practically through our bedroom with the parades of chanters. The location was perfect, a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame, right next to the Rue de Monge and a small market, with a film theater showing classics like Alfred Hitchcockâ€™s The Birds (playing on the first night we arrived) around the corner from the hotel. This is an easy area to explore and just two short blocks from Blvd. St Germaine. The hotel itself is small. We got two rooms on the 1st floor (Premier Etage), rooms 10 and 12 (the only rooms on the first floor) -- they have a small elevator and a nice wide spiral staircase. Having our own floor provided a lot of privacy -- we had two rooms in one apartment (a King bed and a King pull out sofa) with nice air conditioning and a modern bathroom, a very small kitchenette area with microwave and refrigerator that we did not use, and a flat screen TV mounted in the bedroom. The second room had twin beds. You would not call the rooms spacious but they fit our family and were clean and modern with many conveniences that are harder to find in Paris. The front desk was very helpful and courteous. They had our main room ready by 11 a.m. instead of the usual 2 P.M. because we were all tired and had jet lag. Per suggestions of others, we got pastries/breakfast one morning at Eric Kayserâ€™s Boulangerie (croisants, sandwiches, and excellent madeleines). We had breakfast at the hotel one morning as well, and it was very good as well. So far, I would say this is one of my favorites if not my favorite hotel in Paris (the location probably makes it my top choice in the future). I certainly will look to this hotel first for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem!”
Reviews.Author: HappytrailsTucsonAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night when we arrived in France, but will definitely be back soon! Our room was cleaned and available when we arrived from CDG around 11 a.m. Lovely, spacious room on the third floor. French doors looking out at back garden from the bathroom, and front garden and street view from the french windows in the bedroom; lovely cross breeze made for wonderful sleeping! Hotel is located at the very end of a cul-de-sac within walking distance of St. Michel RER station. Bus line goes right in front. Staff members are gracious and knowledgeable. Our room was absolutely lovely! Furnished appropriately and comfortably with nice closets available. There is also a mini kitchen with 2-burner cooktop, microwave, sink and refrigerator. We didn't use them, but nice touch! Very nice restaurants within a minute or two walking; ATMs very close. All in all, an exceptional place to stay when in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Small quaint french boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mari444
Reviews.Content: Good location. Different than website pictures. We had a pleasant stay at this boutique hotel, safe, bus stop across the road, market down the street, staff helpful. Price was rather high. We had a torrential downpour early one morning and the water came down the walls, through the ceiling over carpet and curtains and bed. Staff very apologetic. Evidence from ceiling that this was not the first time. Think some money should be spent and repairs should be done to retain this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, but not the last”
Reviews.Author: greve
Reviews.Content: Several years ago we stayed in the Hotel Residence Henri V, and a return visit only reinforced our opinion. A superb hotel. Great location, quiet, beautiful rooms, and friendly, helpful staff. Good wifi in the room helped to keep my husband happy. Four-poster bed, a good sized bathroom with large window opening onto the internal courtyard, adequate 'kitchen', stunning decor, quaint staircase up to the room (also a baggage lift, of course) meant that I too was in seventh heaven. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at this Inn was a lovely experience.”
Reviews.Author: Fluglot
Reviews.Content: We loved this small, boutique hotel. We stayed in a standard room which was small but there was plenty of room to move around. We didn't feel cramped and the decor was very attractive. The bed was a "memory foam' type and was extremely comfortable. The location was very desirable , within easy walking distance of museums, cathedrals the Seine and cafes. The staff were very, very friendly and happy to help in any way. We would highly recommend this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tmag10
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel in the Latin Quarter was perfect for us. We walked to the Pantheon, the Jardin Luxembourg, Notre Dame, Hotel D'Ville, and the adorable Ile St. Louis. The metro stations are very close, there are many restaurant choices and the area is clean and safe. The hotel staff was very helpful and gracious. We loved the tiny elevator, the winding staircase, the well appointed rooms, and the breakfast room- it's what makes it Parisien and separates it from anywhere else. That's why we went to Paris. I would definitely stay at this quiet, comfortable, friendly hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean small well-appointed room with balcony and kitchenette.”
Reviews.Author: TEKnudsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in July 2010 and can highly recommend this small well located hotel. The surroundings are quiet. We enjoyed the charming clean room with good facilities including a small kitchenette and balcony. Our only complaint is that the equipment in the kitchenette is modest, for example only one pot, no breadknife and tea towel. The staff speaks English and is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Charming, Parisian.... Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: YankeeGirl722
