Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel completely based on its location and the wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed!! We had a fabulous stay at this hotel! We booked the hotel directly through the hotel website and got a great summer special rate. We had a standard room and went with the mindset that the room would be on the smaller side. We were definitely surprised that the room, although smaller than American hotels, was much larger than we expected! We had room 62 on the top floor and loved it! We had two adorable balconies and plenty of room! The room was charming, clean and comfortable. We loved the spiral staircase and appreciated the elevator after a long day of walking! The location is perfect! A less than 10 minute walk from Notre Dame and Seine and a block away from the Pantheon. The guys working the front desk were more than helpful when needed and spoke excellent English. The refrigerator in the room was perfect for holding our wine and cheese! The air conditioner was also wonderful on some of the warmer nights. This is not a modern hotel, but if you are looking for Parisian charm in a wonderful location with hospitable staff, this hotel is for you. We loved it here! It made our first trip to Paris that much more wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SummerdazePerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the beginning of July. It was very hot, so the airconditioning came in very handy. If your after a boutique style hotel, this is the one. The rooms were lovely and the bathrooms were large. The guys at the front desk spoke english well and were helpful when needed. The location was great, it was very close to Notre Dame, and the Pantheon was just behind the hotel. The hotel was on a quiet street and there were many restaurants and cafes nearby. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel central to major Paris sights, but on a quiet side street.”
Reviews.Author: euroyoung
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated and walking distance to the Seine, Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle, Pantheon and many other sights in the Latin Quarter. The staff was very helpful and willing to speak English. The breakfast was basic fare but in a lovely setting with great service.

Reviews.Title: “the bathroom has light!”
Reviews.Author: cestkim
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed and a half dozen two and three star hotels in basically the same area and Hotel Residence Henri IV was by far the nicest. First of all, the rooms are bigger than the usual Paris hotel room. Still small by American standards but adequately roomy with TWO closets and TWO tables and chairs. And the bathroom was huge and light with a full length window. The wifi was free and fast in our room (50) and in the lobby. The hotel was a bit more expensive than others I've booked but I took advantage of an internet special and paid for the room ahead of time thus getting it at a greatly reduced rate making it comparable in price to others I've stayed at. Oh, and I can't forget to mention that there is a little kitchenette as well. It was great to have a fridge and silverware! As far as location, you can't beat it (unless you like to stay in real touristy areas). There are busses right outside the door and a metro 5 min. away. Since it's in a neighborhood, there are plenty of little grocery stores, boulangerie, restaurants and even a market. If you want more excitement, Saint Michel with all it's activity, a different metro line and the RER is about 10 min away. The only thing that would stop me from staying here again is price although you get what you pay for. My budget wouldn't have been able to handle paying full price so I'm crossing my fingers that I can get the same type of Internet rate next year if I travel to France again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TandH2010
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in various places in Paris, including Le Marais (which we loved) but this has been the best so far. The location was just so ideal. The hotel itself is at the end of a small cul-de-sac running off a fairly quiet street, so apart from church bells, we had total peace and quiet. The staff are great - extremely helpful and friendly. The room was just lovely and had an attractive outlook. The best feature, though, is the way it is secluded, yet right on the doorstep of metro/train stations, great restaurants and boulangeries (Eric Kayser just around the corner is fantastic) and sight-seeing (Pantheon, Notre Dame, Ille St. Louis). We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the heart of the Latin Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: legalwheel
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on a friend's recommendation. Turned out to be a very good selection. The location is perfect, just blocks away from Notre Dame, the Paris subway, and all of the sights and delights of the Latin Quarter. Our accomodations were suitable for 3 adults - a bedroom and a living room with a sleeper sofa; and a kitchenette which we provisioned from nearby markets. The staff was friendly, fluent in English, and genuinely concerned about our comfort.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Paris - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: SaGrandma
Reviews.Content: I expect when it is a "first time" it is always best to have really good memories of the experience. For the four of us, our stay at this Hotel was such a positive one! From the winding staircase and the tiny lift (useful for luggage) to the cosy lounge off the reception area - pleasant and inviting. The room we had was a 'family' room: two areas for sleeping with a small kitchenette and a good sized bathroom/toilet. Bed and bedding were great. The secret of course, was the ambiance of the Hotel on the whole and the room in particular: we felt so much at home and who wouldn't want to have little Juliet balconies off the rooms? The windows opened out to the balconies and grandson would enjoy the cold, fresh air sitting on the sill, writing his Journal (for school project). The reception desk was always manned by cheerful, helpful staff and we were made to feel most at home by Qaisar. The location: couldn't ask for better. The little walk to the Seine and the water taxi; the walk to the Market; restaurants; the subway - everything was nearby and the walk - well, the little bit of exercise to these points was most welcome and invigorating! Again, my thanks to the Trip Advisor Reviewers for their insight and willingness to share.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed everthing about this charming, well located 'parisian' hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandb10
Reviews.Content: In a convenient position but really quiet, we slept like logs, rare in Paris. Even though it was close to popular tourist sites, there seemed to be plenty of locals going about their business. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the rooms were typically Parisian, not bland 'international'. We were travelling with another couple and we all agreed we would be recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Our little balcony was utterly charming.”
Reviews.Author: kkm7m
Reviews.Content: A charming, comfortable, clean hotel in the heart of the Latin Quarter on a quiet little side street. The staff spoke English and were welcoming and so helpful. Our kitchenette was very useful, as was the air conditioning. Be sure to ask for a room with a balcony. We enjoyed sipping our wine out there more than we can say. Easily reached by metro. What a wonderful way to start our trip to France.

Reviews.Title: “My room in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: raphael1_a
Reviews.Content: I come to see my daughter in Paris and I select this hotel again, as I already know this hotel is excellent. Located in my favorite Quartier Latin, with useful kitchen, reasonable price and nice staff. Super market Monoprix (open till 11:00 pm) and Naturalia (Bio shop) are 5 minutes walk, and Kayser (bakery) is 1 minutes walk! You can enjoy your stay as if you are living in Paris. Only 14 rooms, however, very safe and good quality in everything. The hotel amenities are excellent as well! Hope I can visit again this year.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Ever”
Reviews.Author: pariswet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Henri 4 some 15 years ago and enjoyed it so much that we wanted to repeat the pleasure. We found it just as quaint and attractive as on our first visit. The location is excellent, quiet and accessible. The staff at reception were genuinely friendly and helpful and the optional breakfast was freshly baked and just right. On this occasion we were on the top floor in a double room and it compared favourably with the suite we had on the first occasion. Our only regret was that the hotel was unable to accept a credit card payment from our daughter in England who wished us to celebrate our special occasion with a bottle of champagne she wanted to pay for and about which we knew nothing till our return. Despite unusually cold and wet weather we would come again, funds permitting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: annamari_1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. Perhaps my expectations were set too high... it's a nice hotel but not perfect. We travelled with two children and booked a superior room (living room + bedroom). This room might have been specious for two people but for the four of us it was very crammed. The kitchenette was useful for eating in but there were not enough chairs for all of us in the room so someone had to sit on the bed while eating. The interior decor is nice but shows signs of wear. The sound insulation between the rooms could be better. The helpfulness of the staff varies greatly: while checking in the receptionist gave us our key without actually saying a word - not only not wishing us a nice stay or something similar pleasantry, but also not mentioning that they have a lift, even when he saw us pulling our luggage up the stairs... Other members of staff were very helpful though, printing out our electronic tickets for the Eiffel tower and calling the hotel at our next French destination for us. The free WIFI inside the room was very convenient. (By the way, I suggest you book your Eiffel tower ticket online so you don't have to queue for hours.) But the best feature of the hotel and the main reason of why would I recommend this hotel to anyone is definitely its location. Close to many main sights, perfect transportation links, nice restaurants and shops in the area - we've been staying in different areas in Paris but this was the one we liked the most.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, charming, calmingly elegant French hotel”
Reviews.Author: debritu
Reviews.Content: Charming, simple-elegant, quiet, non-touristy hotel. Beautifully appointed in perfect location. Quiet cul de sac with lovely small park infront of hotel. Lovely view from hotel balcony. Well decorated and appointed rooms. Lots of attention to detail. Nice bathroom with shower. Well stocked kitchenette. Nice firm mattress with good quality sheets. Lovely sitting room in small reception/lobby area of hotel. Location couldn't be better. A few blocks from the Seine and Notre Dame, a block from the city bus and metro station, a few blocks from the Sorbonne, the Panthenon and Rue Mouffetard, around the corner from Kayser bakery. If you want to feel you are in Paris and not in a large, chain type hotel where you could be in any country where you are surrounded by tourists and your typical dining facilities, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: jairusa
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, in the heart of the latin quarter. Metro station is a block away.Night life is blocks away. Hotel is on quiet street with a park on the corner. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Room clean and neat. Our particular room had windows in bathroom and another that opened up to a quaint balcony with a table and chairs. Very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, rooms a little small but great location”
Reviews.Author: s1ndy72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had a lovely time. The location is perfect for seeing Paris and is in walking distance to many great sights. We travelled with two children (6 and 3 years old) and my only criticism is that the rooms were a little on the small side. However, we've travelled to Paris several times and the room sizes are comparable to others we have stayed in. The staff here are friendly and helpful. The kitchenette was a welcome feature as it meant we could eat in the room. This saved us money and also meant we could relax knowing the kids had eaten something. If you have fussy eaters you know what I mean! The hotel is clean, quiet and a great base for anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lewbob
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice small hotel in an excellent location for visiting Paris. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all major sites. Also immediate area is great with lots of restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PACabral
Reviews.Content: The very best travel experience we had, perfect location, attentive & courteous staff, room not so spacious, but splendid view, tranquil & silent environment, the kitchentte gives the opportunity to sample the vast offer of delicious goodies (food & wine) in the neighborough - and save a lot of euros to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for your stay on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: gdd49
Reviews.Content: We walked all over the city from this charming boutique hotel. This was our third stay here and although the carpet was beginning to show signs of wear and the room could use better lighting, other attributes - service, cleanliness, and location - made up for some minor imperfections. Tucked away in a dead-end street, the staff here is always anxious to please and helpful, while not intrusive. We booked the special internet rate in advance and the rates seemed reasonable. We will return although we may check for room renovations first and request a room on a higher floor which we recall as being brighter.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, very good value for money and delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nick157
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet, but subsequently received a personal recommendation . It proved to be a gem - perfect central location, but quiet at night. The option to prepare simple meals ourselves was a great benefit, and the staff were delightful and very helpful. I would certainly return.....

Reviews.Title: “Location location location and knowledgable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Paris103
Reviews.Content: Firstly the staff were very friendly and helpful.The rooms by Paris standards were large and clean .The location was what sold us on this place in the middle of all the restaurants and bars ,close to the metro, walking distance to almost everywhere we wanted to see. The only down side is the breakfast wasn't really healthy for a day of walking and sightseeing,but many other places to eat nearby.The conseriege for the day shift was helpful with every query.I would and we have recommended this place to friends travelling in June.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quiet, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: BillBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in March 2010. Very impressed with the hotel and the service of the staff. Immediately after booking, a personal response was e-mailed regarding a query- which I thought was impressive. The hotel is clean, charming and the room we were given was large (by Paris standards), very clean and 'fresh' (non smoking hotel!) comfortable (with a desk and two chairs, and two 'julliet' type balconies), charmingly decorated in the style described by the hotel. The room also had a mini-kitchen (micro-wave/hob/fridge, which was brilliant for making coffee and simple snacks). There was a TV in the room with CNN/BBC world news + free wi-fi in the lobby area. The staff were unintrusive, efficient and welcoming/friendly (for example, reminding us about the clocks going forward so that we didnt miss our flight). The room was quiet and the hotel conveniently located (5 mins from metro, 10-15mins easy walk from St Michelle, the RER line that links directly to CDG airport!). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: molliemaguire
Reviews.Content: Hotel is tucked into a cul de sac so it is nice and quiet. Good location half a mile from Notre Dame. Breakfast was good, but not a help yourself buffet, instead a basket of pastries and a jug of coffee were brought to your table. Cereal and juice you did help yourself to. Room and bathroom was clean and comfortable, but not very modern.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, charming, well-kept, quiet accommodation”
Reviews.Author: nycsojourner
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the accommodations at Residence Henri IV. We felt very fortunate to have chosen to stay at this hotel for our family four day visit to Paris and Versailles. Our suite was obviously well maintained and lovely in appearance. The bed linens and towels were at a very satisfactory level of fineness. The bathroom was in excellent condition with good water pressure. The staff members were very helpful, indeed excellent. We enjoyed the local area both in terms of dining, shopping, etc. as well as having the convenience of a nearby Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Hicham front desk manager... excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michotraveller
Reviews.Content: Very quaint place.... Hicham at the desk was above and beyond excellent. Left some important items in hotel and he in sending them over... easy, fast and efficient. Great location... Very pleased with my stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benkirane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and decor Hotel very quiet, friendly environment, staff realy very helpful Thank you " Residence Henri 4 "

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Parisian retreat”
Reviews.Author: JanieNottingham
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Henri as a special Valentines and Birthday treat. I have travelled to Paris many times on business but this was my first and also my husband's first stay for pleasure. We were not disappointed here at this wonderful little hotel, and would certainly come again... The location is excellent, handy for the metro and some very good local restaurants, and a very quiet position. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was lovely with fresh pastries and coffee served in our room every morning.....Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: chitan303
Reviews.Content: It's my second time at the Henri IV. Glad to see that they've improved the wifi network. The suite on the fifth floor is tiny but tastefully decorated, with double-paned windows and blackout curtains to keep the sound and light out when needed. The smallest kitchenette is serviceable. Only complaint is in the bathroom - I wish it had a better bathtub with greater water pressure. It takes considerable skill getting the right temperature. And surely, they can afford better toiletries... BYO hair conditioner and body lotion! Finally, skip the hotel breakfast and head for Eric Kayser a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: JRHV
Reviews.Content: Rarely does a hotel live up to its billing but this one certainly did. Small, quaint and offered excellent service. While short on amenities (i.e. room service or laundry service), an extremely helpful front desk more than makes up for that. Also, with its excellent location, everything you need is within an easy walk. The front desk was especially helpful dealing with a lost luggage problem, dealing with all the interactions with the local baggage service. Beyond pleased with our stay and would recommend to anyone - and in fact, have already passed the hotel's website on to a colleague who plans on honeymooning in Paris this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CicciCh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Henry 4 with my 23 y.o. daughter to celebrate our birthdays, both in January, and to visit an international home decoration fair in Paris. We felt very comfortable at this hotel and in its area (Quartier Latin). Our room was very clean and cosy, tres pariesienne! Also very quiet at night, wich is a must for me when I travel. There are only 2 rooms on each floor. The staff was very kind and helpful. Free internet in your room. It was our first time in Paris and I was a little bit concerned. I think the the hotel Henry was the best choice for us, as two travelling ladies alone. The hotel is close to different undergrounds and the REB and it was extremely easy to visit Paris and the international fair. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we preferred one of the many brasseries of Paris. There are a lot of good and lovely restaurants just around the corner (oh so fine, when you are tired after a whole day of walking...). A complete menu costs between 25 and 28 euro's, fixed price. We tried many restaurants but our favourite were: Le Petit Chatelet (rue de la Boucherie) and Louis Vins (Rue Montagne).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful peaceful haven in a lovely central area.”
Reviews.Author: RJHPerth_Australia
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel we've stayed at in Paris - small and friendly, with very attentive staff and in a great location which affords a lot more peace and quiet than most places. I won't stay anywhere else in Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Europe - not just Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyLois
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel from the fabulous individually furnished rooms in keeping with their theme, to the extremely helpful and pleasant staff. We loved the area - perfect for exploring the left bank and the St Germain and Latin quarter. Comfy beds, terrific restaurants nearby and lots of great things about this lovely little boutique hotel. After 5 weeks travelling around Europe this one stands out for lots of good reasons.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous boutique hotel with French charm, modern amenities and fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: LizzieGAustralia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Henri IV (50, rue des Bernardins - make sure you get the right hotel, there is another hotel with a similar name which is apparently not so good) - a small boutique hotel superbly located in the Latin quarter of Paris. Furnishings are beautiful and very French, combined with modern bathrooms and good sized rooms by European standards. My husband and I were delighted with both our room (#62) on the 6th floor and the twin room our 2 teenagers shared (#20). Both had a mini kitchenette. The staff were incredibly helpful and very professional. There is a lift and free WiFi. The rate we paid was good value for such a great location. The metro is very close by but many Paris sights can be reached on foot from the hotel. They do a light continental breakfast if you advise them the night before but I would also recommend the nearby Kaiser bakery in Rue Monge which is superb. Wouldn't hesitate to stay at Hotel Residence Henri IV next time we are in Paris, I really can't fault it or their friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful,charming parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizziesoph
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here over the New Year period.From the moment we checked in we felt looked after. The staff all spoke English very well and were so helpful in every way. Our rooms were surprisingly spacious, very clean and quiet. The decor was very parisian which was lovely.The location was fantastic...to the market down the street...to the metro...everthing was easy to get to. We had a lovely stay and would highly recommend Henri 4 to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality and great location”
Reviews.Author: bb41
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel to all. The staff makes you feel comfortable and they are exceptionality warm and helpful. A great location, comfortable rooms with cross drafts and fresh air, and chocolate every day! This hotel will make your visit a warm and memorable one! Barry and Deborah Berndes Publisher San Diegan Travel Guide

Reviews.Title: “Oversized, excellent location hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gringopr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a small cul de sac which keeps the noise to a minimum, trust me we were on the first level with a view of the small park, and we did not hear anything from the outside. It is a older building and you could hear folks walking up and down the stairs, in the morning and evening. There are plenty of sites in the area and the metro (#10 - Maubert) is a short block and a half from the hotel. There are many restaurants in the area and a short walk to the Latin Quarter. For breakfast, would recommend picking up bread and pastries from Eric Kayser which a block away towards Notre Dame. My wife and I stayed in room #10, which was very well sized compared to other hotels we had previously stayed at in Paris. The room has high ceilings and plenty of space for luggage. The room and bathroom were cleaned and seviced daily. The is a kitchenette which is perfect for making your own breakfast. WiFi is available in the hotel at no extra charge. The staff provided excellent service and answered every question prior and during our stay. Did not see or notice any of the negative behavior which were mentioned in previous review. We only received the best professional service. Definitely will stay again during our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Equanimity
Reviews.Content: A beautifully appointed little hotel, with delightful decor and great facilities. Quiet location in a cul de sac but near to Notre Dame, the Seine and other tourist attractions. The Latin Quarter is great for all kinds of food, quaint shops and classic architecture. Highly recommend. Breakfast good value compared to cafes around the area, and staff very friendly and helpful. Will defintitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Utter disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bluelight_solutions
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the pictures advertised on the website - the rooms look nothing like them. According to the website, we booked a "Superior Room" that was meant to be spacious and trendy. In actual fact, it's an old, dark, tiny room that is divided by a separating wall with a sleeper couch and TV in the other room. Furthermore, it had a broken toilet seat (I haven't even seen one like this in the worst pubs in the UK!), and an old, creaky wardrobe containing a couple of smelly, old blankets, and the lights didn't even work properly. We were so distraught about this, we tried to leave immediately. We discussed our disappointment with the concierge in order to let him know that we wouldn't be staying. He phoned his manager who discussed with him that he should charge us for two nights, despite our contract clearly stating that we should only be charged for one. We tried to get him to see reason, but he refused point blank, and the situation became awkward. My girlfriend tried to reason with him that guests shouldn't be treated this way, but he was adamant in charging us for two nights. This was a complete mistake, and we highly recommend that people wanting to enjoy their stay in Paris do not go here! We recommend the Five Hotel or the Hidden Hotel instead. Both places were absolutely wonderful compared to this old dump.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, quiet, convenient hotel by the Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: tmr18
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel, and was not disappointed. The two-room apt/hotel is spacious, well-furnished and comfortable, with kitchenette. We were able to make our breakfast every morning, and was nice to come back in the afternoon and have tea. Around the corner from Eric Kayser Boulangerie, small supermarket, and open-air markets on St. Germaine Blvd. Comfortable bed, clean, spacious bathroom. Having wi-fi in the room was a plus as well. Lovely flat-screen tv, which we never used, who has time to watch tv in paris!!! Short walk to the metro, and very convenient to the university, Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, etc. My son, who is living in Paris, was amazed at how much space we had compared to his tiny apt room. Basically this is the only place we ever stay, and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a true find”
Reviews.Author: MAS059
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Henri IV is a real gem in the 5th arrondisement. It's tucked into a quiet cul de sac just off the Rue des Ecoles so it's quieter than the average Parisian hotel. The staff are incredibly professional and welcoming. The rooms are meticulously maintained...the beds comfortable...the lobby sitting area a tranquil oasis. My only regret is that we were only in Paris for five nights. We'll be back...and I can recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: thornbird45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights last week for my 40th birthday and had a really great stay. I'd spent a fair amount of time checking out hotels prior to choosing this and it lived up to all our expections (and it is exactly like it is on the website!) We stayed in Room 32 - which had a sitting room in addition to the standard bedrom, bathroom and kitchenette configuration. Our room was really nicely furnished and had a very cozy and romatic feel to it. The kitchenette is a real boon, particularly as the hotel is well served by a wide selection of boulangeries, traiteurs etc all within 5 mins walk. The hotel is exceptionally quiet and we slept really well whilst we were there, with a decent sized bed (I'm 6 feet 4 and have a real bug-bear with small beds in hotels). You would really struggle to get a much better location - you are really well served by metro stations and RER lines and there are a number of major attractions that are within easy walking distance. Top tips 1. As in most Parisien hotels its better value not to have breakfast in the hotel - this is especially the case with this hotel as you have 2 legendary Eric Keyser boulangeries (they are almost next door to each other) within 2 mins walk of the hotel. 2. There are also 2 local Franprix supermarkets close by and a Nicolas wine merchants, both really useful if not eating out. 3. Some really good restaurants nearby - the best by a mile is Le Buisson Ardent (approx 5 mins walk on Rue Jussieu) but Coup Chou is also very good but with slightly hit and miss service. 4. You must visit Le Bonbon au Palais - 1 minute away at the other side of the Langevin park - the most amazing confectionery we've ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllaBychkova
Reviews.Content: It is very nice, comfortable hotel, in the good location near Notere-Dame and Sorbone, on the queit street, a lot of different shops and cafes in this district. There is a mini kitchen in the room with all crockery, but without teakettle. There is a bathroom in the room. It is very queit in the hotel, because on the stock there are only 2 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel in quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: Thrushwood
Reviews.Content: Thanks tripadvisor for helping us find this great hotel, which made our three day trip to Paris in November 2009 extra special. Located in the Latin Quarter, a couple of streets south of Ile de la Cite, the hotel is well located for sightseeing. Although it does not offer bar or restaurant facilities there is a wide and varied selection of bars, bistros and restaurants within easy walking distance. Breakfast is available on request although we frequented the Eric Kayser boulangerie (www.maison-kayser.com/en/ ) just around the corner, for good coffee, croissant and cakes (we can recommend their monge chocolate tart, rum babas and hot chocolate). For a romantic evening meal try the Coup Chou restaurant (www.lecoupechou.com/) as recommended to us by the hotel staff â€“ delightful food and atmosphere. Our room (10) just at the top of the stairs off reception was large with a king size bed and ample wardrobe and drawer space. The bathroom was clean with lots of hot water available for a deep hot bath - great after a hard days sightseeing - plus fresh towels every day. Free wi-fi made it easy to use the internet on our ipod touch. Being just off a main street the room was quiet with very little traffic noise or the internal noise you tend to get from banging hotel doors or plumbing. Overall the Residence Henri 4 is difficult to fault. Our only criticism would be lack of a kettle to easily make tea and coffee (although the room does have a kitchenette with electric hob, microwave, sink and fridge (doubling as a mini bar). Otherwise the decor is just starting to show some signs of wear and tear - a little thread bare carpet on the stairs for example. However this did not detract from this hotels many positive points and we would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is not what you get! Website better than reality!”
Reviews.Author: chucklebutty
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site and the hotel's own website prompted me to book. How disappointing! Booked for my 40th for 3 nights with my 5 yr old son. I think that they saw that I was a single parent and put me in the worst room in the hotel! None of the 'fancy looking' rooms on the website, oh no, a dingy and dated room instead. Bulb in the lamp was out, bathroom sanitaryware old and it wasn't the cleanest. The breakfast is pricey and absolutely rubbish. A piece of stale bread and 3 small pastries to choose from (oh, and some fruit compote) - dreadful - the worst I have ever had in Paris and this was my tenth visit to the city! I asked for a nicer room and was told that the hotel was full. Particularly disgraceful since I booked a while ago and also emailed separately to ensure that I had a nice room and explained the special occasion. One receptionist was superb (the one upon arrival) but never the same person there twice and the others were quite miserable and made no efforts with my son at all. Would never go back - not value for money at all - though I guess it is luck of the draw and if you had one of the better rooms, you may have a different opinion. I have left feeling that I have totally been ripped off as I could have got a far cheaper hotel that was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quiet and friendly in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: lowkeytraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business. After a few days, it felt like home. There is nothing spectacular you can point your finger at, but most everything about the place is just right: comfortable, quiet and clean room, and an extremely warm and helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time returning in April”
Reviews.Author: DublinPascal
Reviews.Content: Ist trip to Paris ,staff very helpfull, easy access to Metro RER and 'bus,Pantheon 5mins walk as is Notra dame. making plans to return in April/May of 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: britcanuckusa
Reviews.Content: My mother-in-law and I stayed at the Henri IV in April and we had a wonderful time. The rooms were very roomy by Paris standards; they were also very clean and quiet. The hotel is situated in a great location, walking distance to many of the sights (Notre Dame is a few minutes away, and the Louvre isn't much farther; we even walked to the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triomphe and the Jardin de Luxembourg.). In fact, we hardly used public transportation as it was so conveniently located (though we're big walkers; others might not want to walk quite as far =)). Definitely worth a visit. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews... it's a gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: estmin
Reviews.Content: A long weekend of quality mother/daughter time - my 17-year old and myself - and we'd booked the Residence Henri IV because of the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor, and because of its location (one I am familiar with). We definitely weren't disappointed! The room was lovely - double french doors to the front, with a tiny balcony (that would have had a lot of use had it been summer!), and double french windows to the back in the bathroom, overlooking the courtyard. Wrought ironwork, geranium-filled window boxes and paint-flaking shutters all added to the typical Parisian charm. On a more practical note, the little kitchenette was excellent and meant we could store juice for breakfast, as well as heat up some croissants and make tea. The quartier is excellent: location-wise it's well placed between the Seine (easy access to Notre Dame and the Ile St Louis), and St Michel; there are plenty of non-touristy shops (and a very atmospheric little food market on a Saturday morning on the Place Maubert, just a few minutes' walk away); and it all felt very safe. One word of warning for visitors going soon: there is no interchange of Metro lines at Odeon, which certainly caused us a couple of navigational problems when trying to get back to the hotel after a tiring day pounding the pavements. It's not insurmountable, you just need to be a little more creative with your use of the Metro map. I think I read it'll be up and running again by the end of December of this year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel very clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: rforrest
Reviews.Content: Great service, loved the room and location excellent. Off the street so not lots of nosie as in most hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: louis_the_14ths_mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Henri IV for four nights as part of our honeymoon. This hotel is excellent....very clean, and in a phenomenal location. The front desk is SO nice...they are so helpful. They made reservations for us, helped us figure out how to get to obscure restaurants and just made us feel very comfortable. The room was a very good size, larger than we expected. The bathroom was spotless! Overall, we would really recommend this place and wish them all the best in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with lots of character and helpful attentive staff; great for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: SusieB2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments with balcony overlooking the gardens. The rooms were well-appointed and the kitchen facilities useful. (Some proper cutting knives and salt & pepper shakers would have made it more so). The bathroom was large and very clean. The rooms were quiet and restful; the fold-out bed folded away very easily during the day to make full use of the sitting room. The beds were extremely comfortable. The prices are reasonable although not cheap, but altogether a great place to stay during a special time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good location, quiet, children friendly, nicely decorated”
Reviews.Author: geo11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night at a room on the fourth floor. The living room (or entry hall) is separate from the main bedroom and spacious enough to open up the sofa into a double bed and use it as a second bedroom for the kids. The room is getting plenty of daylight through 2 big windows that can be opened and it is decorated in style. There is free Wi-Fi access. Although we didn't use it there is also a kitchen-closet with all the basic for preparing an order-in meal (ex. microwave to warm it up). Small breakfast room but sufficient for us. Nice residential area with good choice of neighborhood restaurants and close to the metro. Walking distance (~10 minutes) to Notre-Dame. Highly recommended hotel for a pleasant stay at Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Kenney
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research in advance of our trip to Paris, and HRH4 was the hotel we finally settled on; the choice was well worth it. The pricing is excellent for Paris, and the location could not be better. This hotel is tucked away on a little dead end street directly off Rue des Ecoles and considering you are only two blocks from the Seine you should not search much further than here when choosing a spot. The room is sized well, the hotel staff is pleasant, and you can get anywhere you want by walking just two blocks and getting on the Metro. Buy a museum pass for the week and skip all the queing necessary at most museums/churches. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: nyakak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at l'Hotel Residence Henri IV for 7 nights in early October and could not have asked for more for our money. The hotel is conveniently located in our favourite area and its situation in a dead-end street was perfect for deep and quiet sleeps. The room was spacious enough and the little kitchenette was perfect for storing little drinks and foods to tide us over until we could get to a cafe for lunch (as we inevitably slept past breakfast every morning). Had the weather been better, the little balcony overlooking the garden would have been well used. Definitely recommend to anyone who is not splurging.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Harriet95
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our stay at Henri IV, The hotel was in a fantastic location close to 3 Metro stops Maubert Mutualite, Cardinal Lemoine, Jussieu and RER St Michel. The rooms were a good size and clean .We made full use of the kitchenette every morning. With a supermarket less than a 5 min. walk away and several bakeries to choose from it made life easy. I liked it so much I have already booked another stay there!

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about this hotel is its location”
Reviews.Author: damassine
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is right in the middle of Paris in a very quiet square. It is few minutes walk from RER Saint Michel (very convenient to go to/from CdG or Orly airports and to move around Paris). It is in the middle Quartier Latin, very close to nice restaurants, notre Dame, jardin de Luxembourg, etc. The perfect base for exploring Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Nothing Exciting”
Reviews.Author: The-World-Trek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great area of Paris in the Latin Quarter, however, it was a bit far from the main Metro stop near Notre Dame - especially making the trip several times throughout the day. The room was somewhat smaller compared to other large-city Eurpoean Hotels of similar price/category. For our next trip, we would pick a hotel closer to the Sienne with better emenities for the rating/price. It would have been a nice touch to include breakfast with the room price as other hotels in the same category do. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhh - this hotel is wonderful, don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Lockhouse
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from three nights at this wonderful hotel. Tucked at the end of a cul-de-sac, yet still wonderfully situated, this small, quiet hotel is a lovely bolthole in Paris. Our room was really a suite, it had a separate sitting area and a small balcony. A lot of thought had gone into the decoration, with lots of panelling and ornate plasterwork. A huge thank you must go to staff who booked cabs and restaurants for us and for whom nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: squid107
Reviews.Content: We loved the area ... lots of bookstores, record shops (my husband collects vinyl), and great cafes. Within a short walking distance to the Sorbonne, Luxembourg gardens, Cluny medieval museum, and ofcourse the Seine and Notre Dame. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were offered breakfast either in our room or downstairs but opted to try a new cafe every morning, just for a new experience. Would definitely stay here again. I'm a little cheap and with the weak dollar, the rooms were a bit pricey, but are probably comparable to other Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away hotel”
Reviews.Author: nogginthenog
Reviews.Content: This is a located in a very convenient area, very near to Notre Dame and the Pantheon. We stayed in the very top floor of the hotel, in quite a small room - although this was not really a problem as we were weren't in the room too much. Having said that, if you are planning to spend a bit of time in the room and cook meals in there, I'd ask for a different room. You get a fridge, a small cooker, microwave etc, but no kettle - this is not unusual in european hotels we've stayed in, but for a room with those kind of facilities, the lack of kettle was a strange anomaly. The staff were universally helpful, english speakers (although it never hurts to at least try to speak a bit of polite french). If you want a big american style breakfast (we did on the last day) then go to "Breakfast in America" just 200 yards away. We bought our bread and cakes from the outstanding "Eric Kayser" boulangerie around the corner. There is also a great arts cinema literally 50 yards away - we saw a Cary Grant film there (in english) Overall, a very nice stay at Henri 4, unfortunately ruined after we left by the fact that we missed our Eurostar train due to complete traffic chaos caused by a parade!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dani64MagnagoItalia
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel in latin quartier cleaning and with excelent sevice. The hotel is in the centre of latin quartier e near monuments . The staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very French, great location and wonderful service......who could ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller63
Reviews.Content: I took a long time to find a hotel and was glad to find Residence Henri 4. The front desk staff were great...........friendly............recommending good places to eat and it felt good to get 'home' after the end of a long day walking. Yes. I want to go back..............location was good but from Gare du Nord I would go to Cite metro rather than St. Michel as a nicer walk.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to see Paris”
Reviews.Author: LancsLad2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the staff are all very pleasant and helpful. The kitchenette is a good feature for breakfasts and snacks, though a few more utensils would be useful. Our room was missing a corkscrew, but was supplied when asked for. Given it's location it is very good value. The rooms were spotless. Lots of good restaurants near by. The concierge booked us into the Petit Prince de Paris, which is 5 mins walk away and was excellent. An excellent base to explore Paris as it is close to a number of very useful bus routes to get you around. Our party was parents and 2 girls 6 and 10. The girls liked going around on the bus rather than the metro. Also easy to get to/from Disneyland, bus to Gare du Lyon and then the RER.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Radu76
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this small parisian hotel. It is very good positioned (near Saint Germain and Saint Michael boulevards) and it was quite easy to reach it from the airport, just took RER B, without any other line change, followed by a 5-6 minutes walk. Also liked the rooms which are quite big (for Paris standards) and very clean. Each room has a nice small balcony decorated with flowers, where you can drink a glass of wine or enjoy a delicious french cake. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: poshpa
Reviews.Content: Chose Henri IV based on other Tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Largest we have stayed in in Paris. Kitchenette was very useful following a long day's sightseeing. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Hotel is well placed for getting around the city either on foot or by Metro. Lots of restaurants and bars in immediate area. If we come back to Paris will definitely return to Henri IV.

Reviews.Title: “J'envie Henri 4......................:)”
Reviews.Author: Guy4
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I don't feel like that tonight. It's a fantastic hotel, well located and """" The staff is the most frendly I have encounter """""

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for location, ambience and service”
Reviews.Author: GuillaumeBristol
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff greeted us and assisted us through our two night stay. Real Paris feel to the hotel and its rooms and variety of authentic bars and restaurants within very easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and charming place.”
Reviews.Author: Summerrose23
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, with an attentive staff, in a great location. The rooms are large and elegantly appointed. We have stayed in many hotels in Paris and this is the best situation we have yet experienced. The sofa bed was exceptionally comfortable, which often is not the case in apartment/hotels. And, there was a small balcony which overlooked a lovely park. We all highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service, great accomodation and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleach4
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely long weekend in this great hotel. Location is excellent just a short walk from Metro & RER stations, with some nice cafes & restaurants very close by, a Saturday market around the corner and the Seine on your doorstep. PERFECT. The staff were all friendly, helpful and personable. Don't leave Paris without hiring a bike - it was so easy to drop them off at nike station elsewhere in the city and then pick another one up whenever we wanted - made our trip!! Go to the top flooe of Galleries Lafeyette for amazing (and FREE) views of the city and a great rooftop cafe !!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dcat8dfish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were only in Paris for 1 night as it was a layover for his business trip to Singapore, so we weren't looking for something too expensive but quaint and that captured the feel of Paris. We found the hotel on TripAdvisor and although we were finding some that cost a bit less, the pictures of the hotel had me hooked; it was exactly what I was looking for - quaint. We were in a cute little room (room #1) which is on the first floor literally right behind the font desk. I was a little concerned that we'd hear noise from the lobby, but we didn't. The hotel is tucked back on a dead end street, so even though our room had a window right out to the sidewalk, again, we didn't hear any noise. The only noise we did hear was the tower bell that seems to be across the street - it is a little excessive at noon, but oh well. The hotel itself didn't seem too large, and was a bit narrow. I was actually quite relieved that we were on the first floor because the stairs were quite narrow and looked like would have been a tight squeeze trying to get out luggage up it - and they don't have an elevator. The location of the hotel turned out to be great; it was maybe a 5 min walk to Notre Dame, cafes, boulangeries, subway stops, etc. We booked a bike tour called 'Bike About Tours' (which was about 4 hours, but absolutely wonderful - I definitely recommend it) which met at Nortre Dame, so it was nice that we didn't have to travel far to meet up with everyone. Overall, our one night in Paris was amazing, and the hotel was a large part of that...I only which I had more time to spend there!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Quartier Latin life.”
Reviews.Author: ArmchairDreamer
Reviews.Content: Great location. We found very nice bakery, charcuterie, fromagerie and wine shop around Pl. Maubert, and enjoyed in-room dining as well as good bistros there. The room (quadruple) was a bit smaller than expected, though a writing table and mini-kitchen helped our dining. Room cleaning was perfect, and the other service was minimal but rendered upon requests. We felt as if we are staying in our own apartment. We went to the hotel breakfast room in the windowless basement in the first morning, but chose to have our own.

Reviews.Title: “intimate hotel in a big city”
Reviews.Author: redheadKitchener_ON
Reviews.Content: I cannot add much more to the other reviews as they cover everything I would have to say about Residence Henri IV. I can just surmise that the enthusiasm everyone seems to share, is that in a beautiful and sometimes completely overwhelming city that is an endless feast for the eyes and the stomach, Henri IV is a lovely quiet intimate hotel that is a pleasure to come back to at the end of the day. If you want all the flash of the large hotels then this is not the place for you, if you are looking for a charming, friendly and peaceful place to stay while in Paris, no need to look any further. Our 6 nights were wonderful and we cannot wait to return. Thanks to all the staff !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hbryson
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed at the hotel for five days in early August, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is close to Notre Dame cathedral and to the Seine waterfront. Many good restaurants are nearby, and we did not need a car to get round. Hotel staff was very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service in a perfect Paris setting”
Reviews.Author: filnut
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Residence Henri 4. We found the hotel to be reflective of central Paris. The rooms accomodated our family of four. They were beautiful with their marble fireplaces and moulding, and historically french decor. We had a patio, which looked the greenspace of the school across the street. The street was relatively quiet for Paris. The staff at the hotel was accomodating and professional. Overall, it was a lovely and convenient place to stay. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quiet hotel in a great Latin Quarter location”
Reviews.Author: jk3newyork
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 2 friends, and all of us loved staying at this hotel. Our room was more like a suite with 2 separate bedrooms, small balconies, and a small fridge/kitchen area. The bathroom was clean and filled with the usual amenities, and adequately spacious. The decor was very classically French, and everyone who worked at the hotel was very friendly, polite, and helpful. The location is perfect, as Notre Dame and the Seine is nearby, and all the sights are within walking distance. The only small complaint I could have was that there were technical difficulties with the hotel's phone one night, so the hotel front desk could not connect me to an incoming call from the U.S. Not a big deal though--everything else was near perfect for the price. This hotel isn't one of those big, glamorous, chain hotels though, so don't go here thinking that you'll get those kinds of amenities. I think there are only a small number or rooms here total, and I don't know if there is a restaurant/room service. It was more like a charming small boutique hotel/apartment building.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xavke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the great lux but this is compensated by his location ,no noise in the evenings and nights ,very calm, we slept very well . The breakfast is not so good ,take your breakfast outside the hotel ,also because you are eaten in the underground minus 1 ,not so pleasant . But if we come back in the futur we choose the same hotel due to his location to the notre dame and the Marais . The Marais is very nice ,nice shops and restaurants ,you don't need the champs elysÃ©e ...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: smithatnt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week at the Residence Henri 4 with our two teenage daughters, and overall we loved it. The location is ideal, being close to countless places to eat, as well as a smattering of regular businesses that gave us a good feel for what "normal" residents would use in the city. We were amused at the little cinema around the corner showing old Clint Eastwood movies dubbed in French ("Inspecteur Harry"). Being at the end of Rue des Bernardins, the hotel is reasonably quiet, and it overlooks a pretty little park. On the negative side, the room temperature was rather warm in the Summer, and turning down the thermostat didn't seem to do any good, but in fairness, we never asked the staff to do anything about it, since opening the windows provided a nice breeze. Also, no coffeepot was provided in the mini kitchen, which my wife would have appreciated in the mornings. As everyone has mentioned, the staff is great, speaks English well, and they were very helpful with everything we asked. We would also recommend eating at Cafe Le Soufflot just down the hill from the Pantheon--great outdoor seating with views of both the Pantheon and Eiffel Tower, great service and food for reasonable prices

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, clean and comfortable hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Travelteenmom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel solely on the recommendation of tripadviser travelers and we were not disappointed! We had a family 2-room apartment (two connected rooms with a double futon in one and two singles in another), which was perfect for our family of four. The rooms are not big (are they ever in Paris?), but the layout worked well for us. The fact that we had a half refrigerator, hotplate and small sink to use for breakfasts and light meals was a big plus. And our two teenagers loved the location -- right near the Sorbonne (so lots of young people around) and within walking distance to Notre Dame. We were apprehensive about the lack of A/C, but it never got too hot...and we were there in mid-summer. We thought this hotel was very suited to our needs as a family and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Randallini
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. A bit pricey as they charged 30Euros extra for the 2 kids per night. (Total 240Euros/night) The room was good, well air conditioned and big enough for the 2 kids to have their own space. Nice to have kitchennete also. The staff was helpful too. The location is excellent for the Metro and lots of patisseries, pizza, corner store, cafes very close by. 15 min walk to Notre Dame and close to the Batobus (boat bus)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, beautiful building, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: toxic3
Reviews.Content: The hotel residence henri iv was in the perfect location and just how it looked in the brochure, which was nice. So often hotels look beautiful in the brochure but are a disappointment when you arrive. This hotel was even better than the photo's. Rooms were lovely, and again, we were not put in a less appealing room at the back with no views, which often happens. We were on the front of the building in a room that you see in the brochure. Typical beautiful Parisian building, beautiful rooms inside. We were pleased that luggage could be held for us as we were in Paris for a full last day so it was a relief to be able to leave our luggage in a safe place while we enjoyed our last day once we had checked out. Staff were very friendly are very accommodating to our lack of French, even when we booked a double room instead of a twin by mistake. I could not fault the hotel in any way, would definately recommend it to anyone and we hope to return again to the hotel around xmas time, we are not even going to try to find somewhere cheaper to stay as we liked this place so much.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ccmanly
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights at Residence Henri IV and recommend it - we felt very much at home there. Our room, number 402 had a small kitchen, living room, bedroom and bathroom - plus a balcony, everything we needed. The hotel has charm - it felt like a large home with house guests, rather than a chain style hotel. Lots of advice from the front desk - and always a welcoming smile. It is in a great location - five minutes to Maubert markets, a few more to Notre Dame and the Seine. Metro stops are also only a few minutes away. We did not have breakfast there as there are so many cafes in the area - recommend the Kayser cafe on Rue Monge. And great value - we took advantage of a summer discount and felt the rate was very reasonable, given the rooms we enjoyed. We will always go back to the Residence Henri IV - it is a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely hotel centrally located and extremely helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights from 23rd July and were really impressed both with the size of the room and bathroom and the staff. We have also stayed at the Hotel Gregoire and Hotel de Nice each of which were good in their own way but the rooms were much smaller. We had room 50 which had a tiny balcony with a table, and the two chairs in the room just about fitted in, and it also had a nice big bathroom with bath and shower and a fridge and hotplate with minimal cutlery and crockery supplied. We would definitely go to this hotel again. It is situated in the Latin Quarter and there are lots of places to eat around and a wonderful cheese shop just down the road. We ate at La petite cour the night of our anniversary and La Bucherie de Notre Dame on our last night and both were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking hotel with kitchenettes”
Reviews.Author: RobertD1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with my kids and my parents. We had the "superior" room which has a separate bedroom and a living room with a sofa bed + a tiny kitchenette. My parents had the standard room on the same floor which also had a kitchenette. Both rooms had private bathrooms. There are only two rooms per floor, so we had the whole floor to ourselves. You have many hotels to choose from in Paris. Some are much more expensive than Henri IV, others are much cheaper. Residence Henri IV has rooms for 4 people, is non-smoking and has kitchenettes. Among hotels with those features, this is one of the least expensive. The neighborhood is nice with a nice little park across the street with a play structure for the kids. Quite close to Notre Dame and other attractions, although we didn't find ourselves walking South or East very much. The location is very quiet. Paris streets can be noisy, but this hotel is at the dead end of rue des Bernardins and it has double-paned windows. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are very nice. The rooms aren't huge, but there was plenty of space for our family. The hotel has a very small and slow elevator. We usually used the spiral staircase, which can make you dizzy after a few floors. WiFi is included in the price and their telephone rates are very reasonable (much cheaper than our cell phone). They have a small breakfast room (for extra cost), but we didn't use it since it's easy to eat in the room. There are small several markets and bakeries within a few blocks. Overall, we loved this place and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: elizesteyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 18 year old son stayed here for 2 nights in July. We had two linked rooms and a kitchenette and a little balcony with a table. The views were lovely and the situation perfect. Metros and restaurants nearby and many major sights within easy walking distance. We loved the little fridge to cool drinks or breakfast items. I would have liked the addition of a kettle, but you could boil water on the stove. The rooms were small, but nicely decorated and clean and tidy. If possible I would love to stay here without a child, which would give you a very roomy suite. The only downside, which was not really a problem for us, was that the room was not yet ready at 12h00 and we had to wait at a nearby restaurant for over an hour. The reception staff were very friendly and assisted with taxi and shuttle bookings. I would definately stay here again and I must add that I have stayed at many hotels in Paris as my daughter lives there. We also spent a night at the Hotel Grand Ecoles, which was less expensive and had the advantage of a lovely private courtyard. The restaurant Fetes Galantes that was recommended by Tripadvisor did not impress us. Tiny, tacky and terrible service, but the food, when it finally arrived was very good and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “little nice hotel, central place in the middle of paris”
Reviews.Author: LillyVienna
Reviews.Content: charming small apartement, two bed rooms, ideal with a child, very good located, lot of restaurants a food step around, closed to Notre Dame, walking distance to Louvre. Breakfast is good, we would come again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel! Good location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: julia028
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located in a great area of Paris, and because tucked away in a cul de sac, very quiet in spite of being so central. The room was lovely - old fashioned in style but with everything we needed, with an en suite and all very clean. The service was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: fourdarlings1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week on the 6th floor at this hotel. It was charming and very quiet-at a dead end of a road. It was central to metro and RER stops and you could walk to all of the major attractions. The best patiserrie-Eric Kayser-was just a block away. The only negative would be that if the aircontioning was on in the eveing it was blowing right on the head of the bed on our faces. We would not hesitate to return. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable alternative to large chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: UsaFrancophone
Reviews.Content: We had an apartment which would have been very comfortable for two but was rather cramped for the three of us, making it difficult to enjoy its attractive appointments. We did not use the kitchenette; if we had wanted to eat in there would not have been enough space to do so. The breakfast room was cozy and the service excellent. The staff at the front desk were pleasant and helpful. While the hotel is not far from the Luxembourg Garden, the Isles de la CitÃ© and St-Louis, the Latin Quarter, etc., its immediate surroundings have little to offer. All the other guests we encountered were native speakers of English--which is not why I went fo France.

Reviews.Title: “Charming friendly hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: MayaCapeTown
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, walkable to most places and always had a friendly, helpful english speaking person at reception. We had a big, extremely comfortable room. The decor is lovely and quite typically french which I liked. We had breakfast in bed each morning which was also a great treat!! It was also very quiet which is impoprtant to me.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RJoseph
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Henri IV for five nights in early June. Our stay was excellent. We had a family room for four. The room was spacious and clean, the location was very good, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Bottom line: I would not hesitate to stay again at the Henri IV and do not hesitate in recommending it to others, especially those needing a good-sized family room because of children.

Reviews.Title: “Abolutely perfectly stylish!”
Reviews.Author: Rachael564
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond wonderful. The room was large, clean and very stylish! I could have just moved in. The personnel were very friendly and helped us make lunch and dinner recommendations. We were so happy with our hotel choice....we will make it back to Paris and Henry IV! My only complaint...they need better coffee.

Reviews.Title: “we will return”
Reviews.Author: mojumi
Reviews.Content: To sum up: We had a lovely week-long stay at the Henri 4. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean, tidy, and quiet. The location was excellent. We were originally placed in room #1 on the lobby floor, with the entrance to the room just beyond the front desk. Although that room was quite large and had been recently remodeled, I found it was too loud and I did not like being at street level. The staff moved us immediately to the second floor without any problems. Our room on the second floor was just what we wished. Although it was slightly smaller, it had long windows at both ends overlooking both the street (and park) in front and the courtyard in back. There was a small balcony big enough for two chairs and a table. The bed was quite hard but the room was very quiet. The in-room kitchenette was very convenient. We had breakfast in the room one morning. I would not recommend the hotel breakfast. Although the cost was about the same as breakfast in one of the cafes nearby, the coffee and croissants were not as good. Of course, it was nice to have coffee on the balcony. The hotel is convenient to the Maubert-Mutualite Metro stop and a very short walk from Notre Dame in one direction, and the Pantheon, Jardin Luxembourg, etc in the other. We particularly enjoyed one of the nearby cafes, as well as the market shops just down the street (wine, cheese, meats, bread ... ) The air conditioning was turned on the second day of our stay, although the breeze from the windows made it largely uneeded. All said, this was just what we wanted from our hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: sansblague
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights in June as did our niece. We found the accommodations and staff perfectly suited to our needs, the location very convenient. We were very tired from our trans-Atlantic trip and appreciated having the option of having a sandwich and fruit in our room (fridge and dishes provided in our unit). We found the staff very responsive and most gracious in providing directions and assistance. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Straight in the middle of history”
Reviews.Author: luntrashu
Reviews.Content: Communication, promptitude and cleanliness. Great stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the last leg of our trip”
Reviews.Author: kelleyprof
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I took a 2-week graduation trip to Europe. It's not our usual style, but we did 4 countries in about 16 days. It was absolutely wonderful to spend the last leg of our trip in a place with character AND a kitchenette. After dining in restaurants for two weeks, it was nice to have more options with a refrigerator, stove sink and dishes. Our room (Henri IV) easily accomodated 3 to 4 people. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was perfectly adequate (great shower, nice deep tub, a window), great climate control and a wonderful amount of space for a Paris hotel. In addition, each room had character - a non-working fireplace in each room, fun moldings on the walls and ceiling. In adition to the comfortable room, the staff was delightful - very helpful and reliable. The location was quiet, and within a few blocks of two key subway lines. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Henri IV.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, quiet”
Reviews.Author: texasm0mma
Reviews.Content: My 33 year old daughter and I had a wonderful time at this hotel, location was great. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast left a little to be desired. I should have asked them if they could deliver coffee to the room as that is what I really want when I get up. I think thery probably would have done it. The room was a little small, but that is the norm for Paris, especially to an American. I would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in beautiful Paris.”
Reviews.Author: sophed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Henri 4 based on reviews on Trip Advisor and couldn't of been happier with our choice.I hadn't been to Paris since the early 80's so was happy to stay somewhere so lovely that was in such a fantastic position, close to the Seine for the highly recommended Batobus and Notre Dame and right in the thick of the Latin Quarter, close to the metro and with lots of cafes and markets all around. We really enjoyed the hotel itself as it was SO French - just what I wanted as we were in Paris. The rooms were very luxurious and spacious for our family. The children (19 and 17) shared a very comfortable pull out sofa and it was great to have a balcony. The staff were also fantastic, welcoming and helpful. We found Qaisar to be especially helpful. My children got stuck in the lift (which didn't bother them in the slightest) and Qaisar had the technician there in record time - my husband and I thought he must of been right outside the door the reaction time was so fast! When you travel (especially all the way from Australia so you can't do it every day) it's so important to be happy with where you stay and we were more than that. It helped to make our stay in Paris really wonderful and memorable and we will definitely recommend Henri 4 (actually I have to several friends already!) and stay there again when we go back to beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly hotel , good value, and great location near Notre Dame.”
Reviews.Author: bobanddorothy
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here. The hotel is in a great location, 1/2 mi south of Notre Dame in the Latin Quarter on the Rive Gauche. It is on a quiet street just off the Rue D'Ecole, but very near to restaurants, stores and historic sites. 2 subway stops are within a 5 minute walk, and it's 10 minutes to the Seine, and about a 20 minute walk to the Louvre. The desk is staffed 24/7, and all the staff were knowledgable, friendly, and spoke at least basic English. We arrived at 8:30 am, and had a room by 9:30. Our airport transfer was arranged by the hotel, and was excellent. The hotel is in a charming old building, which does have an elevator and is nonsmoking. The room was comfortable and quiet, and had an individual AC unit. The bathroom was modern and clean. Decorating was simple but tasteful, and perfectly fine for the reasonable price of the room. We had a king-sized bed, but most are queen-sized. Free wireless internet is included, and there is a laptop you can borrow if you don't bring your own. We had the continental breakfast on 4 days for 8 euros pp. Juice, coffee (a whole pot, unlike the cafes!), fresh bread and pastry, and fresh fruit were included, with eggs available for an extra fee. We would not hesitate to stay here again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: anoels47
Reviews.Content: Located in the Latin Quarter, Henri 4 is convenient for visiting the museums, as well as shopping and dining. Bread, cheese, and wine shops are close by, and my husband and I enjoyed our best meals on our terrace. Given the excellent location, ambiance, elegant furnishings, smoke-fee environment, amenities (hassle-free internet access) and helpful staff, Henri 4 is a deal at twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, charming rooms, excellent location. Our refuge in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: whoobie1
Reviews.Content: We arrived harried from dragging our luggage through the RER/Metro system and were greeted by the nicest man working in reception. He informed us that he had upgraded our room without a charge because they noticed that we had a 3 year old child with us. He said this room would give us more space (it did!!!) and they didn't want us to have to go up and down stairs with our stroller. VERY thoughtful. He then directed us to an amazing restaurant with wonderful food and great service for lunch. We had not done enough homework on our French skills so we were grateful for his advice. The room was just darling and quiet, the large king size bed was very comfortable (my son slept on the settee and we were well rested for our adventures. We ordered breakfast and appreciated the convenience on the last day. The man in reception also informed us that Monday was holiday (which we would not have known) and were able to factor this in to our travel plans back to the airport to leave enough time. In all, it was an amazing place to stay in Paris. We will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful quiet place in the heart of the town”
Reviews.Author: RomaLorenzo
Reviews.Content: Room clean and confortable. The builing was built in the second part of the 19 th century and inside everything look like an old house. We travelled with two children and had a double room with a small kitchen (really useful for breakfast) .The area is the best in the town, full of restaurants, shops and people, but the hotel is in a very quiet street with no traffic. No doubt we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff - 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Wags4
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe with our kids - hotel had to be clean and quiet - friendly staff was a bonus! The staff was very helpful and was nice to get a friendly greeting as we came and went. Beds were very comfortable, rooms clean, GREAT bathroom with large shower. Hotel is back from the main street in a quiet culdesac - very quiet, no problems at night. And, the location was perfect! Walkable to Notre Dame, Louvre, fun Latin Qtr street shopping/restaurants and close to metro stop. We were thrilled we stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quaint, well located, and with good value.”
Reviews.Author: BroussardLA
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with Hotel Residence Henri 4th. It was exactly what we hoped for, situated in a great location on a cul de sac, making this hotel quieter than most, with a friendly, accomodating staff. There is a Metro stop a couple of blocks away which was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good...if u know how to laugh!”
Reviews.Author: Charli_R_87
Reviews.Content: First off this hotel is in a great location, esp for someone like me who loves heels and short distances, Notre Dame is a stones throw away, as are the metro stations. It is definately not for those fond of modern lifestyle however, which is what i mean by being able to laugh about it all...the wallpaper on the walls is material covered foam (im not lying), the safety deposit box was probably the first ever invented and could only be used by using a towel to grip it with, and the lock on the bathroom door stuck, leaving me inside the bathroom for twenty odd minutes, with me and my boyfriend on the other side, in hysterics...it was not locked for the remainder of the trip. The eerie paintings on the wall were also too much for me and were removed and hidden from sight each night before i went to sleep...if you go here you'll understand! The elevator is also a bit dodge, it just about fits 2 people and luggage, and gives u whiplash everytime it stops. All that being said, you do get what you pay for, with room service and clean sheets each day, as well as a computer to use free of charge when wanting to access the internet. most of the staff were also helpful and suggested several nice restaurants...and some not nice ones. But altogether was a comfortable stay and in a city thats so expensive, it certainly did the job!

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel with french character in a great Parisian location”
Reviews.Author: frenchbully
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The room was comfortable,clean and had charm.Loved the deep bathtub. The staff is friendly,nice and helpful.
