Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TyChgo
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to Paris for her first time out of the country and we decided that we would spend more on food and attractions rather than shelling out for expensive hotel rooms. We actually decided on splitting one room and needed two separate beds - which is sometimes difficult to translate when you don't speak the language. I have to say that Hotel Residence Henri 4 delivered. The rates were very competitive and I feel we got a very good value for the quality of the room and the location. Before we left for Paris, I requested via email, two separate twin beds and they confirmed almost immediately. I printed it off just in case I would have a problem and I did not - it was confirmed as soon as we arrived. The staff is very accommodating and luckily for me, spoke English without faulting me for not being able to speak French. They put us on the ground/main floor, which I wasn't happy about at first but they assured me it was a nice room and that if I wasn't satisfied, they would try to move me the next nice. It wasn't necessary at all. Very clean room, comfortable beds, tv, kitchenette, and modern bath with hand held shower attachment. They replaced towels and toiletries daily and always had the room clean. A safe was included in the room. They do request that you leave your key, which is nice since they are staff 24 hours. The staff was great. They were quick to accommodate with restaurant suggestions, make reservations, give directions and recommend a phone option for calling home. They have a special international rate direct from the hotel which is as inexpensive as an international calling card. They also have free wi-fi. The hotel is situated in the Latin Quarter and is a few blocks off of the St. Micheal RER stop, which makes it easy to get to/from the CDG airport. It's also on a nice Metro line (#10 -Mo stop Maubert Mutualite) with great "on the go" food choices and an open market that runs at least twice a week. Another huge plus is that it's two blocks from the best baguette in Paris - Eric Kayser (Rue Monge I believe). One more thing, a wine shop at the end of the block. My mom loved everything about Paris and having to not worry about the hotel experience is worth a lot. I would highly recommend this place as a moderately priced, friendly hotel room in a great location. Thanks much.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was superbly located & was ideal for our family of four”
Reviews.Author: Gaz049
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the cleanliness of the Hotel and by the friendly people at reception. The rooms were ideal for a small family and not too small. As the hotel is located at the end of a dead end street it is very quiet. Its location is excellent with the Pantheon & Notre Dam Cathederal in close proximity. We thoroughly enjoyed our four day stay at the Henri IV Hotel and look forward to returning Gary O'Brien, Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Superb Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: LizWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This superb hotel's decor is stunning and oh so French! Show home clean, impeccable service, and the location is perfect - just blocks from Notre Dame and the Pantheon. We even walked to the Louvre from here. There is a microwave, fridge, stove top, sink, lovely dishes, and great attention to detail. The bath tub and shower were the best we experienced in France. Large flat screen TV, accessibe internet. This hotel is a dream and worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Cavanman007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming and so well situated for seeing Paris at its best. The bedroom was very comfortable and all the bedrooms so cutely named. What makes the hotel is the staff. All staff were so pleasant and did everything possible to make our four day stay with them (to view Paris) such a wonderful experience. Breakfast daily was a delight with our attendant making our day commence with a smile and good wishes for an enjoyable day. I have only one request - please make sure the shower in our room is in better working order for the next guest

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: mvatshel
Reviews.Content: We had a charming little appartement perfect for our family of 4. Nice and clean and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: bearwald
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families on a tiny street right off the rue du ecole and rue monge. We had an "apartment" on the 2nd floor with two rooms, a very nice bathroom and tiny kitchenette for our two adults and two children. Don't be put off by the "sofa bed". This was a very comfortable double bed. Small balcony for sitting out overlooking the adjacent small park. Small grocery around the corner and up a few blocks on Rue Monge. Latin quarter restaurants are a few short blocks away. Three or four blocks down hill to Notre Dame and the Ile de Cite. Wonderful service at breakfast and whenever we went in or out. Could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hideaway in a busy City”
Reviews.Author: misswing
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a week at Residence Henri IV in Paris and it was fantastic! I could go on and on about how much I loved Paris, but would like to focus on this little Hotel in the Latin Quarter instead. Henri IV is located in a little cul-de-sac about 3-4 blocks from the Siene River and Notre Dame. It it hard to put location in perspective looking at a map when you haven't been to Paris but it is very centrally located and close to 2 different Metro stations. It is about a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, 15-20 minute walk to the Louvre........would recommend using the Metro for the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysees. There were lots of great restaurants in the area, a couple on the next street over. The Tibet and Thai Restaurants were really good and we also liked the little cafe/oub "Authenic Pub" for a relatively cheap beer and food. We selected this hotel as it was highly rated on Trip Advisor and we were happy we did. We had a room on the top floor (I would say an attic type room) with 2 little balconys which we utilized each day. The hotel looks onto a little park so very quiet and private. The bathroom was very large for Europe with a bath as well! We really enjoyed the kitchenette and used it for breakfast every morning. The only downside wa sthat the wireless internet service does not work as well on the top floor so we would take our laptop down to the parlor which was fine as no one else was there and we could talk with the front desk person and ask lots of questions. We would stay here again the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming very french hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: llw078
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Henri IV for 6 nights. Our room was on the 6th floor, very private and roomy for Paris while providing a very french atmosphere. We found the hotel easy to find, we walked over from the RER stop at St. Michel by Notre Dame. The bathroom was immaculate and there was a tub, shower and nice soaps/bathsalts after walking all around Paris. We had two french windows that made the room very bright and opened onto little balconies (too cold for our visit, but likely wonderful when warm). The breakfast delivered to our room was lovely and on time. The staff was very helpful. They even had a laptop for guests to use, in addition to free internet. We had a lovely romantic stay in this charming very french hotel. We booked a special on spring rates through the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Little Paris Apartment of your Dreams”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl06
Reviews.Content: Don't we all have dreams of a little apartment in Paris on the Left Bank? We'll, this is as close as it gets, and it has all the services and amenities of a hotel with a much higher star rating. Your room will be charming and spacious. Your sheets and towels are changed daily and your bathroom just sparkles! You will have a kitchenette, so you can bring home treats from the local shops. You even have a cinema just around the corner that shows lots of English-language films. Other perks: Wi-Fi reached the 5th floor most of the time, two closets, lovely soap and bath gel, desk for work, table for dining, Place Maubert and Boulevard Saint Germaine is a five minute walk for Metro and buses and taxis, sincere and lovely staff members will endure your attempts at French conversation and help you with any problems that arise. You will just love Residence Henri IV!

Reviews.Title: “Small clean, quaint hotel..no frills but very friendly staff walking distance to Notre Dame and Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: DublinKeithB
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was quite difficult to find initially as its sort of hidden away on a side street. My first impression was that it was quite small (not really a reception area - more of a desk to stand at). I was there with my girlfriend for our first time in Paris so i was hoping for somthing more colourful (the website pictures are out of date and its definitely not as shiny and new as it looks). In saying all that though, the rooms were fine and the staff were absolutely brilliant - very friendly and restaurants they recommended were beautful and very reasonable priced. I got the spring deal with reduced room prices - i think it was around â‚¬125 for the room per night. I definitely would not pay more than that even taking into account the prices of French Hotels.. In summary, good location close to Notre Dame and Metro station 5mins walk away, brillaint staff but maybe the place needs to be brightened up a bit. I'd recommend if the rooms were â‚¬100 - â‚¬125 per night

Reviews.Title: “An ideal city break!”
Reviews.Author: lb-mp
Reviews.Content: The Henry 4th hotel is in a great location. A small, friendly hotel within walking distance to Notre Dame and the Pantheon. The hotel staff were very friendly, offering tips on where to eat out. The room was large enough, modern and clean. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced and it was brought to our room. Would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: chimperoonie
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room had a balcony, a little kitchenette, and upholstered walls :) The location is amazing so we very rarely had to take transport anywhere, the Pantheon is round the corner and Notre Dame is down the road. When I come back to Paris, I will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: laurieann
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the Henri 4. We stayed in room # 1 for 3 nights and since we booked at the last minute, we had to switch rooms for our last night to room # 32. Both were spotlessly clean and bright. The tiny fridge was very useful for our yogurt, juice and leftover Chinese food. Also the microwave came in handy. The 3rd bed in room #1 was comfortable, but made for someone my height or shorter. I am 5'3". The laptop computer in the lobby was very handy for quick email checks. My thanks again to the wonderful staff, especially Qaisar. I travel at least 4 times a year to Paris on holiday. The Henri 4 is my new favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, elegant and quiet..”
Reviews.Author: Traval013
Reviews.Content: All the wonderful things you've read about this hotel are true. We weren't sure if the apartment (bedroom and separate lounge room with futon bed) would be large enough for 2 couples, but were very pleasantly surprised. The lounge area was fine and the fold out bed all made up when we arrived and very comfortable. There's a hall area to the left of the rooms, so you don't have to walk through the bedroom to get to the bath. It was too cold when we were there to eat breakfast on the balcony but it would be lovely in warmer weather to dine there. The small breakfast room was in the basement but nicely decorated and had excellent coffee. I would definitely recommend this hotel and it's very economical if you're 2 couples sharing the double room. The location is excellent with lots of shops, restaurants and metro stops in an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: mattia170
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife use to come often to Paris. This time we decided for a romantinc small hotel instead of being guested by our friends. The Inn is very well located (5/10 minutes walk from Notre Dame). It has nice and quiet rooms. The breakfast is nothing special ( the standards in Paris are not high) but you can make it by your self in the little kitchen in the room. I am already recommending it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Meiwenti37
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Henri IV taking advantage of a special winter promotion. Our room was clean and comfortable with simple cooking facilities. The bed was large and comfortable with lovely cotton sheets, changed each day. The hotel is in a very good location, within walkinig distance of all the main attractions. There are many shops and restaurents close by, so doing a little self-catering was no problem. Would we stay there again? Yes and we'd recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Friendly, Fab Location, Lovely rooms!”
Reviews.Author: CTasman
Reviews.Content: The Residence Henri IV is close to everything. Every one is very helpful and friendly, although Hicham, the concierge, is a real gem! The room was big, clean, the bath bright, lovely french windows, very quiet for being right in the middle of Paris, decent breakfast for the price. What else can I say about a perfect place to stay in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “WoW!”
Reviews.Author: Lhaz
Reviews.Content: Our room was VERY beautiful, comfortable, clean, and cozy!! My girlfriends and I were in Paris only for a night after a trip to Lourdes, and we wanted to splurge on a nice hotel that really makes us feel we are in Paris. We weren't disappointed with Henry 4! We didn't plan ahead for Paris, but from this hotel, we were able to find our way easily to Norte Dame, Latin Quarter, and we took the train to Eiffel Tower, Musee de Orsay, and Les Invalides -- all in one afternoon! The hotel arranged for a shuttle pick up for us to CDG airport the next day. The traffic was VERY bad, and the shuttle picked up a couple more passengers from other locations. We thought we were going to miss our flight! So, plan ahead if you are going to the airport from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and enjoyable stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: taju
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in our preferred area of Paris, and was very quiet despite being close to a main busy road. The location was very convenient to most places we had planned to visit. We had such busy days sightseeing and walking around Paris, it was a treat to come back to a quiet hotel to relax. The staff were always very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maxinePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the wonderful, very helpful and smart staff! We are happy our friends found this hotel for us and we recommend to other travelers! The little kitchenette in each room helped us with my husband's beer and my yogurt and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one to stay at”
Reviews.Author: vl3
Reviews.Content: Great location, quiet little street - no through traffic. Staff were lovely, just lovely - all of them. So helpful and friendly - a pleasure to talk to. Plenty of good restaurants close-by so always somewhere to eat. 5 minutes walk and you are looking at Notre Dame and walking along the Seine. Hard to imagine a better location. Hotel is beutiful, very elegent, Only drawback in our room was the mattress - a little old so not terribly comfortable. Other than that great. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Something different...nice and great value!”
Reviews.Author: jialoong
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the hotel and enjoyed it. Had a plesant surprise when i got into the room. The decor were different and gives you a nostalgic feel. Room is spacious (i booked a superior room) for the price paid and also cosidering that this is Paris (previous hotels i stayed was more expensive, smaller and not well maintained). It was also clean and well maintained. We were able to get wireless internet in our room (3rd floor) The heater works well. Bathroom is big and clean. Reception staff were all nice; Ordile was exceptionally warm and helpful and so was Hicham. We had a miscommunication with a temporary reception staff but even though he come across as slightly aloof, he was still very helpful. Nice location too; near the metro, there's a nice bakery nearby(Eric Kayser) and also a self service laundry all within 3 to 5 mins at a leaisure walking pace.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Henri IV ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: sank0
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews about this hotel I booked a 1 night stay for my wife and I. Too often after reading reviews expectations are high and disappointment follows but this hotel ticked all the boxes. Excellent location, just off the main Rue des Ecoles so not too noisy - 5-10 minutes walk from Notre Dame , lots of character, clean rooms and very friendly staff. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good service”
Reviews.Author: PierreLeGuide
Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel in good location in the Latin Quarter, between the Pantheon and the Blvd. St. Germain. In a small cul-de-sac off the busier Rue des Ecoles, which makes it very quiet, yet easily accessible to services on the main streets. We had a Superior Room, which is a small suite, with two rooms and a small galley kitchen, complete with cooktop, micro-wave, and small refrigerator. Room was clean, and nicely decorated. Staff was very friendly, and willing to make reservations for dinner, etc. Only reservations were: inadequate storage space in the bedroom: one armoire for hanging clothes, but no bureau for shirts, etc. In addition, lighting was very dim, making it hard to read at night. Overall, a very nice hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Residence Henri 4 - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: OptDW
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a favorite Paris location! The apartment was very comfortable and lovely, bigger than Parisian hotel rooms we had in the past. We travelled with a baby and having a small kitchenette was excellent for us. The staff were very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good by Paris standards”
Reviews.Author: LLSL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights just before Christmas. It's a charming hotel in a great location, just off the street so we didn't get much street noise. The view we got from our window was quite typically Parisian. We got a comfortable and prettily furnished double bedroom, and our son slept on a single bed in the living room. It was very good to have the extra space, as Paris hotels can be really pokey. There was a galley kitchen, but rather disappointingly, no coffee or tea making facilities - really basic. The breakfast they offered (croissant and coffee) cost 8 euros, which we thought was a bit steep - but really we found we couldn't do any better in nearby cafes - so now we have the impression that Parisians are just a bit mean about breakfast! We had to wait till we were dressed and had found a cafe to have our shot of caffeine each morning - really tough! We also had a quite a lot of internal noise - mostly children - not sure if they were in our hotel or in an adjoining apartment, but overall the stay was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lau86
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Henri 4 is a lovely traditional hotel, we stayed for two nights room was comfortable and well catered to all our needs, all the staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel has a brilliant location being just 2 mins walk from the patheon, 10 mins walk from notre dame and 15-20 mins from the Louvre. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to visit and explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Parisian retreat”
Reviews.Author: Bkee
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this lovely hotel, the staff were very helpful, polite and spoke English. The one bedroom suite was perfect for our young family, with our 2 girls 4 and 6 sharing the sofa bed. There are modest basic kitchen facilities which are fine for short stays and simple meals. The hotel was in a lovely area and only a short walk from anything you might need including a market and the metro. We would recommend to others as the price relative other hotels in Paris was reasonable, but offers a more unique Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday break”
Reviews.Author: Twinkleknees
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel in the Latin Quarter. Staff very friendly and efficient, accomodation really good quality. Area quiet but very authentic, would deffinately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Paris”
Reviews.Author: H0rwich
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Residence Henri 4 over New Year. The staff were very friendly and helpful, helping us organise our daily visits. We met up with family from Australia, whilst there. The hotel rooms were a little small though comfortable, and had what we needed, apart from tea and coffee making facility. The rooms were also very warm, a little too warm for me really. A staff member tried to reduce the temperature, by adjusting the radiator thermostat. The Hotel is quite well situated near the city centre, in the St Germain area of Paris. We walked into the city daily, to see the most common sites of Paris. The cost of the stay was not expensive, and suited our requirements. An enjoyable stay, and the Hotel is worth staying in for a Paris break.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: turtles24
Reviews.Content: A fabulously warm and cozy little place with a perfect location. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excelente”
Reviews.Author: ERJ145
Reviews.Content: Execellent room, at the 6th floor. warm(during winter), nice view. At the hotel the employees were very nice.2 balconies. Sels pour le bath. All the informations that I asked they gave. 5minutes walking to Notre-Dame. Very well located. Next time in Paris I will stay ther for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Henri 4”
Reviews.Author: gte304k
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Residence Henri 4 last weekend with one of my friends. We had a great time. The hotel was clean and the room was a nice size. The concierge was very helpful and answered all of our questions. We booked our own shuttle to and from the hotel, but the concierge said they can book the shuttle for you. In hindsight we probably would have gone that route. The hotel is located about 2 blocks from a metro station and is in a great neighborhood. You can easily walk to the Pantheon and Notre Dame. We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend the hotel. I will stay there again next time I'm in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NunuLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Henri IV before and remembered it to be a lovely, small hotel in an excellent location. My husband and I stayed only one night, as we were only passing through Paris on our way to India in early December. I called the hotel directly to reserve and was offered a room that was better than any we had stayed in the past, with a nice discount: Room 42, the Henri IV. It is a two room suite, decorated in lovely blues, with a canopied bed and marble fireplaces (non working obviously) in both rooms. There is a fridge and hotplate separate area and a large marble bathroom with a tub. It was very comfortable, quiet, and I find it particularly nice to have a second room in case one person wishes to sleep or read or vice versa when the other does not. The staff is very attentive. All in all, this is a wonderful hotel in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “so so nice”
Reviews.Author: David2977
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 night in a very luxurious hotel on company expences which didnt make that much of an impression on us , moving to a 3 star hotel made us expect the worse. and what a surprise. beutiful comfortable and ornated romantic 2 rooms with a small kitchinete and close to every where. please book it. lovely staff too. for the staff: it would have been helpful to have an english guide of events gong on in the latin quarter for the relevant month.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: teefaf
Reviews.Content: Other reviews have said most of what there is to stay, and are accurate to my experience. I'll add what I think hasn't been mentioned much. We were in Room 62, which was surprisingly spacious (and not just by Parisian standards). As soon as we had made our booking (via the hotel's website, which had the best rates I could find), the hotel emailed to say they'd noticed I'd made 2 bookings and would give us two rooms together - a good start. Communication before our stay continued to be prompt and courteous. we arrived a couple of hours early on the day, and after a short wait to make sure the room was ready, were allowed early check-in. Although the hotel has a classical/traditional feel about it, furnishings and condition of the room were top notch - everything was very clean and in good condition. The room was comfortable, but although there was an AC unit in the room we were never sure what it was doing. It seemed to chuck out some warm air occasionally. The wifi was great when it worked, but on some nights, for no reason we could figure out, we just couldn't find the network to connect. The shower was hot and worked fine, but we felt the pressure was a bit weak. The hotel soap was the best I've ever used. The wardrobe had plenty of hangers, and there was a stand for our suitcase to sit on. The room had plenty of mirrors and lights. The TV was OK, but reception was hit and miss. We didn't try the breakfast so can't comment. When we asked the front desk to call a taxi for us, it might have been nice for them to tell us we'd be charged for the journey the taxi must make from the rank to the hotel, and how much this usually is. It was a surprise to us when we got in. Paris hotels are very expensive, and to me this was no different. However, given the going rate in the city, we do feel this hotel represents good value. We'd certainly go back - the location, quality and comfort are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Paris118
Reviews.Content: Altough we were with three persons, we only got bathroom supplies for two persons. Both evenings we had to go to the reception to ask for towels. We did only get the shampoo, although the hotel had supplies like bath salt, something for your shoes, shower bonnet etc.. A pitty we didn't get this. In the kitchen there was only one pan, so you can make your breakfast, but not a real meal. The room was really nice and beautiful. Even the china fits with the curtains. Location of the hotel is excellent. The staff at the reception was nice. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: tonyemha
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was well placed with easy access to the Metro. Our (two) rooms were comfortable and spacious with comfy beds and hot showers. There are lots of very French cafes locally for breakfast and it is a five minute walk to Notre Dame and the Seine. Staff were proficient and understated but very friendly and appreciated our attempts to speak in French and make arrangements that were off the beaten track. The linen was clean and the pillowcases changed regularly during our five nights. The in-hotel breakfast experience was basic, but fine on the day we set off early for a trip to Versailles; otherwise we preferred to visit different cafes for breakfast. The little kitchenette was fine for making drinks, but with Parisian restaurants to explore we never made food in the suites. Our feeling is that we would happily stay there again. The Pantheon is nearby too and from the steps of the Pantheon there is a good view of La Tour Eiffel. The Cafe Marly attached to the Louvre is a lovely (though expensive) treat for a meal - important to reserve. (Check in advance the closing days of museums.) Gallerie Lafayette is a very pretty shopping experience. One of our highlights was an opulent treat at the Paris Opera - and astonishingly extravagant building and a memorable evening watching the premiere of a ballet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Obamavictory
Reviews.Content: We took a long weekend break with our teenage children from London in the UK, and booked Hotel Residence Henri IV mainly because of the very very positive trip advisor reviews. They were not wrong! The location is fantastic, walking distance down to the river and Notre Damme, over to the Louvre, and we especially loved the Latin Quarter at night for restaurants and for fabulous croissants and coffee for breakfast. Metro stations are abundant and we zipped around very easily. We had a first floor suite with a tiny but functional kitchenette where we could make tea and store soft drinks, beer and ice-cream (we were travelleing with teenagers). Beware the mini-bar Coke cans if you turn the fridge up to keep your beer cold though. One exploded on us causing mayhem! Staff shrugged it off when we explained and didn't expect payment. The furnishings and decor in the rooms and the lobby were lovely, quite "posh" in fact, front office staff very friendly and helpful and the cul-de-sac location made it quiet even though we were at the front of the hotel. I'd really recommend this as a base to explore and enjoy Paris and definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlc470
Reviews.Content: A great find! We were motivated by previous reviewers, and the hotel lived up to their accolades. The room was snug, but with big windows, which made it feel more spacious. The location was perfect -- just a few blocks to Notre Dame, close to many wonderful little bistros, and convenient to both bus and Metro. But best of all, it is a neighborhood filled with real Parisans! Not tourists! We were most grateful to the superlative staff, who advised and guided us throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Gem”
Reviews.Author: BruininEurope
Reviews.Content: The hotel ideally situated e.g., close to the Seine, Notre Dame, and walking distance to many other locations, e.g., D'Orsay, Louvre. The Metro is nearby, as are small excellent bistros and cafes. A great wine shop is around the corner. Two days a week a nearby plaza has a little outdoor market with great choices for gifts and picnics. The rooms are nicely furnished with updated bathroom fixtures and small kitchenette features (we want our Eric Kayser chocolates we left in the refrigerator!). The breakfast is OK but very convenient. Nights are very quiet even with the Blvd St. Germain close by. Staff are very helpful and patient. Their advice for transportation was always right on (For our Sunday afternoon arrival from CDG take a cab instead of a shuttle - cheaper for two and quicker; for the return in the early AM use a shuttle booked by the hotel. To Gare Lyon the hotel booked a cab). Everyone was very friendly, congenial, with lots of time for help and conversation. All are competent with English if one's French is rusty. Within the three-star class this hotel is an excellent choice. We'll go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: akarana
Reviews.Content: I discovered this establishment on Trip Advisor and was delighted with my five night stay. It is a small hotel with just 13 rooms, located in a quiet street but only a short walk from the Notre Dame. The St Michel metro station is about 12 minutes walk away. There are lots of small shops, bistros and restaurants nearby, and each room has a small kitchen facility with hot plate, fridge and micro wave oven. The standard of housekeeping is excellent and the rooms are of a reasonable size and are well furnished. The bathroom is also a good size.The reception staff speak good English and are most helpful. I needed the services of a doctor and the person on duty made all the arrangements on my behalf. I give the Henry IV top marks and my personal recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience Residence Henri 4”
Reviews.Author: juno68
Reviews.Content: This was a fine apartment (3 of us stayed comfortably). It was a much better idea and less expensive than taking two bedrooms, once the bathroom rota was established. Decor and room quality and cleanliness perfect. Staff were adorable.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here.....”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters
Reviews.Content: Another one who booked this hotel from the Tripadvisor reviews and it did not disappoint. We spent 3 nights here over the last weekend in July, my husbands 40th birthday. It took about 10 mins to walk from the Metro and on arrival we were allocated Room 1 which was on the ground floor next to reception. Room was beautifully furnished and we were very pleased to find a small kitchenette at one end of the room which we were not expecting. This became invaluable as each morning we purchased a fresh french stick from the local bakery (2 mins walk) and made ourselves up a packed lunch for our days out sightseeing! We also kept our wine in there! As previously mentioned, Notre Dame and the Seine for river cruises are within easy walking distance (5 mins) but we also discovered the number 53 bus which took us from outside the hotel (literally 20 paces away) to the Eiffel Tower - result! We also used it to get across to the Trocadero as on my hubs birthday we ate at Cafe de L'Homme as a special treat. If you get a chance then go - the view of the Eiffel Tower is awesome and it looks beautiful lit up at night. Despite being on the ground floor/by the reception desk - noise was not an issue at all - in fact I don't think we saw another guest throughout our stay even though the hotel was full! My only slight negative was due to us being there during probably the hottest weekend in Europe this summer! No air-con just a small cooling tower which we had to keep on all night and it was still stifling. No windows in the bathroom just a rooflight so you could only spend a few mins in there at a time - not great when you are trying to do your make-up! We didn't bother with breakfast so can't comment on that but overall, a fab little hotel - lovely and peaceful and a great price. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tw0Up
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. We booked on recommendation of our cousin and were to meet our daughter and a friend there. She was blown away, as were we, with not only the location and the friendly staff but also the furnishings and ambience. This hotel is clean and well maintained. Well worth the visit and we would always try and stay there in future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: GR1NZ
Reviews.Content: A great hotel but lets keep it in perspective. We spent 4 nights at this hotel in a standard room and returned for 1 night in a suite. We were very happy with the hotel but a couple of things need to be understood. Firstly the hotel is nothing like the image created by the small "mood" pics on the hotel website. The rooms are very standard for a hotel of this size and era in Paris and are not as well lit or fitted with the quality decor the pictures suggest. Nor do I consider it the Gem or delight that many reviews state. Having said that I have no complaints to make regarding our stay. The room was comfortable, reasonably well appointed, and, for Paris, of a reasonable size. In fact we enjoyed our standard room more than the suite, especially when one considers the additional cost of a suite. The hotel is located in a cul de sac and is quiet. While Notre Dame is in walking distance and several great restaurants are nearby (refer to hotel front desk for recommendations) it is nevertheless a little bit on the fringe of the shopping and areas of nearby interest. There are two metro stops in good proximity to the hotel. It is a good choice and option to stay at and I would recommend it but dont have expectations in excess of the reality based on the reviews

Reviews.Title: “Great place, walking distance to sights”
Reviews.Author: louisaharp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an 8 night stay at the Residence Henri IV and were very pleased with this hotel. The rooms are a nice size (for Europe) with comfortable beds and the bathrooms and showers were very nice (except for the hairdryer, but really, who cares) with good hot water and water pressure. They have a laptop that you can use to check email for free. The location is excellent... close walking distance to lots of cafes along Blvd St Germain, as well as the Seine and Notre Dame, and if you like to walk, the Louvre, and Musee d'Orsay and even all the way to the Champs Elysees and the Eiffel Tower (which we did). Plenty of good boulangeries closeby for breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful in arranging a shuttle to take us to and from the airport, which was cheaper than a cab and easier than dealing with luggage on public tranportation. I would definitely recommend Residence Henri IV.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle-free”
Reviews.Author: kitkat37
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time looking for hotels and as we'd left it until the last minute found most places were booked. In desperation we rang around a number of hotels and found the reception staff at the Residence Henri IV extremely friendly and helpful. We were concerend that the rooms in Paris - and the beds - might be small so they fitted us with two twins (basically a double bed with two mattresses) which were perfect. The check in and check out were completely hassle-free - took literally two minutes; and no complications. While the rooms might be a little tired they have character and importantly are clean, airy and a very good size, not just for Paris standars but for anywhere. The bathroom was similarly spacious and unlike most hotels actually had a window. We were extremely pleased with the location of the hotel and the service we received there and would have no hesitation in recommending it to others. We didn't try the breakfast as there were basic kitchen facilities in the room and plenty of cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “HÃ”TEL RÃ‰SIDENCE HENRI IV*** is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: soundguydave
Reviews.Content: Residence Henri IV was probably the most perfect place we could of stayed while in Paris. We visited in early September, but found even 3-4 months in advance many hotels were booked up. Luckily we found space here. We had a double standard room, which was more than enough space for two people. The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the heart of the city, a five minute walk from Notre Dame. There are also many Metro lines within 5-10 minutes, including the Saint Michel station. The Pantheon is less than five minutes away and you can see the Eiffel tower light show from its front steps. The hotel itself is right off the busy streets on a dead end, so we were never bothered with much traffic noise. We didn't bother with the breakfast (although it was the cheapest of any hotel we saw) because there is a farmers market almost every day less than a block away where you can get baked goods and fresh fruit for under 5 euros. One block over is a super market and you can stock the fridge with water and other things that seem to cost an arm and a leg when your out and about. The housekeeping staff was great and always seemed to when we were leaving for the day and fixed up the room then. Overall, if we were to visit again, I would most definitely book The Hotel Residnce Henri IV again. Tips: If you're coming on the RER C line from Charles DeGaulle airport, get off at the Luxembourg Gardens stop instead of Saint Michel. Its about the same distance, but it is far less busy there than Saint Michel and will make your walk easier. Room 62 is where we stayed and it was one of the only Standard rooms that had a balcony (two balconies actually!) Its on the top floor too and there is only one other room up there. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The good reviews I read of the Henri IV proved true”
Reviews.Author: ArnepDC
Reviews.Content: The Henri IV is a tiny hotel (about a dozen rooms), but the rooms are reasonably-sized (by Paris standards). Ours included a mini kitchen (fridge, stove, sink & microwave) and a full-sized bath. We paid about 190 Euros per night, which didn't seem that unreasonable (again by Paris standards). The Hotel doesn't have a lot in the way of public amenities: breakfast in the basement was noisy and a bit depressing; a single copy of the Herald Tribune was available in the small lobby. But for us a big plus was that the hotel is on a quiet cul-de-sac just off the Rue des Ecoles, which meant that you could easily find interesting restaurants, bus and metro connections around the corner, but you weren't bothered by traffic noise at night. In general, I found that the on-line reviews by other guests, which I had read before I made the booking, were on the mark. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, elegant, relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: idiotmittens
Reviews.Content: Charmingly decorated, warm and welcoming with a wonderful room decorated with a swagged canopied bed in lustrous red satin with crisp sheets and furniture. My girlfriend was overjoyed, and as it's just next to the Sorbonne, it's within easy walking distance of a range of bars and restaurants. We will certainly be going back. I can't comment on the food I'm afraid as we were too eager to get out and enjoy a tartine and a coffee outdoors!

Reviews.Title: “Loved that Hote l!!”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris64
Reviews.Content: Lovely, very clean hotel, in peaceful neighbourhood. The room we stayed ( family of four , with two children) spacious enough with beautiful decoration. The people of the hotel were very polite and we had no problem communicating in English. The only drawback were the towels, clean but very used. Any way I recommend this hotel without any doubt. I know now where to stay in Paris !!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely will return”
Reviews.Author: feeblecat
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised at the earlier review - is the review really for this hotel? Have just returned from this hotel on 10th September. Very clean friendly hotel, larger than average sized room and the kitchen area a great bonus. Excellent location and all the staff, bar none, were friendly and helpful. I had to email specifying floor preference as I do not like elevators and they replied immedately saying they would be delighted to accommodate my request and gave us room on specified floor. Staff happy to phone taxis etc for us and write down in French any info we had to pass over eg destination etc. A great experience and will definately return to the same hotel any time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Booking it was a problem”
Reviews.Author: S-in-Calgary
Reviews.Content: I had booked a superior room online, which was immediately charged to my card. A few days later I had to call them to change the dates, due to unavoidable charter flight changes. I understood that if I were to cancel, I would lose the money, however I explained that I didn't want to cancel my reservation, I simply wanted to change the dates. At first they refused, and said they'd keep 100% of the money, and I'd be forced to pay for other nights, or go somewhere else. After much arguing, I was able to change the dates, and they "allowed" us "by exception" to stay in a standard room, but at the SUPERIOR rate. During the process, they basically accused me of making my story up, citing that people have made up stories of their pets dieing, etc. in order to cancel reservations. Again, I didn't want to cancel, just change dates. Once there, the hotel was fine, our room was tiny (to be expected, but that's why I had originally booked a superior)... however I'm surprised (or perhaps not) by the arrogance and entitlement of the people I had to deal with in order to make changes to our reservation. If my card hadn't already been charged, there's no way I would have given them my business.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, beautiful clean hote in a great location - just perfect”
Reviews.Author: lilmonkey19
Reviews.Content: I did not want to leave and would go back any time! The location was great - close to the Notre Dame and amazing restaurants. The hotel was clean, beautifully decorated, and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Wouldn't change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Gourmetbella
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good location. Only a short walk to Notre Dame. Rooms were big and clean. Central and quiet is a lovely combination. The breakfast was expensive and not very interesting - and it was served in the basement - without windows...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Irishjig
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel in a geat location. Our first time in Paris but I believe the room size is pretty good. The kitchenette area is a great idea.Overall very happy with my our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at residence henri iv”
Reviews.Author: myluv29
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel ahead of time taking advantage of the spring early booking. It was our first time in Paris, and i was glad to have found this place. It was very close to the metro, cafes, and Notre Dame. I loved waking up in the morning to the bells of the Cathedral and picking up food at the boulangerie for breakfast. The staff were great, even prior to getting there they answered all my questions promptly via email. We got there super early and they were nice enough to let us check-in earlier when there was a room available. The beds were big enough, i like the parisian bathroom, a small kitchenette, fridge, and safe. All in all my husband and i had a great stay here and definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “nice holiday”
Reviews.Author: radu17
Reviews.Content: we were first time in paris and we booked by internet. We enjoyed our stay in a lovely place near to Notre Dame . The staff was friendly location is quiet rooms clean i'll be back with pleasure another time

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Leedslass78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in August and couldn't find fault with it. The staff were helpful, polite and friendly and the room was like a suite with a living area, kitchenette, bathroom and bedroom. For Paris, this was such good value for money. The bed was big and soft, the bathroom was a decent size with a good shower and the whole place had loads of character and charm. Best of all was its location in the heart of the latin quarter; 5 minutes walk to the Seine and Notre Dame and just around the corner from the Pantheon and loads of bars and restaurants. This was our second visit to Paris and when we return we will definitely come back to the Residence Henri IV. Loved the hotel and loved Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: PaTonyPatont
Reviews.Content: A warm and friendly establishment with staff who were always ready to assist a couple of lost travellers. It was like staying in someone's private home. The rooms were great and breakfast equal to the local cafes. The hotel is in the Latin Quarter near the Notre Dame and transport on the Metro or the River is close. I loved the place and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lawgirl2010
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We stayed in four hotels throughout France, and this one was my favorite. The room was very quaint and "French" with wonderful windows and decorations. The hotel is on a dead-end street, which makes it quieter than other hotels, and the location in the Latin Quarter is perfect. It's close to a Metro stop and to the Ile de France (Notre Dame and Ste. Chappelle). I didn't realize how much I should have appreciated the bathroom until we experienced other hotels in France. Henri IV has a full tub and a shower head that is actually located above your head, not at your knees (this is a big problem in France). It was the most "American" bathroom of all the hotels I stayed in. The staff is also very friendly and helpful, and they all speak English. All in all, I really enjoyed Henri IV and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly, clean and central hotel”
Reviews.Author: superjen
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel which really lived up to our expectations. Just a stone's throw from the Blvd St Germain and Notre Dame in a quiet cul-de-sac we had the ground floor room which was very quiet. Large room with the usual huge bed and a chaise lounge (we were in Paris after all). A very clean and well equpped bathroom which was lit by a skylight which is such a help in the middle to the night when it is pitch black and you need to find the loo. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideTraveller99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a Europe vacation and my best memories are of our time spent in Paris where we stayed at the Hotel Residence Henri IV.We had a lovely room with elegant French decoration,gorgeous French doors leading onto a small balcony with black wrought iron table and chair and a terracotta flower box filled with red geraniums- oh so Parisian! We were on the 6th floor so had a view over the rooftops when we had breakfast. The room also had a kichenette which was an added bonus.We were near the St Nicholas du Chardonet Church so we woke on Sunday to the beautiful sound of the church bells. We found the size of the room a pleasant surprise after London especially the bathroom.It is situated in the Latin Quarter and is close to shops, 2 small supermarkets,boulongeries, restaurants, Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxembourg- a beautiful park and of course the Seine River. We walked to the Lourve from here but there is also the hop on hop off bus which leaves near Notre Dame and takes you to all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: glpowers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Residence Henri IV for a five night stay and had a lovely experience. The hotel is very charming - there's a central spiral staircase and a tiny lift which saved us from having to carry our luggage up. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was bright and stocked with fun toiletry samples. The hotel isn't luxurious, but it's very nice, and has a very French feel to the decor - our room had high ceilings, crown molding and an oil portrait on the wall. The room also had a small balcony and two large windows, plus a tiny little kitchenette. We didn't do any cooking, but the fridge came in handy and it was nice to have the option. The front desk staff was also very polite and helpful. Only minor complaint was that our room didn't have air conditioning, though with the two large windows and the fan in the room, we were plenty cool enough even in the middle of July. The location is also excellent - there are two nearby Metro stops and although the hotel itself is on a quiet side street, there are larger streets very nearby where it's easy to get a taxi. We had a lovely time strolling through the neighborhood - there are excellent food and shopping options within walking distance. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Particle
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the centre of Paris, close to river and Notre Dame. Staff made us feel very welcome. We took our 2 small children, and had a small suite which was great for them to have a separate room but still be close to us. Good play park just along the road for children with slides and climbing frames.

Reviews.Title: “Paris' Best!”
Reviews.Author: DCWalkers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been visiting Paris frequently since 1998 and this is the single best hotel we've stayed in, bar none. While I have to agree with all of the other comments here about how wonderful the rooms are, the great location, the fantastic bakeries and wine shops in the area, what really sets this hotel apart is the professional, friendly staff. They go out of their way to ensure that not only are all your needs met, but that you are made to feel welcome in their hotel. I am a native English speaker, but get along quite well in French. One of the small things that I appreciate from the staff is that they continue to speak to me in French even after noting that my accent, rather than switching to English. I enjoy their willingness to help me perfect my French! We stayed on the top (6th) floor (yes, there is an elevator) in one of the standard rooms (not an apartment). It was plenty big enough, especially the bathroom. Tiny little balcony was cute, but really too small to make use of, at least for more than one person. There are only two rooms on the top floor, and the single negative thing I have to say about our stay was that the other folks on the floor had no concept of how loud they were! The kitchenette was nice, as it allowed us to keep bottled water, chill some wine, and a few snacks. It's not really robust enough to create a big meal, but who wants to eat in their hotel room in Paris anyway? Lastly, do not be put off by the rate listed here on TripAdvisor or on the hotel website. We were able to get a really good rate by booking through Expedia. We will definitely be making this hotel our "go-to" choice when visiting Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MegBradford
Reviews.Content: This was a charming hotel with more than enough space for 2 adults and 2 teenagers for a short stay. The rooms were very clean. We had a tiny kitchen but no kettle or cafetiere, and not enough crockery for 4. To be fair we didn't ask for any more, if we had have done I'm sure it would have been forthcoming as the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Expensive, but it's the middle of Paris, a two minute walk from Notre-Dame, and the exchange rate was poor for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rezende
Reviews.Content: We spent six days in Paris and Residence Henri IV was perfect for our family. Great localization: quiet street, near from Notre Dame, Sorbonne University, Quartier Latin... and the Metro. The rooms are beautiful, big enough (even for our 3 teenagers), clean, confortable. Reception 24 hours, everyone kind and helpful and they speak english! Rezende, Sao Paulo, Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mickdv
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Henri IV definitely lived up to our expectations. Hotel staff were always courteous and only too happy to assist us. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend time in Paris at a rate that doesn't break the bank. Location is perfect with easy access to the Metro and haps of restaurants and other convenience stores close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoodieLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel. Friendly staff, decent size room, comfortable bed, and pillows not too bad for France! Good bathroom and all clean. Situation was excellent - in the Latin Quarter but in a quiet cul-de-sac. We walked everywhere - 7 mins to Notre Dame - and never needed the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_L-Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is a really quaint hotel in the Latin Quarter - a sensational part of Paris to stay in. Honestly, we really can't fault this place. It's in a quiet yet central location, within decent walking distance of both Maubert and Cardinal Lemoine metros, and near to heaps of good cafes in the Latin Quarter. The room was really quite spacious (for Paris), and so too was the bathroom. Being a residence hotel, we had a kitchenette, which was very handy for microwaving the odd quiche. The staff were really friendly and helpful with any questions. Finally, I'd say that I was most impressed with the great value for money here, it was easily the most affordable hotel we found in this great area. Can't comment on the breakfast as we unfortunately never got around to having it there with the choice of cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, cosy and lovely”
Reviews.Author: mgilligan
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel/apartment located in the heart of St Germaine. The one bedroom apartment is ideal for a family who need a small (but serviceable) kitchen to warm up bottles or food for a toddler or baby. The rooms are spacious by Paris standards and it has a bath (which is rare by Paris standards). As expected the lifts are tiny but overall the hotel is kept in excellent condition and rooms are comfortable. Highly recommended for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously Quaint Hotel in Wonderful Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisTeddy
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and traditional property with flower boxes outside the large windows that lead to small wrought iron balconies where you can enjoy the charm of Paris. The neighborhood is quiet, yet very Parisian with specialty stores and coffee shops. We found a grocery store, fruit stand, liquor store and patisserie right behind the hotel. The hotel has six floors and a cirular stair case that is absolutely charming (don''t panic--they also have a small elevator). Our room on the 6th floor was a little more casual and slightly smaller than some of the others (which are very large rooms)--very french country in the decor with a full bath, microwave, rerigerator, sink, etc. The bed was a little smaller also, but it was still fine for us. The staff was very helpful and we had a great time!!! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone! Very close to Notre Dame, the Seine and the Latin Qtr. It's terrific!!!!

Reviews.Title: “convenient and quiet”
Reviews.Author: dcmarlins
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, small (13-room) and nicely furnished three-star hotel on a quiet deadend street near the Metro Maubert-Mutualite stop in the Latin Quarter. We spent five nights in an apartment accompanied by a granddaughter. The apartment consisted of two BR, an ample bathroom and a small kitchen. The staff is very helpful and pleasant, the rooms supplied with fresh linens and cleaned daily, and the price is reasonable. We stayed here in 2004 also. Close by is the exceptional Keyser boulangerie, our first morning stop to gather baguettes, brioches and croissants to take home for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelPretoria
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and two children (11 and 17) stayed in the Hotel Henri for two nights. What a gem this hotel is in Paris. The rooms are spacious and very clean. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as the children are very fussy eaters. We bought goodies from a supermarket within walking distance of the hotel and made use of the self-catering equipment in the room. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definately stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “perfect.”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkTravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a stay in Paris. So perfect that I am hesitant to write a review, as it might become too popular. Without a doubt we will be staying here on any future visit to Paris. The room was comfortable and nicely furnished. The large floor to ceiling windows in both the bedroom and bathroom meant we could get a nice breeze through the room. Very little noise, considering it is in a city. It has a small, personal feel about it. The reception and entrance hall is small, which was rather nice and gave a personal feel. We never even saw any of the other guests around. It is ideally located if you are looking to explore Paris either on foot or by Metro (500 metres away). Notre Damme is a five minute walk. For evening eating we would suggest finding one of the many simple restaurants in the St Germain area, which is about 10 minutes walk away. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: Floridiantraveler50
Reviews.Content: This little gem gave us a family of 4 with a tweener and a teenager a feeling of living in Paris. Quaint, friendly, and comfortable. Typical Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Residence Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: cbsincoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully located for neighborhood dining and for access to tourist attractions. We and our daughter's family of five enjoyed attentive and personal service of attractive and well informed staff who spoke excellent English. They also were most patient with our attempts at communication in French. The room amenities were fine and the size of the hotel (only 13 rooms) was perfect. Sincerely, The Sincocks

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: hamhem
Reviews.Content: Great left bank location. 10 minutes to Notre Dame. Great staff and large suites at a very resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Keeping the Residence Henri IV a secret!”
Reviews.Author: khep
Reviews.Content: We booked the Residence Henri IV on booking.com after researching on TripAdvisor. Can't say enough about how much we LOVE this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions at anytime of the day or night. The room was larger than your standard Paris room...we weren't hurdling over our baggage to get from the bathroom to the bed. With a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame/Ile St. Louis from the hotel, the location couldn't be any better. With the hotel being at the end of a dead end off of Rue Ecole, traffic noise is very low (big plus after exploring Paris all day). We booked our first night on booking.com for 154 euro (June 30). We then decided to book a additional night and contacted the hotel to see if a room was still available. The staff got back with me the same day and gave us the same room at the same rate. Can't beat good service! Would love to keep this one to ourselves but we have to share with everyone.... this is a real find in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: worldcitygirl
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review forever. My husband and I stayed at the Residence Henri for four nights during New Year's week. I can't say enough about the hotel or the charming staff. We had a room on the first floor with no balcony. However, it was very clean, spacious with a nice little kitchenette. Nice bathroom toiletries as well. Our one complaint (and this is about most European hotel beds) is that the mattress on our bed was not very comfortable. Just way too firm for our liking. That aside, the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Our day manager during our stay was a young man from Morrocco who was studying at the Sorbonne. His English was fantastic and he was very good natured about my terrible French (which I insisted on practicing to my husband's chagrin) My husband took ill one day, and he was very helpful in directing me on where to get medicine and even recommended warm Coca Cola for DH's stomach (it does work wonders by the way). I underscore other review's comments about the location - it's perfect for getting around Paris. Not only are you in the heart of the Latin Quarter, a stone's throw from Notre Dame (go very early if you don't want to wait in line for hours to get in!), but there are many wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Make sure to go to the Erik Kaiser pattisierie in the morning to get some of the best French pastery you will ever eat! Overall terrific hotel and a great value in one of Paris' best neighborhoods. I'll be returning for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: pa_traveler05
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Residence Henri IV is in a great part of town and very convenient to many of the popular tourist attractions. The hotel is at the end of dead end street which makes the immiediate area a little more quiet and intimate. However, once you walk to the first intersection, you are in the heart of the Latin Quarter, surrounded by shops, restaurants, bakeries and cafes and just a few minute's walk from Notre Dame. A metro station is around a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel's staf was friendly, helpful and pretty good with English. We had what was called an apartment for four people -- my wife and I plus our two daughters. The room had a bedroom with a queen size bed and a living roon with a pull-out sofa. The pull-out bed was small for two people (even if one of the two was my six-year-old daughter). The room also had a kitchenette which we did not use. The hotel and room were both older but very clean. The room was adequate for us. There were a couple of disappointing aspects to the room. The towels in the bathroom were threadbare and the toilet seat was worn (not dirty). The breakfast room was in the basement and not a particularly great place to start your day in Paris. The breakfast was OK. We ate there only one day when we were in a rush. We enjoyed our breakfasts at the local cafes much more. In summary -- very nice and friendly hotel in a great location. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Residence Henri 1V”
Reviews.Author: 2gnomesinparis
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Paris for my husband and I and we loved the Hotel Residence Henri 1V The Henry IV is in a beautiful part of Paris. The area is quiet and clean and feels safe, and being in a cul d sac makes it quiet at night even though it is still in a vibrant part of Paris. There are 2 Metro stations nearby and many cafes and restaurants within walking distance. Notre Dame is an easy 10 minute walk as is the river Seine and St Louis Island .. The hotel has 13 rooms, and there is a tiny lift. The room was charmingly decorated and very clean with modern bathroom plus a tiny kitchen area with 2 hotplates, microwave, sink, small fridge and utensils.cutlery,crockery. The bed was very comfortable. There were french doors which opened onto a little balcony with a table and chairs and a window box full of red geraniums, with a lovely view outside. The hotel staff were very friendly and efficient and English was spoken. We did not try the breakfasts at the hotel because there were so many little cafes and beautiful shops to buy croussants, bread cheese etc, plus yummy fresh made crepes.. I would highly recommend this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: WMS2008
Reviews.Content: If you like the left bank, the location is fabulous. The hotel is an easy walk to many legendary attractions such as Notre-Dame de Paris. It is also proximal to the "on and off" water taxi and the subway at Saint Michel which expands your range to most of the city. The staff was friendly and quite helpful. They appoached their duties with a high degree of professionlism which complimented the pleasure of our stay. They successfully handled several special requests for us and their follow up was excellent The breakfast room is spare and a little drap but the food was a fairly good. Our guest room was adequate by European standards. It appeared that most of the rooms had a balcony which provide a pleasant place to sit. The street is a dead end which allows a quiet nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFlowergirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Residence Henri IV is a gem. We booked this hotel because it looked like we would feel like we were in Paris instead of some ultra modern hotel that we normally gravitate towards. Most of the other hotels we considered were in my opinion, way overdone with floral patterns on the bedspreads, curtains, walls and the carpet, so I was very happy to find this hotel which was tastefully decorated. We like to live how the locals live while we visit a new place, so keep that in mind when I tell you that the breakfast was good. There were croissants with jam and Nutella, cereal, fresh fruit, orange juice, coffee, tea and water which is typical for a French breakfast, so if you are expecting a traditional "American" breakfast, remember you are in France and probably won't find that at many places no matter how hard you try. It is located on a quiet street in the Latin Quarter with a metro station just 2 blocks away with a lot of restaurants and markets around. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and spoke very good English - I realized at a later point of our trip (in another hotel) how important friendly hotel staff is when you are in another country, especially where you don't speak the language fluently; they can make or ruin your experience. The room we booked was a standard room which was a good size for two people. There was a queen size bed, two small closets for hanging clothes, tv, a small table and desk and 2 chairs and a small kitchenette which we barely used except to make tea. The bathroom was fairly good sized and had a shower/bath, sink, toilet and a hairdryer. Not a lot of room to put toiletries, but we made it work. Overall, a great experience and I would go back to stay there in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Chele0905
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation off at Henry IV and absolutly loved it! It is a quaint, beautiful hotel and the staff is outstanding. We loved it from the second we pulled up and saw the red door. They took care of every need immediatly and provided us with all the help and information we needed to get around the city. The room was more than enough, and the small table with kitchenette was perfect for our small breakfast of breads and coffee. They were more than accomodating. We asked advice on everything from how to find the Eiffle Tower to where to get the best bread, wine and cheese and always were pleased with the results. We even had a little balcony with a small table and chairs and had a wonderful view as we wereon the top floor. The staff made sure we were comfortable and our needs were taken care of. We even forgot a cold pack, special butter and an insulated bag when we left to continue our vacation of Europe. We called two days later and ased if it was still there. It was. We arrived back to Paris 10 days later, and they still had our things. These people are VERY good at what they do!

Reviews.Title: “Paris hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller089
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a great position. Staff helpful & gave a wonderful recommendation for Dinner on our first night not far from the hotel was the " Maree Verte " a great start to our stay. Hotel very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaHoliday
Reviews.Content: Was perfect. We have a 10 month old baby and they were very accommodating. They gave us a room on the ground floor, so it was very easy with the pram. The room was a generous size - plenty of room for the double bed, wardrobe, day bed, port-a-cot which was provided free of change and was set up ready for our arrival, a small fridge / stove top, and a lovely bathroom with bath and shower over the bath. Very nice decor. We were able to use the sitting room near reception to read / have snacks while our baby napped in the room. The reception staff spoke good English and happily booked us a taxi to the airport, which arrived on time even though there was a metro strike at the time! The hotel is in a perfect location - less than a 5min direct walk to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful little hotel in a great locaation”
Reviews.Author: myffy
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this delightful hotel in its fabulous location down a little cul-de-sac but right in the heart of the Left Bank. Although our taxi driver had a little difficulty finding it, and our room was not quite ready on arrival, the staff were very friendly, providing umbrellas, travel advice and directions. The decor in our apartment was not absolutely pristine (expecially the bathroom - so lovers of bland luxury need not apply), However, the architectural quality and atmosphere of the building, lovely linen, view over a little garden opposite and overall design more that made up for this. Our party of 4, including 2 children, didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel, but would certainly go back again and the little kitchenette would be a great bonus for snacks and lazy breakfasts. Chic and yet comfortable, central but quiet, historic but not antiquated, a great choice for central Paris sightseeing, for families or a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “nice smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: jarjar05
Reviews.Content: i stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Residence Henri IV. It is a nice small hotel. The staff was friendly and spoke passable english, which combined with my not so great French made communication much easier. The room was nice. It had a nice balcony, air conditioner, windows and doors to the balcony. The location is excellent for tourists wanting to see Notre Dame , The Louvre, or any other common sightseeing areas. The local cafes and a nearby Italian restaurant were excellent. ( best pizza and banana splits ever). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good family rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lichu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 persons in one of the hotel's family rooms. The room was excellent (not too small as many rooms in Paris) although the bed in the parents room lacks some centimeters in the length. Very nice and quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: Ale64
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay in Paris, very well located, next to Notre Dame Cathedral. Lots of restaurants and shops in the area. Our room was small but very clean and comfortable, it even had a small kitchen and balcony. The bathroom was modern and full of space. I highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly fit for a king!”
Reviews.Author: Goldcat
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a long weekend in Paris staying at the Hotel Residence Henri IV. Though more expensive than some of the hotels we looked at we liked the idea of basic self catering facilities and were encouraged by the previous reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter, a lively, cultured and serene part of the city surrounded by educational establishments, bookshops and cafes. The hotel was not the easiest to find but with a little help from a lovely French lady we made it. The first thing that struck us was how lovely the guy on Reception was. He spoke fluent English and was very charming and helpful. Our room was a reasonable size (for Paris) with a nice bathroom and small kitchenette (fridge, couple of hobs and a microwave). There were however limited plates and cutlery so it might be worth considering bringing some with you! The room was nicely decorated and immaculate. Paris is easily accessible via the Metro, of which there are a couple of stops nearby. It was lovely to return to this quiet, safe and friendly hotel after a long day out sightseeing/shopping. I really would recommend this hotel and we definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Perfect, or Simply Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TJLW
Reviews.Content: With the dollar worth next to nothing, and Paris being an international city where decent hotels cost, well, you know, it was such a relief to find Residence Henri IV. First, it's quiet - at the end of little dead end street, and the windows are so good that they close out the sound of the pigeons in the morning. The shower is hot and strong; lacking only face cloths. The bed is kind to one's back and the linens are soft and fresh. Skip the in-house breakfast and enjoy the wonderful options within a few minutes walk - especially the local fresh market just down the street. This is not a luxury hotel; there's not even a radio or alarm clock in the rooms, but then, who goes to Paris to listen to the BBC or to wake up in the morning? This is a simple place, fun and in a wonderful neighborhood. The staff is cordial and speaks English almost as well as French. I'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Peferct and charming”
Reviews.Author: JanMary3
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay here. We had a lovely room (50) on the 5th floor, with a balcony you could step out on to (not possible on all of the balconies). We found our room large and well furnished. The bathroom also had a window, which is always a bonus! The fridge in the kitchenette was a reasonable size, and all the cutlery and china we could need was provided. Being in a small dead-end street meant there was little traffic noise, and there was a lovely little park just opposite, with a children's play area. The staff could not have been more helpful. At my request they arranged to have a bottle of champagne waiting in our room for our arrival, which was excellent. We were able to get an excellent rate through booking early on the hotel website. I did also phone the hotel directly, but they could not offer as good a rate as their website deal.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place in a large city”
Reviews.Author: Hosta_La_Vista
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than expected. In the centre of the Latin Area there was access to restaurants, stores, metro and everything to meet your travel needs in Paris. Close walking distance to the main metro terminal St. Michels and to most Paris sites. This rare find hotel was at the end of a dead_end street where you heard no traffic noise. Check out the hotel black cat (noir chat). Rooms were large for Paris standards with kitchenettes. The elevator was a bit scarey but glad they had one. Rooms were clean. All rooms have a balcony except #1 - which is on the main floor behind reception. A large room but the window opens onto the parking lot. Not a problem with noise but nice to have balcony doors you can open on the other floors. We didn't try the continental breakfast for 8 euro as there are too many options with vendors outside the hotel. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They have a laptop for customer use. Laundry mat around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Could hardly bring ourselves to leave!”
Reviews.Author: maryfromhouston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding! Great location in the Latin Quarter, but near a park for some green space and quiet at night. Five minute walk to the Seine and Notre Dame. Close to two metro stops and open-air market, which was really fun. Anything you might need within a couple of blocks. Queen size bed and what I considered a really large room-space for hanging clothes, desk, a table. Plenty of room for our bags and all of the shopping we did, and we could still move around! The bathroom was also large and comfortable. I was afraid that Paris hotel rooms would be very tiny, so this was a very pleasant surprise. The staff were amazing! So friendly and helpful in every possible way. They got us taxis, reservations for a boat trip on the Seine, laundry...whatever you need, they will get it for you. We never tried the hotel breakfast because there was a wonderful boulangerie right around the corner. But considering everything else about the hotel, I'm sure it was nice.
