Having a mini-fridge and kitchen facilities was great! You couldn't exactly prepare gourmet cuisine, but you could heat food and store food and drinks. We went to the market one morning and bought cheese, fruits, roasted chicken, bread, pate, and then had a real feast in our room that evening. The hotel even supplies wineglasses and a corkscrew, so get some wine too! We were thrilled with this hotel and would definitely stay there again. You can get a really good deal through the hotel website if you book early. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in this beautiful part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: 4thestate
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a hotel in Paris that gives you a real feeling of being in a foreign country and still carries good amenities. That's the Residence Henri IV. It's located at the dead end of a street in the Latin Quarter, three blocks from a bridge that crosses the Seine near the back of Notre Dame Cathedral. The Metro stop is a five-minute walk, and there's bus service even closer. You'll hear church bells chiming from the two churches that are closer than Notre Dame, but not late at night. Even though there are college students down the street (the Sorbonne) it's very quiet. A small park is practically across the street. The hotel is six stories but only has 13 rooms. Some of the rooms are two-room suites, but my wife and I stayed eight nights in a standard room, 17 square meters, which is plenty of room for two twin size beds, an armoire with a door for each person, a large bathroom with a powerful hot shower, and the piece de resistance, a small fridge, stove top and kitchen sink. Thus, it's no problem to pass up the hotel's continental breakfast at 8 Euros per day per person and pick up some pastries and drinks the night before, or stash cold drinks at prices lower than the hotel minbar's. There are plenty of stores and patisseries around (the best is Eric Kayser's organic bakery on Boulevard St. Germain, two blocks away, which seems to draw the most locals). No AC, but we were there in May with daily temps in the 70s and we just opened the windows for great cross-ventilation. (We were on the third floor.) The hotel also provides a tower fan. The elevator is small and slow, but you might fall in love with the spiral staircase (as long as you're not up too high!). Room decor is a sort of country French. There's a small flat-screen TV but we never turned it on. You don't go to Paris to watch TV! Hotel staff speaks excellent English and is splendidly helpful. I thought the beds were a little hard but I like them softer than most people anyway. Cleanliness was excellent. Price is high (230 Euros a night for a standard room, about 50 percent more for a suite) but we got big savings by booking six months in advance through the hotel's own website.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur510
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Henri for 2 nights. The hotel is located in the 5eme and, therefore, very centrally located. It is situated on a quiet little side street, but the general area has several eating and shopping establishments. As for the hotel itself, it is quite nice. The lobby is small, but very well kept. The staff is very professional (we encountered 3 desk clerks during our stay) and most had ample English speaking skills. Hicham was on duty when we arrived (I told you that I would mention you, Hichamâ€¦) and had lots of information about the area and Paris in general. As for the room, our room was of average size (for Central Paris), I suppose. It was very clean, however. I do love a clean hotel room and ours did not disappoint. The bathroom was also very neat and tidy. Our room had two single beds, a desk, nightstand and large dresser. There were also two wardrobes/closets for clothing. A mini-fridge, cutlery, drinking utensils and hot stove were also in the room. This was a very nice touch since we brought food and wine back to the room. We paid 160E per night and this was a very good deal. I messed up our booking (on Booking.com), initially, and didnâ€™t realize my error until a few weeks before arrival. By then, rooms were more scarce and the price had gone up. However, the hotel honored the price that was available at the time of my earlier booking, thereby saving us about 20E/night. Not a ton of money, but a very nice gesture on behalf of hotel management. All in all, this hotel lives up to its lofty reviews on TA. It represents great value for the money and the location is fabulous. Paris is a very walkable city and this hotel is in a great location and within 2 blocks of a metro line. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary at the Residence Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: RS-Columbia
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Henri IV for our 10th anniversary. The staff was courteous and spoke English. The room (#60, standard double on the top floor) was larger than we had anticipated, had air conditioning, a small balcony, and an updated bathroom. The hotel was very quiet, as it was a couple of blocks from the busy rue St. Germain. A few blocks from the hotel, on rue Monge, was a wonderful street market just in front of a series of shops selling pastries, cheese, wine, meats, and fruits and vegetables. Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame were only a 5 minute walk away. The weather was wonderful, so we also were able to walk many of the other sights in central Paris. We would definitely recommend a stay at the Henri IV.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Residence Henri IV - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers099
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Residence Henri IV and were very happy with the service, the room and the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: irisinmay
Reviews.Content: we have just been back from Paris. It's a charming city and this hotel have a nice location. Easy walk to the Dame and restaurants. Room is bigger than expected.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrowneDublin
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at this hotel. only stayed 2 nights so that was a bit short. the hotel is small but we had no problems. room was small also but quite average for Paris. it did have the plus of having a little kitchenette which was great as there was a bakery quite close by so we could get croissants for breakfast there & have them in our room. staff were lovely and hotel was clean. would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaintingTime
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Residence Henri IV after much research using Tripadvisor, and a couple of other sites available on the internet. The room rates were reasonable, and not over priced for what you got. I travelled during the second week in April, just before the busy season. This research really paid off, as I and my partner were not disappointed with our spacious, clean and comfortable room. The room itself was large by European standards (one thing my research promised), nicely furnished with ample wardrobes and dressers for clothes, and a small area with a built-in bar fridge, sink and stove. Everything was spotless. Great housekeeping. The room was QUIET, the bed comfortable and the sheets were of good quality, so sleeping was easy. The hotel is removed a little off the street, so traffic noise is not problem. The marble tiled bathroom was newly renovated, with both a bath and a shower, great water pressure....and lots of hot water! I purchased the breakfasts, and it was a great way to get the day going. We were more than satisfied with the croissants, buns, and as much juice and good coffee that you wanted. There is a 24 hour concierge, which is great because you don't have to worry about when you get back to the hotel, and they keep the key, so you don't have to worry about losing it. Maps, directions, and friendly service were also appreciated. We used the shuttle service that the hotel offered to the airport on our way home, and it was much more economical than a taxi. Would I stay here again? Yes! As a matter of a fact, I am planning to return in the fall & will definitely book a room. The area surrounding the hotel is also filled with great affordable restaurants. Sites like the Pantheon and Notre Dame are just a 10 minute stroll. Nicely centred in the Latin district. A wonderful Paris hotel in this price range!

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: 1330ag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with our two kids ages 5 and 8 and really enjoyed our stay. It was centrally located and a decent amount of space. It also had a small kitchen area. The bathroom was clean and overall it was really comfortable. The Latin Quarter is a perfect place to stay. Lots of restaurants and you can walk to so many things. I would definatly stay here with my family again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mojave_gal
Reviews.Content: I'm hardly a world traveler, but I travel for business occasionally and try to leverage the trips. This January was Paris! Spent the first part of the trip at Disney Paris New York Hotel (fine hotel, but who wants to travel from California to go to Disney?). I wanted a moderately priced hotel in the left bank. I learned my lesson in Barcelona the year before --- "great" reviews on Trip Advisor are often great because the property is cheap and well located. Apparently some folks can put up with the "uck" factor better than I. While I don't need upscale I do need clean, well kept and reasonably attractive. So it pays to read all the reviews on a property and try to read between the lines. I felt this place would fit the bill. The Hotel Residence Henri IV is a great location! On a little dead end street off the Rue Des Ecoles it was a bit hard to find, but it was quiet and safe. Five-minutes close to the subway too. I arrived late on a rainy afternoon and they had my reservation. My room was on the first floor, right behind the registration desk. Frankly I flipped when they showed me to my room: it was dark, had an unmade daybed as well as a double, and I could hear everything going on in the lobby!! I was bummed! So I went back to the desk and asked for a room change. It's a tiny hotel so I kept my fingers crossed. And they put me up on the 6th floor in an absolutely charming room --- a bright little garret with a little balcony. Cute patterned wallpaper, a dormer window that looked into an "authentic" French courtyard. Double bed was comfy. There was an easy chair, a small desk and small table. The bathroom was tiny (aren't most in EU?) but clean and I could enjoy both baths and showers. Overall perhaps a bit on the shabby chic side, but IMHO it all added up to charm. There was a kitchenette behind a metal roll-up that I didn't discover until my last day there. The front desk was incredibly helpful. Ask for a direction and before you know it they're drawing you maps! Don't think the room was big enough for two, but if I ever make it back to Paris solo I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZeGirl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location, rate, room size, kitchenette and raving online reviews. This hotel did not disappoint. We loved our stay there. The room was large and the bathroom was huge. The staff was friendly and helpful. We liked having the continental breakfast brought to our room. It was a leisurely way to start the day with no delivery fee. The only thing that was not perfect was the bed--it was hard. But I would not say that it would stop me from staying there again. It really is a charming hotel in a wonderful location. The area around it has a lot of shops, cafes and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: locogirl33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those who want a clean, quiet, friendly, convenient, centrally located hotel in the Latin Quarter. We spent five days in Paris and were very pleased with the quality and value of this 3 star hotel. The nearest Metro is Cardinal Lemoine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful smalll hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoLoChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Residence Henri IV, in February 2008. It is a very nice, well located small hotel. We had early booking at their discounted rated so 3 nights were 549.00 euros, total. We had what is called a â€œSuperior Roomâ€� which included a small living room, futon couch, with a small table and 2 chairs, a good size separate bedroom with nice TV, (we plugged in our IPOD and watched our US favorites). The photos shown on the web and the photos on Trip Advisor represented the hotel accurately. The small kitchenette with microwave was fine for snacks and their small refrigerator good for beverages and cheeses. The bathroom was clean and of good size, with a shower curtain. The rooms large windows open to a small step-out balcony, with a good view. The hotel is quiet and the English speaking staff is very helpful. I suggest you have the continental breakfast, delivered to your room. Having petit dejeuner delivered to you, comes with hot-hot coffee and steamed milk and a basket of breads and croissants, butter, jam and orange juice. This makes you stop and take a moment before a day of sight seeing and you get to sit at your cute table and look out the windows and feel like a Parisian. The first day we did not have breakfast in the hotel and save the 10 euros each, as we were going to have croissants and coffee around the corner; but the fabulous and very famous Kayser cafÃ© and bakery just around the corner was too busy, and we just kept running, and never stopped till lunch. So the in room breakfast is a treat. This hotel is a perfect location. Close to markets, restaurants, metroâ€™s, buses, taxi stands. The hotel is walking distance to so many good restaurants. I would suggest Christophe Restaurant on 8 Rue Descartes, for a very good bistro meal. I would suggest you get the Pudlo Paris restaurant guide by Gilles Pudlowski, it was a great reference guide with accurate reviews, and for the first time in 2007 is translated to English. Make sure that if booking Hotel Residence in the summer they have air-conditioning. If they donâ€™t have air-conditioning it could be a problem as the rooms can be stuffy without open windows. For February and at a discounted price this was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of it's high ranking”
Reviews.Author: ajeep8u_Italy
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Beautiful, well-maintained, well-managed, smaller hotel on the end of a private street. Ten minutes walk gets you to Parc du Luxembourg, the Pantheon, or Cathedrale Notre Dame. Friendly staff, free wireless internet, rooms have a small kitchenette. Minuses: Few - it's not very well positioned to Metro stations. Tips: The best Boulangerie near by is Eric Kayser - 8, Rue Monge, 75005 - head north on Rue des Bernardins (toward Notre Dame) one block, turn left on Rue Monge, Kayser is 100 meters on your left.

Reviews.Title: “very sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: daphne1818
Reviews.Content: we have decided to choose this hotel following the reviews we have read on tripadvisor and were happy to find out that the hotel was as described. we shall return to this hotel on our next trip to paris

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Family”
Reviews.Author: Racheltaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Residence Henri IV for 3 nights in March. We had a lovely 1 bedroom suite with a pull out couch in the living room that our daughters' ages 9 and 11 slept on. There was a kitchenette and a nice washroom (not too big, but had everything you needed). Location was great, near Notre Dame Cathederal and walking distance to many sites. The staff were very courteous and helpful. It was hard to find a room that would accomodate our family in Paris and we were glad to find this hotel. Would easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: trueblueinny
Reviews.Content: Nestled at the end of a quiet street off the main road, this well situated small hotel is a pleasant and convenient base from which to explore Paris. The staff are attentive and very pleasant, readily making restaurant reservations, etc. The hotel is arranged vertically with only 2 units per floor, each having a small but convenient kitchenette that comes in handy for food bought the market located just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location in paris”
Reviews.Author: iamthemalrus
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location. Friendly staff. Rooms good size, clean and very comfortable. I would stay there again. The breakfast at 6 euros is much better and cheaper than the local bistros.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Residence Henry 1V”
Reviews.Author: minerale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Residence Henry 1V in February 2008. The weather was cold but the hotel was beautiful and warm as were the staff. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, the surrounds were more than expected. Please keep the secret. Of course we will return one day. Gail and Ross

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel box”
Reviews.Author: chestwood28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris before at a 4 star hotel and this was just as nice, if not nicer. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and large for the price. I loved that the hotel was on a dead end road in the Latin Quarter. (if you take a cab, make sure you give the driver the exact address)

Reviews.Title: “Great for business & leisure”
Reviews.Author: TurquoiseTortoise
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel in the center of Paris, under 10 min walk to Notre Dame, and many very good restaurants near by. I stayed for 4 nights combining a business trip and weekend break, great for both. Free wireless internet, friendly staff, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rebeccabrown
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. Great location, lovely rooms, friendly and helpful staff, reasonable breakfast delivered to the room. What more could you ask for? I would go back to this hotel without a shadow of a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kate-and-ian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were very impressed by the quality of the hotel, its central but quiet location and the friendliness of the staff. The hotel is brilliantly situated, a few doors away from a well-stocked wine shop, a couple of minutes from the Metro, and five minutes walk from the Musee de Cluny (home of the magical Lady and the Unicorn tapestries). It is close to Notre Dame, Saint-Chapelle, the Jardin des Plantes, and the Luxembourg Gardens, and within walking distance of the Musee dâ€™Orsay, Pompidou Centre, Picasso Museum and many other delights. Although the hotel has no bar or restaurant, there are many places to eat and drink nearby. Le Cosi, an excellent Corsican restaurant which has a different set menu for lunch each day, is only five minutes walk away. The Place de la Sorbonne is a great place for a drink and people watching. Our room was on the third floor, with a small balcony and a good view along the Rue des Ecoles. The room was a decent size, very clean and well-equipped. The kitchenette was a bonus, particularly the full size fridge, which was useful for keeping food and wine chilled. We were perfectly happy with the hotel breakfast â€“ strong coffee, fruit juice, croissants, brioche and rye-bread â€“ although we did hear one American family complaining that it wasnâ€™t substantial enough for their needs. On one morning, we came downstairs to discover that breakfast had finished early due to an interruption to the electricity supply. We must have looked very disappointed, as, a few minutes later, there was a knock on the door and breakfast was delivered to the room. As we had an early flight, we had to leave before breakfast on the Saturday morning, and asked whether we could have a cup of coffee. When we came down to reception, we found a complete breakfast waiting for us, which was greatly appreciated. We very much enjoyed our stay, would certainly use the hotel again and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Gazandglo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the hotel very cosy and nicely furnished in a traditional French style. Our room was on the 6th floor and we had two small balconies with great views of the local area. It was very clean and the staff were helpful and friendly. The room had a mini kitchen which was very handy for keeping the wine chilled and making tea in the morning. There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel, but that didn't really matter as there are plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. This is a lovely part of Paris and we would stay here again. Try L'Ecurie restaurant, just a few minutes walk from the hotel for a great atmosphere and good value, simple food.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Henri delivered the goods!!”
Reviews.Author: BelfastBella
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay in Paris where the first three nights were spent in the Residence Henri IV. We found this hotel quite easily once we arrived and were pleased with the location. On arrival to the hotel we were upgraded to one of the apartments for the first night which was fantastic and a nice surprise as we were told by the staff that this was because it was our first stay with the Residence Henri IV. However it was a little bit of a hassel packing everything up again and having to move to the room next door the following morning. The hotel itself was very good value for money, clean and had a lovely Pariesenne feel to it. The decor was typical of the period it was portraying in its name. Our Parisenne friends we very impressed with it when they came to visit as they had put relatives in other hotels within the vacinity and thought that the standard was much lower. Breakfast delivered to the room was terrific as normally you have to pay for this as room service, however at 140euro per night breakfast should have been included at no extra charge instead of the 6 euro extra.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and quaint”
Reviews.Author: chicagotrix
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the hotel. The room was small but decent for a European hotel and plenty of space for me and my husband. Our room was on the top (6th) floor and had 2 small balconies accessible through french doors. The room was clean and very romantic. It even had a small kitchenette that we didn't use but it was nice to have a refrigerator in the room. The staff at the hotel were extremely nice and very helpful. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghCitybreaker
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, couple of minutes from the Metro, about 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame. Also handy for Rue Mouffetard and in about 15 minutes you can be in the Marais. Room was a much better size than any other I've stayed in in Paris. It was a double and we each had a decent sized wardrobe, there was also plenty of drawer space and a good safe in the room. Also a small kitchenette which was great, as we could buy pastries and other treats from the local boulangerie / patisserie for breakfast! Bathroom was also a good size and spotless with a good shower. We booked online and got an early bird 40% off deal, which made it very reasonable (around Â£70 per night for the room). Otherwise I think it would have been a bit more than what we would usually plan to pay. If you can get a deal like this though I think it's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: quiltlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and can confirm all the positiv details as great location, friendly and helpful staff etc. Our room was on the 3 rd floor and we found it on the "bigger" size (17 qm) compared to lots of other rooms in Paris Hotels. We liked the little kitchenette which was kind of hidden at the entrance of the room. Bathroom was clean and of good size,too. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, but had a look on the breakfast room: not very welcoming, next to laundry with busy working dryer and washing maschine.. Two things why we canÂ´t give 5 points: no housekeeping when we came back at 4.30 p.m. on one day and strong smell of smoke at one night (this is a non smoking place).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Munster-Gal
Reviews.Content: We're just back from our 3 night stay at Hotel Residence Henri IV and were very pleased with our time there. The location is excellent, just a 5 mintue walk from Notre Dame & 2 minutes away from the Metro. Get a travel pass & use the Metro, bus & RER to get you all around Paris. The room (62) wasn't huge but it was comfortable & the shower was fine. There was AC and a small kitchenette with sink, microwave, mini fridge & 2-burner stove. Breakfast wasn't great but there is an amazing bakery down the road (Eric Kayser's) where you'll get coffee, OJ & a croissant/pastry for â‚¬6.50. I highly recommend picking up a sandwich there & having luch beside Notre Dame. There are some amazing restaurants nearby (La Maree Verte & Le Coup-Chou were our favourites) The staff at Hotel Residence Henri IV were very helpful & made reservations for us etc. They all spoke perfect English and were very knowledgable about the area. As our flight was at 7pm they kindly stored our luggage while we did our last bit of sightseeing. To sum up: a comfortable, clean hotel, great staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JohnHeritage
Reviews.Content: Prime location, well-furnished rooms & efficient staff, but expensive if you pay full price. Breakfast is cheap, and you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Residence Henri IV is trully my residence in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dummont
Reviews.Content: This January, my husband, daughter and I stayed for the 4th time at our beloved Residence Henry IV. It truly has a homey feeling. The people who work there are friendly, it is in a nice calm street but in the middle of the Latin Quarter, the apartments are small but cozy, nice and clean, and it is not overpriced in spite of the weakness of the dollar. We'll definitely be going back. My only reservation about writing a review is that I would like to keep it a secret...

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: Aussiefoursome
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children (aged 10 and 13) recently returned from Paris after staying at this delightful establishment. It is in a great location very close to Notre Dame and the Metro. The decor and ambiance are completely lovely and the room sizes (25m2) were great as we had been told to expect tiny rooms in Paris. The staff were professional, friendly and very helpful. They spoke English and were most helpful to us as both my husband and daughter became ill and needed to see a doctor. The staff arranged appointments and provided directions for us, we simply couldnt have done it so easily without them.I would have no hesitation in recommeding this hotel to anyone and should we return to Paris we would hope to be able to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: iLoooooooooooVePaRis
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It was in a wonderful location, close to many restaurants, shops, train stations and even a coin laundry! The room was comfortable and well appointed; the kitchenette was especially handy. The staff were friendly and helpful. My husband was not well when we arrived, so the concierge booked us an appointment at a local doctor. On departure, they arranged an airport shuttle for us at a much cheaper rate than a taxi cab. It was easy to get around to tourist spots from the hotel. It's a 5-minute walk to Notre Dame and you can catch a hop-on/hop-off bus called 'Les Cars Rouges' from that point as well. We highly recommend this hotel to travellers who want a restful haven to return to after busy days seeing all the sights of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - perfect price with their offer”
Reviews.Author: Gregggs
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent, quiet and stylishly furnished. The bathroom was big, the breaxfast very pleasant. We got a very good price through the offer this Hotel makes. Full price is in fact rather high.

Reviews.Title: “Harris 2 adults 2 children”
Reviews.Author: alecVancouver
Reviews.Content: Excellent location Excellent Room Excellent front desk receiption staff Excellent comminication with 14 and 11 year old children

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: annarborsmith
Reviews.Content: Ditto to all the other positive comments. The hotel was perfectly situated in a lovely part of Paris, and absolutely ideal for a family needing two rooms. The apartment for four was wonderful space for three adults and two young children, and connecting by entry (with a door to close off the stairway) to the other two-person room made it very convenient for two other family members to interact freely. However, what made the hotel exceptional was the STAFF! STAFF! STAFF! They were all genuinely warm, friendly, helpful, and responsive. The management is obviuosly doing the right hiring and training!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: prakashp23
Reviews.Content: This Nice hotel to Stay.....But dont expect too much from Kitchen...Has old Micro wave oven which works only for 15 min then gets off automatically then you need to wait for 5 min before it starts again. Overall it is good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a small family!”
Reviews.Author: Graniv
Reviews.Content: As a couple with a small child we were looking for a one-bed room alternative, with a small kitchen. This was just perfect, and the rooms just beautiful. Paris hotel rooms are normally small (you typically have to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom door), so relative to the norm, this was even quite spacious. E.g. lots of space for a crib next to our queen sized bed in the bed room. Elevator. Nice, new playground just around the corner. Not too far to walk to a very nice little zoo (our 2-year-old loved it!). Nice neighborhood, of course. We were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: La-rive
Reviews.Content: Lovely , charming, friendly, comfortable and clean hotel. In a great location, very close to 2 metro stations and walking distance from Notre Dame. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. When I return to Paris I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: KayChicago
Reviews.Content: The location of HRH IV is perfect -- on a quiet street in the busy Latin Quarter. The multilingual staff go out of their way to help. Despite the chilly weather outside, the room was warm and cozy. If you need your coffee first thing in the morning (as I do) the breakfast in the basement is a good idea; otherwise, it seems a bit dreary down there. In all other ways, HRH IV is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeonardLondon
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant helpful staff (directed us to a great restaurant round the corner) and lovely comfortable clean rooms. Even one of the cleaners we met was nice and helpful. Decorated in that old school, slightly chintzy neo-Roccoco French style â€“ not particularly my taste but what the hell, when in Rome [err..] etc. Very quiet little cul-de-sac, but only a stoneâ€™s throw from Notre Dame, Pantheon, Boulevard St Germain and all the associated action youâ€™d expect. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1006
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Henri IV. The rooms were very nice, the staff wonderful and the location couldn't be better. Having visited Paris many times, this is the first hotel I would really enjoy returning to stay in. My one suggestion for the hotel (and this is NOT a complaint), is to do a little research and have more non-smoking restaurant suggestions for the guests. Given that you are a non-smoking hotel, I think quite a few people who stay with you are probably looking for this and it would be very helpful. There are so many restuarants in Paris and it can be daunting to sort through them. All in all, a wonderful experience in a Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sanfrantraveler
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the reviews. The "apartment" rooms are a great deal. Sitting room and bedroom, nicely furnished, small balcony on a quiet street in a convenient location. I paid EUR 130 for room 32 booked at Rates to Go.com. Staff was friendly as well. Shower curtain was a little mouldy and mattress could be replaced, but these two things would not keep me from staying in this hotel again. Rue Mouftarde nearby is nice for restaurants and bars, not dominated by tourist traps like some of the streets in Saint Germain. This hotel is walking distance from Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou, Jardins du Luxembourg, Pantheon, RER station to Gare du Nord and CDG airport (station Luxembourg or Saint Michel).

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable little hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: henrybs
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from weekend break in Paris at Hotel Henri IV. The room was booked for my husband, myself and my 15 year old daughter and her friend. We loved the two nice comfortable rooms within the same apartment and the roomy bathroom. We also found it very quiet, free from street noise. We appreciated the kitchenette within the appartment. Great location, used the Autobus to get to the major sites and had great fun shopping locally for baguettes and cheese etc!! The decor was delightful and the rooms lovely and clean. There was even a lift for the older generation, although the kids loved going up and down the spiral staircase. Plenty of inviting cafÃ©s nearby. We had breakfast in the hotel on our first morning which was very pleasant and we would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Experience (Wonderful)”
Reviews.Author: tootsie1Lindfield
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 have just returned from a wonderful experience in Paris. The hotel was in a great location and the front reception staff were excellent. Very helpful considering that we lost passports and need faxing arrangements in the middle of the night to Australia. Rooms are very french. Kitchen adequate for coffee tea and light meals. Please note be very careful on Metro watch valuables on crowded trains!! Overall we had a wonderful stay and would definately go back. PattersonFamily Sydney,Australia

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel ! Can't wait to go back.....”
Reviews.Author: Fainty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of November - it was booked for 3 nights but there was a mistake with the booking and we stayed at a sister hotel at the place du Pantheon up the road. Transfer costs for this unexpected change of plan were covered by the hotel - no problem. I loved the situation - hotel is in a super area with all the sights just a short distance away. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was fab ! Comfy bed and pillows ( I always find hotel pillows most uncomfortable) A wonderful stay in a super hotel - I would highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Travellers286
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Henri IV in September, having booked on the basis of favourably Tripadvisor reviews. We were very impressed with the Henri IV. The staff were welcoming, spoke good English, and were always happy to provide assistance with our various queries or requirements during our stay. Our room was of a good size for a European hotel, light and airy, well-equipped, with an outlook across a flower filled window box to the small park which faces the hotel. The bathroom was spacious, modern and, like the room, spotlessly clean. The small kitchenette in the room was very useful, mainly for tea and coffee, but also for assembling the occasional lunch or evening meal from ingredients purchased from the numerous nearby delis. We were very happy with the location of the hotel. The immediate area hosts countless restaurants, cafes and other convenience stores, and the Maubert Metro station is just a short walk away. Notre Dame is a 10 minute walk, and it is possible to pick up the L'Open bus tours from just outside the cathedral. The hotel serves a light breakfast in a small dining area in the basement of the building, and this was included in our tariff. In hindsight, it would probably have been more enjoyable (and entertaining) sitting outside one of the nearby cafes for a coffee and croissant. We highly recommend the Henri IV as a quiet, comfortable place to stay in the midst of this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: TravelingM0m2007
Reviews.Content: We rented a two-room suite with a kitchenette for a week at the Hotel Residence Henry IV, based on other Trip Advisor reviews. Overall, we were quite pleased. We were traveling with our two- year old son, so having a separate room for him to sleep in and a kitchen to make breakfast and sometimes dinner for him was a priority for us. The bedroom and bathroom were good sized, and very clean. The kitchen was tiny (about the size of a large closet, with two little electric burners, small refrigerator, microwave and the smallest sink I've ever seen!), but it was usable and very clean; the plates/utensils were nothing fancy, but absolutely fine. The living room was definitely on the small side, but had a nice full-length window, with a small balcony offering a pleasant view of the park across the street. It also had a couch that folded down into a comfortable bed, which turned out to be very important to us, since it ended up working best for us to have our son in the bedroom (so we slept in the living room). The hotel provided a nice porta-crib (or as the Europeans call it, baby cot). At our request, they also arranged for a high chair rental for the week. Note: for any other parents who may be looking at this hotel, the little park across the street has a nice playground -- very convenient! The location is wonderful -- in the heart of the Latin Quarter. A couple of blocks away on one side is Notre Dame and Ile de la Cite. A couple of blocks away on the other side is the Pantheon and the Luxembourg Gardens, which are so lovely and include a wonderful, very large playground popular with both tourists and local families alike (you have to pay to use it, but it's worth it). The neighborhood around is quiet and friendly. During the day the local church bells chime (which I found very enjoyable). Other than that, I was astounded at how quiet it was -- there was hardly any street noise after about 7 or 8 p.m. There is a metro stop about 2 blocks away. Around the corner from the hotel is a great organic grocery store as well as a regular grocery store. At the end of the block is a local patisserie called Eric Keyser, which had really outstanding pastries and apparently was recently voted best baguette in Paris. As a result we didn't have breakfast at the hotel, except once on our last day when they delivered it to our room. It was a classic French breakfast - mostly pastry/bread and coffee/hot chocolate/tea. The service was pretty good - the hotel staff spoke English well and were good about ordering us taxis, etc. They helped me send a fax one day and posted our mail for us. We asked them to make change for us a couple of times, and they weren't always able to do it, but they were nice about it. The one disappointment was no internet access, which became important when Air France went on strike and we were stranded for a couple of extra days in Paris. The hotel has a policy of not looking things up for guests on their official computer, and we did have to spend several hours on a c\ouple of days at an Internet Cafe called Milk near the Pantheon. However, on one occasion, one of the hotel staff let my husband use his personal laptop, which was nice. That's about it! We would definitely recommend it, and would stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: htango
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the end of our honeymoon trip, so we had lots of shoppings to pack in our luggage. The room was big enough to spread all the stuff and we coud still walk in. Great location near a metro station, markets, cafes. The elevator was very small, I only could fit there with two bags and my wife had to wait. Unfortunately we couldn't get a late check-out, our flight was 11:00 p.m., but the frontdeskman kindly stored some cheese we bought into their refrigerator. Definetely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest hotel I've ever come across!”
Reviews.Author: Summers64
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel from the pictures on the website as I wanted to stay in a typically Parisian hotel in the centre of the city and was not disappointed. Only two rooms on each floor, but full of character and very comfortable. The staff were really friendly and the only drawbacks were the lack of a view over Notre Dame and a fairly meagre breakfast. The location was great, Metro very close - had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: SydneyDnd
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for the first time in October. We chose this little hotel due to its location in the Latin Quarter and from the good reviews on the trip advisor site. We weren't disappointed. It's a lovely hotel. The room was actually two rooms - a bedroom and a sitting room, plus a large bathroom and even a little kitchenette. (This is very unusual for Paris, we're told!) The furnishings were very nice and the bed comfortable. The staff were pleasant and helpful, and even gracious towards our stumbling attempts to speak French. The only downside was the fairly basic breakfast served in the basement. We'd recommend purchasing your own provisions from a nearby patisserie. There's no shortage of cafes and shops nearby including a fabulous cheese shop just around the corner. The hotel is in a quiet part of the latin quarter and walking distance to virtually everything - 5 mins to Notre Dame, 15 mins to the Louvre etc. We'd definitely recommend it and will go back again if we ever get the chance to visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Henri”
Reviews.Author: TheIrishRovers
Reviews.Content: a little gem in paris, fantastic location next to Notra dame,close to louvre, and loads of restaurants/bars on your doorstep, handy for st.michel metro and other's, make sure you dine in the piano bar on street opposite, (across from the church), hotel itself is immaculate, room was good size and modern, with fine bathroom. would definetely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Kanell
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Hotel Residence Henri IV. A charming hotel in a lovely area of Paris. The Hotel Residence Henri IV was very clean with specious rooms (that is rare in Paris), huge yummy breakfast in bed and friendly staff. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: PeeJayEe
Reviews.Content: Being in middle of Paris we anticipated yet another cramped room and were presently surprised when we found that we had a sitting room in addition to a good sized bedroom and bathroom with full bath! A bonus if we had needed it would have been stovetop and microwave.... The hotel is well-located in terms of restaurant and train access and major attractions, but at the same time is extremely quiet. And the price was great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: dobon
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with only 13 rooms. The booking-confirmation already specified our room number, which was 1. This is probably the only room on the ground floor. It is literally right behind the lobby with the windows facing into the street. We would have preferred a room on a higher floor. The room was clean and the furniture nice, but the bed a little too hard to be comfortable. We had complimentary wireless internet connection of good quality in the room. Breakfast in this hotel is the scantiest I have been served in any hotel ever. All in all this is a nice hotel in a good area, but maybe a litle overrated here, and for the price you can probably find better. In August 2007 I stayed in the similar and almost same named HÃ´tel Henri IV in 9-11 rue Saint Jacques which in my opinion is a more elegant and nicer alternative in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and surroundings”
Reviews.Author: JorgenHolm
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Superb two-room condo. Small hotel, calm and quiet. Superb front-desk service. 250 metres from Notre Dame. Perfect shopping- and dining area.

Reviews.Title: “everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: TexasTennislady
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to Paris. We found this hotel very hospitable and charmingly "European". The staff was helpful and friendly. The location was great and convenient. I definitely would recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rish22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Residence Henri IV for four nights in early September 2007 and had a wonderful time. The hotel is lovely and in a fabulous location. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast (except for our last morning when we had an early departure), as there are so many nice cafes nearby. There is also a Laundromat on the same street as the hotel and supermarkets, fruit shops and such, nearby. The staff was very friendly. I really couldn't fault the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers18
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel to be charming and well-situated, within easy reach of the Metro station. Staff were extremely helpful, gracious and very approachable with our limited knowledge of the language. The room was very comfortable and had all the facilities we would expect in a quality hotel. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend Henri IV to anyone who is looking for a quality establishment at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dobber1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a two week trip in France and it was outstanding. The location, just a few blocks from the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, Pantheon and Luxembourg Gardens, was perfect. The staff could not have been nicer or more accomodating. Our room was probably the smallest in the hotel (it was on the top floor with a slanted room line), but it was very comfortable with a small balcony and nice size bathroom. Since this is a former student hotel, the rooms include a small refrigerator, microwave and sink. We found this hotel at the last minute on eurobookings.com which required no upfront deposit or cancellation fees, and when other sites came up with no choices in this area. It is a little pricey, but not as outrageous as some.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: westcountrywalker
Reviews.Content: This was an emotional trip for me as it had been planned for my father to revisit some childhood memories before he died, but sadly he wasn't able to go. The staff were very kind and understanding; allowed us to use the suite (bedroom, bathroom, kitchenette, sitting room) that we had booked for my parents, at no extra cost. The room was beautiful, and graciously furnished and decorated. The staff were very helpful with restaurant recommendations and other information, and patient with my practising my French! Incidentally, the nearby fish restaurant 'La Criee' is well worth a visit... I left an item behind, and the staff continued to be very helpful and kind, responding promptly and courteously to emails. And my father was able to see photographs of his cherished memories before he died... I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone, and hope to return under happier circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Residence Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: CarmelgB
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff, Excellent, Excellent. I can not praise this Hotel enough, my Husband and I stayed here for 6 days in July-August 2007, arrived at hotel at 7PM, and thanks to Air France our luggage did not arrive with us. Anna-leise (in reception) was just fantastic she could not do enough for us. She called Air France for us several times, and pointed us in the right direction to but clothes while we waited and waited for luggage to arrive. She rang and rang for us and after 3 days it finally turned up. I was very disappointed with Air France's attitude but that is another story. If looking for a first class hotel at a reasonable price look no further. We had the top floor room 61 and 62 was our friends room. It was gorgeous, the balconies had a great view, and the little kitchen came in handy. Spotlessly clean. Bathroom en-suite was a great size. All in all the best stay and a big thank you to Anna leise. Carmel

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gerri_slc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location. It's easy to walk to Notre Dame (8-10 minutes), the Sorbonne (4 minutes), or Luxembourg Gardens (6-7 minutes). It's also close to the metro and the nearest cab stand is only a few minutes away. There are lots of places to eat nearby. As a bonus, the street ends at the hotel, so it's very quiet at night. As reported, the rooms are roomy, and it's nice to have a microwave, fridge and little stove in the room. We stayed in a room on the ground floor right behind the hotel desk. I think the rooms on the upper floors look cozier, but our room was a little larger than the other singles, and we never had a problem with noise from the lobby. The desk staff is the real treasure at this hotel. They are wonderful. Odile, Patrice, and Hicham are all charming and very helpful. There was never any hesitation to help us in any way at all. While they were all very professional, after 6 nights, I felt like they were also my friends. I would absolutely recommend the Hotel Residence Henri IV, and I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: lizzie_v66
Reviews.Content: Our family - grandmother, two parents and two children - stayed at this lovely hotel for four nights in August. The rooms were a good size - we had a two roomed apartment and a double room - and as requested with the hotel they were adjacent to one another. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and the stylish hotel umbrellas we borrowed to ward off Paris rain were very useful! We thoroughly enjoyed using the hotel as our base for our short time in Paris, and it was ideally located for trips by foot, metro and bus. We will definitely recommend the hotel to friends, and would stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: prairiegirl45
Reviews.Content: My sister from Toronto, Canada, myself (from Saskatoon, Canada) and my two teenage girls stayed for a week at Hotel Residence Henri IV....It was perfect for us - for many reasons 1) spacious (two rooms; one with twin beds and one with a double bed; large bathroom with tub, sitting area where we dined on baguettes, cheese and wine, mini fridge, sink and dishes; it also has the loveliest balcony; it was bright, airy, very clean, spacious for a European hotel; hotel service was excellent i.e. reception and cleaning staff; location was superb; we took the RER from CDG airport all the way to our subway stop and walked over a couple of blocks to the hotel....close to the Seine, therefore, easy walking distance to the islands and the right bank; market, Pantheon, Blvd St. Germain, Luxemborg Gardens; great wine, cheese shoppes and cafes right in the neighborhood; I would highly recommend this hotel and I will stay there again when I go back....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FremontTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Paris and England and stayed at the Residence Henri IV for 4 nights from Aug 9 to Aug 13. We are a family of five so we had one superior and one double room. They gave us both rooms on the same floor so we could close the outer door and had the whole floor to ourselves. The rooms were large and very comfortable. The hotel is very well located, only a few blocks from the Notre Dame and close to a lot of good restaurants and the metro. Another nice plus was that we had wireless access in our room. The staff were excellent, they all spoke good English and were extremely helpful. They helped us with directions, restaurant recommendations and also made dinner reservations for us. On our last night the elevator broke down and being a Sunday night it was difficult to get someone to come fix it, but since we were leaving early morning and had to get our bags down, the lady at front desk managed to get someone to come and fix it that night and called us in the morning to let us know it was fixed. She also had a pot of coffee ready for us in the morning. We had a wonderful experience at this hotel and we would certainly stay at this hotel again if we were visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Residence Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: Shelley1975
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reviews from this site and we were not disappointed. Our original concern was only that the room might be too small at 17m2 but this was not the case. We were on the third floor (with lift), had a lovely little standing terrace, a lovely spacious room that was big enough for our bed and a cot with room still to move and a lovely big bathroom with bath. It also had a kitchenette with fridge, hotplates and microwave. The staff were really helpful and friendly and we found it a central place to stay. It was in the 5th arr. and close to a lot of things. We were close to a few metro stations plus within walking distance to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. Overall we loved our room and were really happy we chose it. We would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming lovely nHotel, great location .”
Reviews.Author: GORGOS
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife,stayed at this charming romantic little hotel for ten days and we loved it.The rooms,tastefully decorated and with a veranda ,were large enough for Paris standards and cosy. The same stands for its bathrooms which overlooks a small alley and a back yard sort of garden.The hotel itself is located in the cultural center of Paris. Five minutes walk from Paris university and Polytechnic, seven minutes walk from Notre Dame and 3 minutes from Pantheon and rue Mouftar .It takes no more than half an hour walking for Jardin du Louxembourg and 15 minutes from Boulevard St Michel .The staff of the hotel ,without exception, was friendly ,polite but also highly professional .A special thanks to Mademoiselle Annoulice (If my spelling is right) for her help regarding the booking of a ballet performance and for her always warm welcoming smile. One big plus of the hotel was that it had opposite to it a bus stop where from, one could easilly and comfortably (we were never standing) access the whole Paris either by direct bus lines or by interconnections at Blv St Michel. Some of the buses run until late at night 00:30 hrs. It is worth buyng carnets of 10 billets because it comes a bit cheaper and it has the advantage that you can use the same ticket for one route regardless how many buses you have changed for the inteconnection.Next to the hotel there are two Metro stations but we only used the Metro twice because the bus sometimes was quicker and by travelling by bus we could see the whole Paris .Another hint is to buy a 5 days ticket of unlimitted travel with the bateaubus for 17 euros (1day ticket cost 13 euros).You can practically see the most important Meuseems and tour Eiffel by embarking at Notre Dame and at the same time enjoying the river Seine.The last one as far as I remember leaves at 20:30 hrs. Many restaurants both for International and French cuisine were next to the hotel. We tried the Spanish one,the Thibetian,the Indian,the Armenian , the Argentinian and the French one near Ecole Politecnique .We were very satisfied from most of them especially the Thibetian ,the Argentinian and the Spanish one.The French one was good too.It comes cheaper if you order the three course meal formule. All in all we strongly recomend this nice hotel.If the price will not be drammatically increased we will certainly stay here again in our next visit to beautifull Paris. P.S The breakfast although continental was quite satisfying considering its price.We preferred to have it in the room since the dinning room although nice and immaculately clean had no sunlight as it was at the basement of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Henry IV Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In!!!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler50
Reviews.Content: Henry IV was an experience in itself! Located on the Left Bank, it was a five minute walk from the Seine, Notre Dame, and Ile de St. Louis. Location made us feel like we were in the heart of Paris! It was near bakeries, cafes and open air markets. My husband and two teenage daughters and I fell in love with Henry IV. Staff were gracious and offered us help with even the smallest travel questions. Rooms were elegant, with high ceilings and lovely decor. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was fine for the four of us. It even had a balcony! We would never stay anywhere else in Paris. Thank you Henry IV for making our Paris stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, but practical”
Reviews.Author: Stella_Oulu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this lovely, small hotel with my boyfriend for two nights and was actually a little sad to leave so soon, since the stay was so pleasant in every respect. Since we were in Paris for only a few nights, a good location was important, and this hotel has a very nice location. It is near many of the sights and nice areas, such as the Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, St Germain de PrÃ©s, the islands and the Marais, and other sights are just a short metro trip away. There is a metro station a few blocks from the hotel, and the hotel itself is located in a quite peaceful place, at the end of a street, a few steps away from a busy street. The hotel is small, only about ten rooms, but the rooms a spacious. We had a double room, with a small French balcony and a nice, big and clean bathroom. The old style decor is perhaps not luxurious but charming and there is a kitchenette in all the rooms, which is a great plus even during a short stay. The bed was big and comfortable and the view from our small balcony was like from a movie. The only thing that could be improved in this hotel is the breakfast, which was a bit dull, especially in the downstairs breakfast room. We had our second breakfast in our room, which was much nicer, especially if you get some fresh croissants from the nearby bakery to complement the hotel breakfast. Apart from the breakfast, there is nothing to complaint about. The staff was extremely friendly and most spoke very good English, which was nice since my French is not really sufficient after the greetings. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to everyone, and especially couples and families, who want a romantic and peaceful place, where you can rest after a busy day in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient choice”
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night in room 1, which is on the ground floor. Nonetheless we slept well, since the hotel is situated in an unusally quiet street. At the same time, it is ideally located within Rive Gauche Paris. The room was large - in fact unusally large for Parisian standards - and had everything we needed. The place is spotlessly clean. The bed was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: magicbeyours
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was wonderful from the start...the front desk (Annalise) was warm and friendly. Our room was on the first floor which made it very convenient to come and go....the elevator is very old and small. Our room and bed was very comfortable--not huge sized but not tiny either. We really enjoyed the microwave, refrigerator, and burners....however no pans to use on the burners, but other dishes were provided. There is no air conditioning, but we lucked out on having pretty moderate weather and a window on the front and one in the back so we could easily get a cross breeze. We also asked for a fan which we kept the whole time. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cute parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmacita
Reviews.Content: Friendly, nice, clean hotel. More spacious than the average Paris hotel. Located in charming Latin Quarters. Walkable distance to Notre Dame and most other attractions. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DianneSheffield
Reviews.Content: Really great location - train direct from CDG airport and central. Lovely hotel, 2 rooms per floor so nice and private. Everything was fab - stay here and it will be the perfect base for your perfect Paris stay.

Reviews.Title: “All ok”
Reviews.Author: TazmoPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Henry IV for 3 reasons, the location, air conditioning and partial kitchen facilities. All was ok except space around the kitchen area was very limited. No room to prepare anything. A cafetiere to make coffee would have been a bonus. However, it was great to be able to have a full size fridge so we could buy preprepared foods that just needed heating in the microwave. The charcuteries and a closeby Champion supermarket made this easy. The staff were helpful to a limited extent - a couple were actually somewhat on the negative side, but I asked one of the night staff to book me a train ticket online and she very kindly did this. The night staff are much more responsive to requests as they have the time available. As this was my first visit to Paris I wasn't prepared for the lack of services rendered but we stayed at five hotels around France and this was general. The room was a good size, very clean and had everything we required. I would definitely stay there again. Can't comment on the breakfast but at 6 Euros it was certainly the cheapest we came across.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful staff at Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: chezontour
Reviews.Content: We had read a positive review of this hotel in the UK Observer's Top Hotels for under Â£100 in Paris, but obviously didn't know what to expect in terms of location, ambience, etc. From the outset, every member of staff was absolutely charming, and spoke good English (though we used our French as well). They allowed us to book in early as our room was ready. We had a little room on the ground floor made up for 2 adults and a small child. It was small, but beautifully furnished, and spotlessly clean. The bathroom had heated flooring, and a good shower over the bath. There was a fridge and facilities to cook, which we did not use. The bed was VERY comfortable, and despite our location behind the reception desk, reasonably quiet. The location was fantastic - about 10 mins walk to Notre Dame, and surrounded by beautiful streets and buildings, with lots of good eateries. Breakfast was simple but filling, served in a rather tiny breakfast room. We would definitely recommend the hotel, though if you are looking for a lot of space, this would not be the hotel for you. (Bear in mind that we did not see the rooms upstairs, which might be larger - worth checking.)

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: 6Quinns
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel for four nights with my husband and nine-year old twin daughters. I booked one of the apartments, which turned out to be comfortable and perfect for us. It was not spacious like an American apartment, but by European standards, it had plenty of room. There is so much to like about this hotel, I hardly know where to start. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful and never too busy for our questions. Everyone we dealt with spoke English very well so we did not have to resort to our fractured French. The neighborhood this hotel sits in is charming and quintessential left-bank . Right around the corner, about a five minute walk away, is a wonderful boulangerie, cheese shop, green grocer, wine shop and bistro. And about twice a week, there is a farmer's market here where you can buy everything from fresh fish and foie gras to table linens and jewelry. The metro station and lots of other shops are located here as well. You can easily walk to Notre Dame or the Pantheon from this hotel. Both are about a ten minute walk. The other big benefit of the location of this hotel is the street it sits on. It's a cul-de-sac with a small park on one side, so it is much quieter than you would expect from a big city hotel. I think the only weakness of this hotel is the breakfast it offers. The dining room is painfully small and the menu is very limited. Although, to be fair, they will bring your breakfast up to your room for no extra charge. But given the fact that there are so many other options for breakfast in the neighborhood, this was not a big deal for us. Overall, we had a very positive experience staying here and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Perfectly Formed”
Reviews.Author: GS_and_JS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Residence Henri Quatre for two nights to celebrate my finacee's 30th birthday. She had been to Paris before but wanted to go back on her birthday (14th) to see Bastille Day. I booked the hotel based partially on its excellent central location, partially on price and partially on the rating it has on Trip Advisor. It wasn't the cheapest 3-star on offer but it was certainly a great choice. The staff were very friendly - prior to booking I was in touch to request an early check-in and they had no problem sorting it out. On arrival the gentleman at the desk was very solicitous and spoke very good English. The four other waiting/cleaning/desk staff we saw during our stay were also very friendly and keen to help. The hotel is situated on a quiet little cul-de-sac close to the Boulevard St Germain. The area seemed relatively friendly and safe, even at night. The main thoruoghfare is lined with shops, cafes etc. We didn't sleep in on the Sunday but if we had we would have been awoken by bells from the beautiful nearby Church. The hotel lobby is small with just a desk and a little drawing room. There is also a quaint little lift that takes you up to the rooms, which are spread over 7 floors. We booked a standard double room (Number 22) which was beautifully decorated and spotless with a nice bathroom (with tub) and a little balcony overlooking the street. There was a small flat screen television showing French channels. The room was larger than expected - Parisian hotel rooms tend to be small. Unusually there was also a little kitchen-cupboard with a fridge, microwave and hob. This was of course very handy for our own food and drink and making hot drinks (as, in the continental style, there was no kettle). We didn't get to stay in it in the first night though as we were upgraded to a suite! We were told that someone was staying in our room the night before and had requested an extra night so the hotel kept them in our room and gave us the suite next door (Number 20). This was absolutely amazing, with the same facilities as above plus a full size living room with a sofa bed. The rooms were beautifully panelled with amazing moulded ceilings and there were fireplaces (not in use) and antique furniture and mirrors in both rooms. Breakfast was 6 Euro each, which we took in the room - perfect continental fare. There is no restaurant but you can take breakfast in the small ground floor drawing room if you wish. You can also order a tray of tea or coffee to be served in the room or in the drawing room. We used the residence as a staging post to visit all the main sights - Notre Dame is 10 minutes walk away, and there is a 'Batobus' service that runs up and down the Seine, picking up and dropping off passengers at the Louvre, Champs-Elysee, Tour de Eiffel, etc. 12 Euro for an adult day ticket, 6 for a child. We also used the Paris Metro system: 10 single tickets for 12 Euro. The nearest metro station is Maubert-Mutualite, a 5 minute walk away. The gentleman at the desk was able to assist us several times with times and locations for the Bastille Day celebrations. That's it! A wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: PrettyVacant
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Henry IV for 6 nights and could not have been more comfortable. Great room, and large bathroom by any standard, but in Paris it was HUGE! Also a fantastic location - 2 blocks from the Metro, daily markets, great cafes and the best bread baker in Paris (read: the world).

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: KulaCambridge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The staff were, without exception, kind and attentive. The room was quiet, romantic, private and beautiful. It couldn't have been better, really. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: e.f.l.
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, good area, helpful staff, good sized rooms with the bonus of fridge microwafe,cooker good value for money would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: momof3sweeties
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment which was very convenient with 2 small children & a baby. The location was perfect for walking to the major sights of Paris and the immediate surroundings were fun and lively. The hotel itself is quaint and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Manders1020
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Paris and my first stay at this hotel. It was just... great. Everything. Great location too. The employees at the front desk were friendly, accommodating, helpful and seemed to be genuinely invested in my friend and I having a safe, fun stay in the city. I highly recommend the continental breakfast - the breads were delicious, the coffee snaps you awake and the staff are friendly and competent. When we arrived, we were at first given a room on the ground floor. We let staff know we preferred a room upstairs and after our second night, they allowed us to move upstairs. I want to stress that the room on the first floor was very nice. It was simply a personal preference. Our room upstairs was also very comfortable, a little more spacious and more light. A cute little kitchenette that definitely comes in handy, a great shower, hair dryers, flat screen tv and a window box of geraniums. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: espressoqueen
Reviews.Content: This is truly the best of the best in Paris! After arriving hot, tired, and slightly overwhelmed by the subway system, we found the cleanest of clean rooms with a beautiful marble tub, quiet (couldn't hear any noise with the windows closed) and 2 mini-balconies that opened on either end of the suite. We had a great sleep! Situated on what we would call a cul-de-sac street, the bathroom balcony overlooked a pretty little courtyard. The staff were very polite, and there was no problem with leaving our luggage for an afternoon after we checked out. Overall, we would stay there again in a heartbeat! Our only disappointment was that it is so popular we weren't able to book a 3rd night. Highly recommend. (I would like to mention that if you only have 3 days like we did, you will find many stores and museums closed on sunday/monday; come later in the week!) Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Travelisliving
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on a recommendation from Time Out - Paris and from the candid photos and comments on Trip Advisor. It exceeded my expectations! We (3 adults and a child) stayed in # 42. The rooms were larger than expected nicely furnished and clean. The hotel is on a quiet street and within walking distance of the metro, Notre Dame, shops, cafes, etc. I walked to the market 2 blocks away- open on Tuesday and Thursdays - bought fresh produce and then had a coffee and crossiant at the nice little cafe around the corner. The staff reponsed promptly to all my questions before I arrived and was friendly and super helpful during our stay. I will stay here again! Andrea - New York, NY

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: LizBostonMA
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed our stay. Very accomodating staff who handled my many reservation changes without error and with ease. The apartment was excellent for my husband, me and our 2 young children with more than enough space. Regular rooms were spacious too for my other co-travellers. Very nice decor. Location is terrific only a few blocks from Seine and Notre Dame and not far from Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Puxun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week trip to France. Our last night was at the Hotel Residence Henri IV. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly and the room was clean and well appointed. We had a 2 room suite with mini kitchen. We used the microwave, fridge and utensils. It's probably too small for real cooking but it wasn't an issue for us because we don't do any real cooking on vacation anyways. The location near the Pantheon is great and was about a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame. There is a great bakery just around the corner. Then again, there's a great bakery around the corner virtually everywhere in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bobby'sgirl
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff: yes Clean rooms: yes Good location: yes (walkable to Notre Dame, the Seine, Ile Saint-Louis, Musee du Louvre, Place des Vosges, Centre Georges Pompidou, etc), in an area near Latin Quarter with lots of restaurants and shops

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: parisloversOslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Henri IV four days in May 2007. Excellent location, close to the Notre Dame and the islands, Rue Mouffetard (lively even when everything else in Paris was closed on a Sunday), Pantheon and St. Germain. Close to metro-stations and very central, still fairly quiet location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice and cheap breakfast (6 euro each), although we most of the mornings preferred to eat at one of the nearby bistros. Spacious room, with a little balcony with flowers and view overlooking a small garden and a central street further down. Got the hotel to book tickets at the Louvre, which resulted in no queue at all at the museum. A hotel we definitely wold like to come back to, or try one of the sister hotels. Norwegian couple, 29 and 30, 28. May 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for those who know European hotels”
Reviews.Author: lajollasurfer
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful quant hotel convienent to everything. The most important it is quiet, it is at the end of a street. The staff is friendly and the rooms a clean. The galley kitchen is great to make breakfast and to keep snacks. If this is your first trip to Europe, word of advise. Learn 5-10 French words, it shows you care about their culture. My wife and I found the French to be some of the friendliest people in Europe. Dress properly for dinner (no blue jeans) and bring your manners with you. Paris is a beautifully cultured city you will have more fun when you blend in. PS. bring your own soap, euro hotels give you a bar the size of a quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel, Centre of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Tri3
Reviews.Content: My mum & I visted Paris from 23rd - 27th April. Our stay in this hotel was perfect. I had read all the reviews and they were all really good. I had my reservations about the fridge and small cooker etc, however it was fine. We didnt make use of the facilities apart from the fridge. There is no kettle so any water you need boiled is best done in the microwave. We tried the hob to boil some water but took forever. The location is perfect. It is around 400m from the Pantheon. Notre Dame is about 600m directly down the hill. There is a big street about 500 m away - some nice shops. The hotel is at the end of a very short cul-de-sac. The staff are just the most helpful you can imagine. All speak English perfectly! We had a room on the ground floor that was just beside the reception. I was concerned that we would be woken by people coming and going through the night - but didnt hear a peep! So if you get this room, it's not as bad as you might think. Places to eat nearby - we were recommended Le Coup Coup (or something similar). From the crowd in the place we expected it to be wonderful... However it was less than so. The Rack of Lamb, was definately not a lamb - more Mutton. And it smelled like mutton. The duck was ok, as was the soup. Generally we didnt get any good evening meals. Of 3 places recommended to us 2 were pretty average and the third was ok. So make your own mind up on hotels recommendations. Nice lunch can be got at a place on the boulevard down from the Pantheon - cant remember the name but it was packed solid even at 2.30! its on the left if Pantheon is at your back - think its about the third or fourth place. Otherwise we found the Lourve and Musee D'Orsey restuarants very decent! In all I would definately recommend this hotel to people. Only draw back is there is no bar or resturaunt in the place but theres loads within a stones throw!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful visit to Paris at the Hotel Residence Henri IV.”
Reviews.Author: CrazyCanucks16
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 incredible weeks in the Hotel Residence Henri IV. The staff are wonderful. The rooms are huge (for Paris or New York for that matter). You can sleep 2 children on the pull out couch. For those days when you wish to "dine in" there is a small kitchenette. The location is fantastic (Latin quarter) walking distance to everything. Our only fear in giving to good a review is in not being able to book a room in the future. If you are going to Paris for a week or a month this is the place for you (and your kids).

Reviews.Title: “A+ for the Hotel Residence Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: JJtheScrivener
Reviews.Content: The best recommendation we could give: We will stay with them again! Fabulous location, which is paramount for us. The room was clean and larger than any we have experienced in Paris. The bathroom was large and new. I think the hotel had been recently renovated and it was pristine. The front desk was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was the only minus - However, the need thereof forced us to find charming and very tasty boulangeries close by. Finally, the price for value is as good as it gets. I recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Careful”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the booking practice of this hotel appears to be deceptive. A few days ago I was offered a "last minute" rate which I accepted and furnished my credit card details within the period required by the hotel. Their response was they were sorry but the room had already been rented. We all know that the hotels will hold a room for a definite period pending receipt of credit card details so there was no mistake. Obviously, they found someone to rent at the normal rate. I am sure the hotel is lovely but the traveler needs to be careful in dealing with them. This is an issue of honesty. My wife had warned me to look elsewhere after reading the recent report on Tripadvisor of items being stolen from a room at night. I should have listened. I am sure the manager will reply with his explanation of the "mistake." This was not a mistake! Shame, shame!!" } } | ['=

Reviews.Title: “unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjohnan
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet hotel in a great location. It was great to have a small cooking area in the room. The beds were comfortable and the balcony was a special touch. You can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff who provided superb recommendations”
Reviews.Author: BasherWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off the main Rue St Germaine with its fabulous restaurants and cafes. It sits in a quiet corner and is small and very friendly. The hotel rooms are clean and comfortable but the best aspect was the helpful staff. They provided some excellent recommendations of places to eat each evening - we would suggest trying Balzar and Bouillon Raccine as typically french restaurants with excellent food and service. Overall, a great place to stay, very convenient for Notre Dame and Ile de Cite

Reviews.Title: “A Charming and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: americantravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I very much enjoyed our 5-night stay at Residence Henri IV, and will definitely stay there again. We were very comfortable: while the hotel is small and charming, the room we had was spacious, especially for Paris (two separate rooms with beds, a kitchenette, and a large marble bathroom). There's lots of light, easy wifi, plenty of plugs, and the most wonderful staff -- the woman and two men who in turn staffed the front desk were always willing to help with a smile, giving us information about museum passes, metro access, sites, distances, taxis, location of a nearby grocery, good bakery, etc., and I even got crucial help in a wardrobe crisis. This is in stark contrast to the report we got from a friend who stayed in an upscale Paris hotel last year. Members of the housekeeping staff were also gracious, instilling a sense of security, and they consistently did a great job with the room. The location is good for sight-seeing and sleeping well. The hotel is located at the end of a short street, across from a park, so it's very quiet, but at the same time, it's only a couple of blocks from Blvd. Saint-Germain, and a few more blocks over to Blvd. Saint-Michel. There are a few tables on the lower level where they provide a small breakfast (6 euros), which we found very convenient on days when we were rushing out. The coffee was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Residence Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: dle4102
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 wonderful nights at the Hotel Henri, and found it to be excellent. We loved the small kitchenette with microwave and refrigerator and hotplate. We also loved the location which was in a wonderful neighborhood of small shops and reasturants, not touristy at all. We were close to the Metro, Notre Dame, the Seine...and within walking distance of shopping (my wifes first love) ATM's, everything you need. The staff was courteous and helpfull and always willing to help. I would strongly recomend this hotel to anyone wanting a stay in Paris in a typical Parisian neighborhood, with lots of shopping, cafe's, etc to keep you busy.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Residence Henri 4
HotelInfo.Address: 50, rue des Bernardins, 75005 Paris, France
